story:
Hi there! Meet The Little Books, an energetic indie pop duet made up of Rick Colado (RickoLus, Julius Airwave) and Robin Rütenberg (Four Families). 

Rick and Robin have been individual fixtures in Jacksonville's music scene for years and in 2013 the two started meeting to share ideas and inspirations. The result of these creative sessions is a spirited full-length  album entitled "Bridges and Empires" and the creation of The Little Books.

Actually, Rick is a wizard… in-between releasing his most recent solo adventure, Troubadour, and touring Europe in support of Radical Face, he and Robin began writing and recording sessions for their new evolving sound. In this time, Robin also released an album with Four Families. After many months, the duo's hard work finally paid off in the form of a moving debut album. For the moment, the songs nap in the belly of a slow, grumbly beast called a hard-drive.

This campaign will assist The Little Books in bringing "Bridges and Empires" to life in new, creative formats. In our immediate, analog age, we sometimes forget the significance of the relics of human touch. Printed materials, vinyl and hand-made journals are meaningful mediums that enhance the experience of music. We wish to explore and share our music this way.

TLB are involved in every inch of production. From writing to recording to mixing to artwork and design to printing. This means all the rewards from the campaign are unique, individual artifacts, made with love and ink by The Little Books (and sometimes the talented J.T. of CrookedPaw). Printed materials are made by hand in Rick's garage.

Funding The Little Books album will allow the group to invest more into future studio recordings and touring. If this campaign reaches beyond its goal, the remainder will go toward their follow-up EP recording session in Atlanta, GA at the end of April 2014.

What's Being Funded:

- Mastering the album, "Bridges and Empires"
- Cutting 300 12" vinyls
- Album packaging materials (sleeves, cardboard, download cards)
- Cost of print materials (ink, shirts, paper, screens)

For you:

12" Vinyl Record "Bridges And Empires" cover art

collage by Sarah Colado

Limited Edition Tee Shirt Design

art by Rick Colado

Limited Edition Print Set

"portraits" by Rick Colado



Thank you for checking out our campaign! If you are unable to make a contribution, but still want to show your support, please share this project with others.

xoxo, 

The Little Books


Free Demo Download: http://thelittlebooks.bandcamp.com

story:
♫ Summary

I’m James Gilmore, a singer-songwriter from southern Maine and I’m working on a new 4-song EP that will serve as my 1st ever professional studio recording. A lot of exciting opportunities have come my way in the past year and it’s the perfect time to take the next step. It’s time to create radio-ready recordings with a quality studio that I can share with radio stations and festival goers across the country. This campaign is how you can get involved in a project that’s all about pursuing dreams and the love of music!

♫ The Project

I will be recording at 1130 ft Studios in Rollinsford with some of the seacoast’s finest musicians. The expenses reflected in the goal include:

Recording

Mastering

Paying Musicians

Duplication (making physical copies)

Distribution (Amazon, iTunes, Spotify, etc).

The end result will be a 100% professional album from the recordings to the packaging. 

♫ The Perks

As a thank you to those who donate, I’ve included a variety of perks from digital downloads of the upcoming EP to a house concert! If you have a request outside of what I have listed, by all means contact me. You all have showed me more support than any musician could ask for. So thank you!

If $3000 is reached: All donations of $30 or more will receive a POSTER in addition to the perks indicated in the right column

♫ Other Ways You Can Help

Make some noise! A huge way to help the project move along is to SHARE this campaign with the IndieGogo share tools underneath the video above. Any help to get the word out is very appreciated!

story:
Short Summary

We are trying to help Ms Daniele obtain her H1-B Visa so she can continue teaching you at the Champaign School of Music. If her visa is approved, she will be able to continue teaching piano, voice and early childhood music for up to 3 years. Once the first 3 years are completed an extension can be filed for an additional 3 years.

What We Need Your Help For:

  • We need to raise $5000. This money will be used to pay for the attorney, US Government Application Fees, credit card processing and any miscellaneous fees that occur.
  • If we do not meet the $5000 goal, all money will be refunded and the application will not be made.
  • Time is running out. We only have until 11:59pm Sunday night to raise the money. At 11:59 Sunday night, if the money is not raised, we will not be able to apply for Ms Daniele's H-1B Visa. 

The Impact

Ms Daniele has been an exemplary teacher of piano, voice and, soon to be, Music Together Classes. She loves to teach and wants very much to continue teaching her students, you, at the Champaign School of Music. Additionally, being Brazilian, she brings a unique perspective to music and teaching which enriches her students'  musical and cultural education. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please contribute to this campaign to help Ms Daniele continue teaching here. If you are not able to; but could pass this on to someone who would be able to help, please do so. As always, may the Music Be With You!

DISCLAIMER: Even after raising funds and applying for Ms Daniele's H-1B Visa, we CANNOT guarantee the government will approve it. Your contribution will not be returned should the government deny the application.

story:
The Basics

What We're Up To

Hi, everyone! We’re Softly, Dear. We’re a five-piece band from Eau Claire, WI and we've been making music together for almost two years now. Our full names are Alexander Edward Adkinson, Joshua David Frederick, Tyler David Hart, Benjamin James Possi and Adelyn Rose Strei. And hey, guess what? We’re making a full-length album!

There is a lot to this story, and we’ll get to the finer details shortly, but perhaps the most important thing for you to know right now (hopefully you’ve watched the video above by this point) is that we have finished recording the album, we are incredibly happy with it so far, and we cannot wait to share it with you! 

Why We Need Your Help

While recording of the album is complete, two vital steps remain before we can call it a finished product: mixing and mastering. Recording, itself, is obviously the biggest step in the process, but mixing and mastering are far from simple or inexpensive procedures. The making of a professional-quality studio album is a difficult thing for anyone—let alone a handful of college-aged folks like us—to finance. So, we are asking for your help. Our donation goal of $3000 will pay for the recording, mixing, mastering, and release of this album—our first full-length effort. We hope to raise the necessary funds by July 13 and then take our finished product with us as we embark on a tour to the East Coast and back this coming August with our friends Adelyn Rose.

We are all very confident in the music we are making and we fully believe that you will find worthwhile any donation you make to our cause! We would greatly appreciate any and every form of assistance you can give us—be it making a monetary donation (of any amount!), spreading the word and showing this page to your family and friends, or both! Not only will you receive the satisfaction of being able to help us achieve our musical goals; you will also, if you decide to donate any amount of money, receive a reward from us at the end of this campaign. The rewards, listed on the right-hand side of this page, range from digital downloads of our single (currently streaming at the green link below) to physical copies of the album to private shows and everything in between!

We have been incredibly lucky to grow together as a band the way we have over the last two years. And we’ve been even luckier to be able to do so in such an amazing, nurturing community. Eau Claire, WI is a truly one-of-a-kind city—in our case, it’s an incredible place in which to create and witness art of all kinds. In our time here (especially this past year, during which we hosted and attended a great number of house shows), we have been witness to an amazing music & arts community that is overflowing with talent, enthusiasm, creativity, and kindness. This community (which includes you!) has welcomed, supported, and shaped us as a band. We are continually inspired by our fellow artists and endlessly thankful for all those who support us. We consider every piece of music that we release, therefore, as belonging just as much to the community—to you—as it does to us. And that will be especially true of this album if this campaign succeeds! Thanks so much for reading. We hope you will consider helping us reach our goal!

*** For a small taste of the album, you can stream its first single, "Things I Say" right here! The song was mixed by Evan Middlesworth at Pine Hollow Audio and mastered by Brian Joseph (Bon Iver, Volcano Choir) at April Base.


The Making of the Album

The Songwriting Process 

After a successful self-release of our debut EP, Portico, in June of last year, we naturally got back to work writing more songs. We took a very relaxed approach, however, as we figured it would probably take quite some time for a new batch of material to be born and to grow into a collection that we would be ready to record. As we took our time, we found that as usual, ideas slowly came to us from just about everywhere. It could start with an interesting snippet of a 45-minute-long improvised group jam; with a unique—or simply catchy—guitar, piano, vocal or bass line; with a drum pattern that caught our ears; or with an interesting melody, chord progression or set of lyrics that one of us stumbled upon alone in our room late at night. Some of the songs that came to us were also inspired by moments on tour as a band and by road trips we’ve taken across the country as friends. If there’s one thing we’ve learned, it’s that there is really no such thing as that perfect songwriting “method” or “formula". And as five people who are all extremely interested in the art of songwriting, the concept that there is no formula is exciting, because it opens up all sorts of possibilities for fresh, interesting ideas in music.

By the time this past winter began its slow departure, we had piled up quite a few ideas of our own. They were mostly loose song structures that had come to us in different ways and at different times throughout the year. We even dug up some old songs that some of us had written on our own a long time ago and put those on the table as tunes that had potential for a band arrangement and inclusion on a new album. After we considered all of our half-finished songs, we chose some of our favorites and got to work on adding more sections, parts for other instruments, and rounding out all the rough edges. We worked hard on our arrangements and we did so as a unit. After a few weeks of getting together to workshop the tunes nearly every day, we knew that we would be ready to record them soon. So, we booked a full week of studio time out at Pine Hollow Audio in Eau Claire, WI with talented engineer and producer, Evan Middlesworth. We worked with Evan in 2013 on our debut EP, Portico, and we could not have been happier with that experience. Ever since then, he has been our “go-to guy”, and we have been fortunate enough to get to know him quite well as a friend, too (which makes the studio experience that much more special).

Off to Pine Hollow!

When our recording time finally came, on April 7th, we were beyond excited to be back at Pine Hollow. We consider ourselves lucky folks every time we get the chance to be there, but we knew that these particular sessions were going to be really special. When we tracked Portico last year, we did it over a course of months, sporadically booking studio time for the few weekends that we were all available from January to April. This time, however, we did all of the recording in one eight-day period (April 7th-14th). Having made all the necessary arrangements with work and school, we had no other major obligations that week. As a result, we were able to fully immerse ourselves in the studio experience; all we had to do was focus on the music. And we feel that the “all-at-once” approach to recording suited us extremely well. From day one, there was an amazing sense of focus. We tweaked arrangements, finalized string and horn parts, and welcomed studio experimentation. The more we recorded, the more our eclectic batch of songs, in spite of all the differences between them, started to feel like one cohesive creation.

And now that we have finished recording the album, we can say with confidence that it does, indeed, possess a cohesive sound. It is certainly no coincidence, either, that we consider many of these songs to be some of our most collaborative work to-date. The cohesion between songs, therefore, is not so much a result of stylistic consistency (although there is a decent amount of that) as it is a result of the same five minds coming together to work creatively as a team—a single unit—on each of the tunes. And that is something that we feel is really special about being in a band. At its best, the democratic approach to arranging songs naturally combines the strengths, influences, and personalities of each individual group member and results in finished products that are truly unique and serve to highlight what is possible via collective and cooperative creativity. Our album is not for us to judge, but we hope that it can serve as a good example of this kind of approach to music making in action.

With A Little Help From Our Friends...

Recording this album was an incredible experience for us, but it would not have been possible without the help of certain people outside of the band. The aforementioned Evan Middlesworth, our engineer and co-producer, played an invaluable role in helping us achieve what we wanted with these songs. Our creative relationship with him has always been healthy and positive, and we feel extremely fortunate to have found a partner in someone like him so early in our “band career.” Not only does he possess incredible knowledge of sound and recording techniques (he studied Sound Design & Composition at Purdue University); his taste in music and production also aligns quite well with our own. What’s more is that he seems to know exactly where we’re trying to go with every song that we bring to the table. In light of all this, it only made sense to bring Evan on as a co-producer of this album. Being “co-producer” meant that in addition to overseeing the “technical stuff” involved with recording and engineering (microphones, recording software, all those dreaded cables), Evan also involved himself in the song arrangements themselves, occasionally suggesting certain ways of tweaking or adding to the tunes and being there if we needed him as we figured out how exactly we wanted our songs to unfold. Evan even made appearances on this album, playing lap steel guitar on two songs and helping with background vocals on two others. We cannot overstate how appreciative we are of Evan’s talent and guidance.

In addition to the help we received from Evan, we also received some crucial assistance from a handful of incredibly talented UW-Eau Claire musicians. Kris Bergh (trumpet), Hannah Kennedy (violin), Colin Marusek (trombone), Joe Niemann (trumpet) and Laura Severson (viola) all graciously agreed to take time out of their hectic schedules, come out to Pine Hollow, and play the string and horn parts that we had written for some of our songs. To put it briefly, the talent that these musicians exhibited when they came into the studio blew us away. Folks, it is no secret that the Chippewa Valley is host to an amazing amount of high-caliber musicians. But in case you ever forget that, these string and horn players (along with our own Addie Strei, who played saxophone and flute on a few of these songs) will be there to remind you of that fact whenever you happen to listen to our album. In short, we are extraordinarily thankful for their contributions to our songs and we cannot wait for you all to hear their wonderful playing!


Breakdown of Costs

Alright, you've heard our story; now let's get down to the details. Want to know exactly where your donations are going? Here's a list!

  • $2000 pays for studio time with Evan Middlesworth at Pine Hollow Audio.
  • $850 covers the cost of mixing and mastering. The album will be mixed by Evan Middlesworth at Pine Hollow and mastered by Jake Yuhas and Miles Coe (Yohuna, Mutual Benefit) at Treehouse Studio in Los Angeles! 
  • $150 pays for an album design by graphic artist Brenna Signe.

    Risks & Challenges

    Since we have finished the actual recording of the album already, this is a relatively low-risk campaign. We have planned a release date of August 7th (the first official day of our tour--we'll be at Phoenix Park!) and that is, so far, completely feasible. The only risk we can think of would be delays in mixing. The mixing process is a complicated one, as it involves lots of small tweaking and unanimous agreement between band members over said tweaks. So, slight delays are always possible. However, there have so far been no major disagreements over mixing between the five of us, so we do not expect to encounter any big road blocks in this department. 

    Parting Words

    We cannot emphasize enough how grateful we are for your support. We are all extremely excited about this album and we hope you are too! Please consider helping us reach our donation goal so that we can finish our debut album and get it out into the world! 

    Thank you in advance from Alex, Josh, Tyler, Ben and Addie!!

agreed to take time out of their hectic schedules, come out to Pine Hollow, and
play the string and horn parts that we had written for some of our songs. To
put it briefly, the talent that these musicians exhibited when they came into
the studio blew us away. Folks, it is no secret that the Chippewa Valley is
host to an amazing amount of high-caliber musicians. But in case you ever
forget that, these string and horn players (along with our own Addie Strei, who
played saxophone and flute on a few of these songs) will be there to remind you of that fact
whenever you happen to listen to our album. In short, we are extraordinarily
thankful for their contributions to our songs and we cannot wait for you all to
hear their wonderful playing!   Breakdown of Costs
Alright, you've heard our story; now let's get down to the details. Want to know exactly where your donations are going? Here's a list! 
$2000 pays for studio time with Evan Middlesworth at Pine Hollow Audio. $850 covers the cost of mixing and mastering. The album will be mixed by Evan Middlesworth at Pine Hollow and mastered by Jake Yuhas and Miles Coe (Yohuna, Mutual Benefit) at Treehouse Studio in Los Angeles!  $150 pays for an album design by graphic artist Brenna Signe.

  Risks & Challenges
Since we have finished the actual recording of the album already, this is a relatively low-risk campaign. We have planned a release date of August 7th (the first official day of our tour--we'll be at Phoenix Park!) and that is, so far, completely feasible. The only risk we can think of would be delays in mixing. The mixing process is a complicated one, as it involves lots of small tweaking and unanimous agreement between band members over said tweaks. So, slight delays are always possible. However, there have so far been no major disagreements over mixing between the five of us, so we do not expect to encounter any big road blocks in this department.   
Parting Words
We cannot emphasize enough how grateful we are for your support. We are all extremely excited about this album and we hope you are too! Please consider helping us reach our donation goal so that we can finish our debut album and get it out into the world! Thank you in advance from Alex, Josh, Tyler, Ben and Addie!!

story:
Album title: "I Shall Throw Myself Over The Falls"

This project is to finish the unfinished, lost 1999 music album by James Lien, Dave Baker, and Elzy Lindsey.

Objective: To rescue an entire lost debut album, recorded 1999-2004, from the original ADAT tapes, finish the recording, mixing and mastering of the album, and release it to the world. This album-length project was recorded over a five year span, but was "put into mothballs" by the artist shortly before hurricane Katrina hit New Orleans in 2005, and was left unfinished.

Why It's Important To Fund: Because unheard music by "new" artists should never be lost; because finishing something you've started is important in life, especially your band's only album; and because outdated technology, Hurricane Katrina, and Life can't bury this music forever!


5/8 UPDATE: THANKS TO EVERYONE WHO HAS DONATED SO FAR, IF YOU HAVEN'T YET, PLEASE CONSIDER MAKING YOUR DONATION TODAY!!!!

I JUST SOLD MY VINTAGE "MUSIC MAN" RP115 AMP, IN ORDER TO PAY FOR STUDIO TIME TO GET THESE TAPES TRANSFERRED AND THE ALBUM FINISHED. THAT AMOUNT WILL BE ADDED TO THE TOTAL HERE, AS SOON AS I HAVE THE FUNDS IN HAND.  STILL HAVE A LONG WAY TO GO TO GET THE MONEY TO HAVE THESE TAPES TRANSFERRED AND RESURRECTED. THANKS.


Crowd Fundraising is needed for the following items/services:

1) Professional data transfer and rescue/recovery of the 24-track and 32-track recordings from the ridiculously archaic and obsolete ADAT digital tape format, into a contemporary computer recording platform. This is by far the biggest technical hurdle and expense we face, and the main reason we are here asking for crowd help, to resurrect this buried "lost gem" of an album. Bottom line, we need to get this music off of these dormant and ludicrously outdated 1990's era ADAT studio tapes, and into something you can all hear. Approximately $600 needed

2) Travel costs & expenses for overdubs and final sessions, by Dave Baker (bass player, producer) with James Lien, in Asheville, NC. The three members of this band no longer live in the same city, which is ANOTHER reason why this album never got finished in New Orleans years ago, mainly on account of hurricane Katrina. So we need to get them all together again, to finish the job they never finished, and complete the last details of the recording and mixing process.  Approximately $600- $700.

4) Mixing the album, the way it was meant to be heard. Approx. $500

5) Professional mastering by Scott Craggs at Old Colony Mastering Studio in Boston Massachusetts.  Scott is one of the best mastering engineers in the country, and we have chosen him because he is also one of the most affordable to new artists.  Approximately $450-$500.

6) CD pressing, cover design, bar code, Itunes registration, etc Approximately $600-$800


ALL DONORS WILL RECEIVE:


1. Free download of the music when it's finished (late 2014-early 2015)
2. Your name listed in the CD booklet credits! Would not have happened without you!
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Three suggested levels:


$10 donation - free 192 kbps download of the music when it's finished

$25 donation - CD copy of the album + free 256k download

$50 donation (or above)  - receives CD copy of the finished album, PLUS a choice of free 256k Mp3, FLAC or lossless download, AND a free "bonus" CD of alternate takes, demos, long-lost early mixes, and other stuff.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------


The Story: The Band


James L., a lifelong musician and multi-instrumentalist, first cut his teeth as a bedroom cassette four-tracker, on his TEAC 144 in the early 1980s. For over a decade and a half, James worked as a college radio DJ on WTUL-FM, and as a music critic and journalist for the “College Music Journal,” the premier mouthpiece for college radio and so-called “Alternative music” of the 1990s. Being paid to professionally listen to bad new music in the late '90s proved to be such a bleak undertaking for him, that he decided to throw his own hat into the fray, and return to making his own original music.

Upon returning to New Orleans in 1998, James took up the guitar and piano again, and wrote a batch of songs, influenced only by the BEST of the best of what he had heard in his entire lifetime of loving and playing music. In this, he was especially influenced by his first love, the 1970s classic rock and power pop sounds of his older brother's record collection.

Friends and listeners at the time, made whispered comparisons in this music to Jeff Buckley, Big Star, Badfinger, John Lennon’s White Album period, the Raspberries, R.E.M., Gram Parsons, George Harrison, Brian Wilson, Roger McGuinn, Yo La Tengo, Liam Finn, Emmit Rhodes, and so forth.

Turning to his rhythm section friends Dave Baker and Elzy Lindsey, James formed a three piece band in 1998-1999, and took upon himself the Herculean task of producing and recording the major-scale album of his musical dreams, to suit his exhaustive sense of perfection. They may have played only a handful of gigs, but everyone who remembered this band spoke highly of them, and sensed the potential for greatness lurking somewhere in the music.



The Curse


But from the start, the new band was seemingly cursed; their troubles began practically from day one. Trapped in the netherworld between the demise of the old era of expensive recording studios and the dawn of the age of home bedroom digital recording, with a retro sound that hearkened back to the classic rock and power pop of the 1970s, there was really no place for this recording or this unique band to exist comfortably. Ahead of its time. Behind its time. Maybe a bit of both at the same time.

So the music patiently chose not to exist. Until now -- until YOU stepped in to help fund this "lost" album to be completed, and finally see the light of day!

The Recording Odyssey 1999-2005


The album recording was commenced in New Orleans in spring of 1999. Upon completion of the basic bass and drum parts by Dave and Elzy, the tapes were then lugged around by James to a dizzying array of different recording studios, over a period of five years, in a desperate search for capturing the musical ideas that James was hearing in his head.

Principal recording and tracking was done with Bruce Watson at Fat Possum Records’ Money Shot studios in Mississippi; at the legendary Jimmy Ford Clinic in New Orleans; at Word of Mouth studios, Green Street Graveyard, Buzzy Beano’s, and probably a few other crazy, fly-by-night, hole-in-the-wall studio places we can’t even remember the names of.

After countless overdubs, retakes, recuts, studio tinkering and endless rough mixes, the album STILL lingered on only in fossil form, on the archaic format of ADAT digital tapes, and STILL it wasn't finished yet. But he kept going.

Money ran out several different times, leading to long lulls in activity. A fire in a rehearsal space claimed several guitars and the vintage Fender “Vibrotone” Leslie speaker cabinet, that was to be a central part of the album’s sound. Even worse, the notebook containing all of the albums lyrics, credits, track listings, and recording session details, was stolen from a Laundromat on Magazine Street.

The thing called 9/11 happened. Hurricane Katrina happened. The original tapes were copied, recopied, and copied yet again, they were so worn out from overdubbing. Three different guitar amps gave up the ghost and died, over the course of the album’s recording.

Justifiably, the other two members of the group began to scratch their heads and wonder, if James could ever finish the darn thing, or if anyone else would ever hear this music at all -- including themselves. They began to ponder other musical endeavors.

James’ endless chase of the sounds in his head, his refusal to compromise or cut corners or settle for anything less than EXACTLY what he was hearing in his musical vision, began to make this endlessly forthcoming "debut" album look like a fool’s errand, indeed.

As ADAT digital tape became even further obsolete and the machines vanished from professional recording studios (Hurricane Katrina killed off a great many of the machines locally), it seemed that all the recording time, money, blood, sweat and tears spent on this project, was lost and would all be in vain.



The Unfinished Album

Crushed by fate, overwhelmed by the tide, the project waned. Time moved on. A sequence of disasters and triumphs followed -- hurricanes like Katrina, RIta and Isaac, babies were born, medical mishaps, evictions, recording studios closed, people moved away, that crazy thing called LIFE happened, until the band and its tiny little unfinished album -- provisionally titled "I Shall Throw Myself Over The Falls" -- was just a dim memory.

These songs and tapes from this entire album have languished unheard and undiscovered, trapped in the obsolescence of outmoded technology and crushed dreams. A box of mysterious little ADAT tapes, that was lugged from place to place, even being spared from Katrina's floodwaters, yet becoming more and more  forlorn and distant with each successive apartment move.

It's almost completely there on the tapes. It's practically done.

Like an underground version of Brian Wilson's long-lost Smile LP, only James knows what is on those tapes, but he swears to us it was very, VERY close to fruition at the point where the project finally gave up the ghost and was mothballed into suspended animation, almost a decade ago now. The money is needed to turn something that no one can hear, into something we CAN all hear, and listen to, and enjoy. 

This is a bare bones campaign to get this music living again. We are not interested in wasting money on posters or radio promotion or ridiculous ambitions to make expensive lavish videos or to tour the world. We are all about the music here.

Any money raised OVER and beyond the funding goal, will be used for paying for rental, repair or purchasing of any musical instruments and last-minute gear/equipment needed to completely finish the recording, for paying guest musicians (and there are several to be paid), or for any additional help with recording engineers, artwork, mastering, or other services we may run into down the line on this project. And if there is anything left over at the end, it will go to pay back the many previous engineers, guest musicians, technicians and many recording studios who gave so  tirelessly of themselves and worked on this shoestring budget project in the past  -- many of whom were sorely underpaid for their time and effort on the six years of recording this album back in 1999 to 2004.


Thank you for looking, and thanks for giving.

story:
Come be a part of The Freels first album! 

After many shows, more rehearsals and a handful of adventures, The Freels are going into the studio to record our first album together. We are all really excited about the experience and want to share as much as we can with you, the fans! 

It has been a pleasure sharing our music with so many of you in person. Now we want to contribute to the growing library of amazing music coming out of Newfoundland and Labrador. To make our project as awsome as possible we need your help! Your contribution will make all the difference. With the funds to record and the support of our fans we can focus on bringing our best to this project and create an album we know you will love!


There are a bunch of perks for donating and all of them let us bring the fun of The Freels to you. Pictures in the studio, B-sides, and even real live Freels!


Donations are just one way you can help us out. Spread the word so we can spread the music!


The Freels

story:
From Ben and Nathan - a case for your support

“…delightful performers, the power of their combined voices was enough to blow you away.” Libby Hansen – KCMETROPOLIS.ORG

Metropolitan Opera award winning operatic duo Gulley/Granner (aka tenors Ben Gulley and Nathan Granner) formed as an offshoot of Sony/Masterworks singing group, The American Tenors ---

That's us. We've had the fortune of doing some amazing things in our careers. Even with touring across the US and into the EU and Russia, embarking on this journey with you is just as monumental for us. 

As we have built Gulley/Granner into an company over the past two years, we have produced innovative operatic installations, given dozens of performances, both ours and custom work, and we released our first album (HYMN -- Songs of Great Faith with pianist Mark Lowrey). 

Seasons 2014-2017 on the whole is a simple three part project:

  • Benchmark Operatic Album
     - operatic arias
     - duets
     - piano quartet (an ensemble consisting of piano, violin, viola, cello)
  • Art-Pop Record
     - juxtaposition of Art-Song/Jazz/Hip-Hop
     - full 11 piece band
  • Live Showcases
     - for the purpose of touring around the globe in the 2016-17 and subsequent seasons. 

The first part of the project is to complete:

The Benchmark Album

This first part of the G/G Seasons project is a record of classical arias and duets with new arrangements specifically for Gulley/Granner and piano quartet.

We think this ensemble has just the right amount of sound. The percussive flourishes of the piano, combined with the sustained tones of the strings give a richer sound that fills out the corners of a hall as well as accentuating our voices. To us, few things are more fulfilling than singing with strings.

From the bel canto fireworks tenor duet "Ah vieni nel tuo sangue" from Rossini's Otello,  Verismo pieces like the "Siciliana" (O Lola) from Mascagni's "Cavalleria Rusticana" and Cilea's  "Lamento di Federico" this album is filled with some of the most beloved repertoire in opera history...  oh, and Nessun Dorma... some of the most challenging and rewarding tenor repertoire to sing. Lots of high notes and bang for your buck! Putting this on your stereo and turning it up will make for a thrilling ride around 435 highway, and popping this into your headphones will elevate your senses and help you slide from the Upper West Side down to Brooklyn. Wherever you are, this benchmark album will be a boon companion.

"Opera is a living art. These centuries old masterpieces have to be performed with the same excitement, vitality we bring to contemporary music or else it will disappear."

                                                                     -Gulley/Granner

We Need Your Support
To finish this recording it will take about 15,000 dollars. Those funds go to pay musicians at scale, to book the (amazing yet cost effective!) studio and get a limited pressing done.

Are there more costs? YES! But we wanted to grow this project WITH you, not simply make it for you. We talk with you, we see you and hear what you have to say about this art-form and our work and give us a chance to grow OUR community! SHARE WHAT WE ARE UP TO...PLEASE? Thanks!

A bit of a pact, a partnership, a pledge:
As we go along, creating the other parts of the Gulley/Granner Seasons 2014-2017 project, you will be right there with us sharing our victories and stories along the way.

Additionally, with our pledge to deliver, we also have some nice perks and rewards to acknowledge your support. Options range from:

  • Album acknowledgments. (HEY YOU!)
  • Individual track dedication.
    • you can have your (or loved one's) name and a brief message printed under an aria in the album art. (or "MARRY ME?" lol)
  • Signature Gulley/Granner SOCKS. Again, SOCKS!
    • we have a thing about fun socks for performances.
  • Studio visits. (COMFY COUCHES and STUDIO FOOD...THE LIFE!)
  • Signed copies of the finished record.

We will be honored to treat you specially... just as you do us.

The Impact
This is what we do. It is our career and our art-form. 

To make Seasons work, it is incredibly risky and honestly it is scary. But it is also EXCITING to be on the cusp of something that is ALREADY incredibly exciting. In getting to this point:

  • We've sung for hundreds of thousands of people
  • We've seen unfailing standing ovations and big smiles
  • We've shook tens of thousand of hands
               (AND MOST IMPORTANTLY)
  • We've listened to what folks say

From these experiences, we know we are creating something many people will love. We can go no further without you.

Support Does NOT Simply Mean Money
Contributions come in many forms, cash being one of them. There are other ways to show your support:  

  • Blogging
  • Emailing
  • Tweeting
  • Facebooking
  • Making Videos and other fun stuff (Get Crafty!!)

Getting people excited to come along this journey is a huge part of it. 

Thank you for your consideration. This is just the beginning.

Putting this on your stereo and turning it up will make for a thrilling ride around 435 highway, and popping this into your headphones will elevate your senses and help you slide from the Upper West Side down to Brooklyn. Wherever you are, this benchmark album will be a boon companion.

"Opera is a living art. These centuries old masterpieces have to be performed with the same excitement, vitality we bring to contemporary music or else it will disappear."
                                                                     -Gulley/Granner

We
Need Your SupportTo finish this recording it will take about 15,000 dollars. Those funds go to pay musicians at scale, to book the (amazing yet cost effective!) studio and get a limited pressing done.Are there more costs? YES! But we wanted to grow this project WITH you, not simply make it for you. We talk with you, we see you and hear what you have to say about this art-form and our work and give us a chance to grow OUR community! SHARE WHAT WE ARE UP TO...PLEASE? Thanks!A bit of a pact, a partnership, a pledge:As we go along, creating the other parts of the Gulley/Granner Seasons 2014-2017 project, you will be right there with us sharing our victories and stories along the way.Additionally, with our pledge to deliver, we also have some nice perks and rewards to acknowledge your support. Options range from:

Album acknowledgments. (HEY YOU!)
Individual track dedication.
you can have your (or loved one's) name and a brief message printed under an aria in the album art. (or "MARRY ME?" lol)
Signature Gulley/Granner SOCKS. Again, SOCKS!
we have a thing about fun socks for performances.
Studio visits. (COMFY COUCHES and STUDIO FOOD...THE LIFE!)
Signed copies of the finished record.
We will be honored to treat you specially... just as you do us.
The ImpactThis is what we do. It is our career and our art-form. To make Seasons work, it is incredibly risky and honestly it is scary. But it is also EXCITING to be on the cusp of something that is ALREADY incredibly exciting. In getting to this point:
We've sung for hundreds of thousands of people
We've seen unfailing standing ovations and big smiles
We've shook tens of thousand of hands
               (AND MOST IMPORTANTLY)We've listened to what folks sayFrom these experiences, we know we are creating something many people will love. We can go no further without you.
Support Does NOT Simply Mean MoneyContributions come in many forms, cash being one of them. There are other ways to show your support:  
Blogging
Emailing
Tweeting
Facebooking
Making Videos and other fun stuff (Get Crafty!!)
Getting people excited to come along this journey is a huge part of it. Thank you for your consideration. This is just the beginning.

story:
Short Summary

The NEW-Jason Marks CD-"Sam's Place" 

Old Skool Country...resurrecting some B-sides from Dwight Yoakam,The Mavericks, The Blasters, and a couple new ones from Jason Marks...bottom line-FUN country music!!!


What We Need & What You Get

We need $5750 to cover studio production and musicians...Mastering and digital distribution and ultimately CD mass production... 

Keeping it simple...donations to the campaign get a complimentary copy of the CD-Sam's Place 

Ways You Can Help

We understand some people just can't contribute, but we'd still Love your Help:

  • Help US get the word out and make some noise about this campaign.
  • Check out the easy to use the Indiegogo share tools!

That's all there is to it.

story:
Gaybraham Lincoln: The Album

The cast recordings of the historically inaccurate musical by Jared Corwin (book & lyrics), Jacob Minter (music & lyrics), and Gabriella Carr (additional material & original director).

Our musical tells the story of Abraham Lincoln's homosexual affair with would-be assassin, John Wilkes Booth, while the sexually frustrated first lady Mary Todd Lincoln finds release in the arms of General Ulysses S. Grant. 

  • We are the creators of Gaybraham Lincoln: The Musical, a raunchy examination of some of the oldest prejudices through the skewed lens of a historical comedy.
  • This campaign is to create a quality cast album of the musical, utilizing a 15-piece orchestra (strings, brass, winds, and percussion)
  • These contributions will enable us to hire a full register of actors and musicians, and a professional studio in which to record them.
  • The recording will take place on April 13th, 2014 in Ithaca, New York

What We Need & What You Get

Recording an album like this is no small task!

  • The bulk of the money will go to our musicians and recordists.  We intend to fully compensate all our performers, student and professional.  Funds will also be used to pay for studio time.  The cast album requires two recording sessions: one for the orchestra/choir, and one for the solo vocalists.  Funds will also pay for the mixing session(s) and any necessary equipment rentals, such as percussion instruments or specialized microphones.
  • If we fail to meet our goal, we will still record the album!  But unless we reach our goal, we will have to remove the orchestra and strip down to a piano/vocal album with some small instrumental additions, and depending on the amount of funding received, we may have to trim songs off of the recording process.
We have special perks for all of our contributors!  Shipping is NOT limited to the USA!
Perks include:
  • Digital Downloads or CDs of the finished album
  • Autographed Gaybraham Materials
  • Album credits
  • DVD of the premiere performance
All gifts will be shipped after the album's completion.

A Musical About What?

While it may be based in historical farce, Gaybraham Lincoln is a powerfully effective musical that touches on the enduring issues of identity, persecution, and prejudice.  Utilizing the modern style of ruthless farce tempered with topical throwbacks to the 19th century, Gaybraham Lincoln is a musical built to shock, amuse, and inspire.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, that doesn't mean you can't help...

  • Spread the word!  Share this page as well as the musical!

www.indiegogo.com/projects/gaybraham-lincoln-ca...

story:
Jeremy Jones' Next Album!

After several years, I'm finally ready to record the follow-up to my debut album, From Here On (2010).  In the meantime, I have been honing my skills as a singer-songwriter, a guitarist, and a live performer, and I have had the opportunity to collaborate with many exceptional musicians & well-known artists in the SF Bay Area & beyond.

If my debut record was influenced by my travels around the world, this new record will be about rediscovering my Louisiana roots.  The songs for the album have been heavily influenced by music from the city of New Orleans to the greater Louisiana & Deep South regions as well as by classic soul music & psychedelic rock of the 60s.  There will be 10 songs on the album, 5 of which were co-written with my long-time friend & poetic genius, Wallace LaFont, who is also a bayou native.  I have worked extremely hard at crafting & perfecting these tunes, and I am very excited about them.  Now it's time to get them on tape!  

The core band for the album will feature an all-star cast:

Mike Meagher

*Mike Meagher (bass) is a Bay Area native and is undoubtedly one of most outstanding bassists around.  He's also one of the best improvisers I've heard, and he can play any style of music you ask him to play, including the funky grooves that my songs call for.  He's a regular in Stu Allen & Mars Hotel as well as several other great Bay Area bands.   After you hear the bass lines he's throwing down on these songs, you'll be saying, "Thank you, Mr. Meagher!"

Ryan Hickey

*Ryan Hickey (keyboards) is a classically trained pianist from Philadelphia.  The first time I heard him play, my jaw dropped; he has phenomenal chops, and he can play everything from ripping blues piano to funky New Orleans style organ.  He's also a regular in Stu Allen & Mars Hotel as well as other well-known bands in the Bay Area.  It'll be honor to have such an exceptional musician like Ryan on the album!

Yonat Mayer

*Yonat Mayer (vocals) is a very soulful vocalist hailing from Milwaukee who was featured on my first album. Her voice is sweet, but powerful.  It lends itself well to these songs, and it blends very well with my own voice.  Yonat is also a talented & accomplished singer-songwriter, and I'm delighted to have her on another album!

*Apart from the core band, there will also be special guest musicians TBA!

The album will be recorded at Light Rail Studios in San Francisco in late July - early August with top recording engineers on state-of-the-art analog gear. 

The sound engineers at LRS have worked with many notable artists including Crazy Horse, David Crosby, Chris Robinson (The Black Crowes), Jon Anderson (Yes), Melvin Seals (JGB) and local favorites like Hot Buttered Rum & ALO.  

We'll be tracking 100% analog reel-to-reel tape (the old-fashioned way) on gear that has recorded albums like John Lennon's Imagine, The Eagles' Hotel California as well as live & studio records by the Grateful Dead (In fact, their tape machine was owned by Jerry Garcia himself!).  

My friends at LRS has offered me a HUGE DISCOUNT - more than half of the daily rate for the studio & engineer!   Considering their expertise & gear, this is an absolute steal!

But I cannot do this without your financial support!  

Even after all of the discounts, extreme budgeting & efficient production, to do this record properly, it will cost a minimum of $10,000.  MY GOAL is to raise HALF of this amount.   Without at least half of funds, this record will not be a possibility.  Here's how it all breaks down:

  • $4,000 - Studio/Engineer/Mixing & Mastering
  • $2,400 -  Pressing, Replication, Packaging (Vinyl & CDs)
  • $1,500 - Musician Fees
  • $1,200 - Shipping/Merch/Publishing, Platform & Distribution Fees
  • $500 - Album Art & Graphic Design
  • $400 - Tape (for analog recording)

  • TOTAL = $10,000 / 2 = $5,000 (My Baseline Goal)


Rewards!    

I have put together some fantastic rewards to give all of you in exchange for your support.  We'll have everything from digital downloads, CDs & vinyl records of the album to stickers & T-shirts with the official Jeremy Jones Band logo to guitar lessons & solo/full-band performances at your event to cover song requests that will be performed by me & posted on YouTube with a personal shout-out!


Your Support Goes a Long Way!

Every single dollar pledged will go toward the making of this record that I am SO PASSIONATE about.  With all of the above mentioned, I'm confident that it's going to be a SOLID album that will be listened to for years to come, and it will help me advance my music career forward.  Thank you for supporting music by independent artists like myself.  It really means A LOT!   

Even if you can't afford to donate money, please help share this campaign & help me reach my goal!   Thank you so much!  MUSIC CAN CHANGE THE WORLD!

Love & Light,

Jeremy Jones

story:
Short Summary

Portland Maine Soul Summit (POMSS) is a music festival in Portland, Maine, Labor Day Weekend 2014. The purpose of the festival is to bring people from different social, political and economic backgrounds together to celebrate our common love of dance music. Modeling after Winter Music Conference (WMC) in Miami Beach, FL, and Southport Weekender, UK, POMSS is a 3-Day, Multi-Venue Music Festival featuring Soulful Dance Music (Classics, Rare Grooves, Disco, Funk & Garage) and its evolution to electronic HOUSE music. The song by the O'Jays "I Love Music," inspired the theme: "Music is the healing force of the world."

Portland Maine Soul Summit will raise music education funds for children locally and around the globe. It is our goal to innovate and educate by collaborating with international professionals in the dance music industry and non-profits. Through musical performances, panel discussions and fundraising, POMSS will promote music as a means of cultural immersion, raising global awareness of the healing qualities of music. Music raises our well-being and enriches our everyday routine.

What We Need & What You Get

 

POMSS's campaign is for start-up costs. This festival is being co-produced by American Pavement, South Portland, ME and VJS Productions, Inc.

American Pavement, was founded by Kathryn Haigh, a native of Nantucket Island. She holds a BA in Anthropology from Wheaton College, Norton, MA, and is an international traveler, dancer, writer, designer, business owner and events producer in both Massachusetts and Maine

 

Victor Simonelli was Born in 1960's Brooklyn. Victor's home was full of records, and he has been surrounded with music since birth. He has worked in the dance music industry and at its legendary venues such as Studio 54, The Loft, The Paradise Garage just to mention but a few...In 1992 He forms his Productions Company VJS Productions Inc. Victor Simonelli has excelled in his skills as a remixer by doing work for such talents as: Madonna and Michael Jackson as well as gaining Major Label Credits on projects with producer Quincy Jones and heading numerous Record Labels and Sub labels: Bassline Rec, Big Big Trax, West Side Rec, Stellar Rec & Unknown Rec and traveling the world with his amazing uplifting DJ Mix sets.

United we can achieve any goals...Music is the answer and love will make it happen. Come join us to educate our youth through creativity and music, make a difference! Lets spread LOVE one beat at a time and make our Heartbeat heard!

POMSS is formally endorsed by:

Randy Muller,
Randy’s music career spans more than three decades. Randy is a graduate of CUNY’s Hunter College with a double BA in Political Science and Media Studies. He also holds a Masters degree in International Relations. He served on AIMP's Board of Directors (Association of Independent Music Publishers), ASCAP's East Coast Advisory Board, and is owner of Plaza Records. He also remains at the helm of One To One Music Publishing, Alligator Music, and Ten Thousand Songs, which administers his many copyright interests. Plaza Records' recent release, "Brooklyn House Party", features House Music heavy weights Kenny Dope, Terry Hunter, Carolyn Harding and Mike Agent X Clark among others.

Rocky Jones, label owner at the iconic DJ INTERNATIONAL and Co-founder of the 9000 member DJ Hall of Fame Group, Chicago, IL

Carolyn Harding, Legendary Vocalist and Co-Founder/CEO of
The Big Band and Tap Preservation Society, Long Island, NY

Mike Agent X Clark Detroit, MI
Like Strictly Beatdown Recordings on Facebook,
Mike has been dubbed "Detroit's Ambassador Of House" among the City's Underground Music Community..and those that know him well. This is exactly what makes The Agent X an essential DJ. With over 35 years of deejaying, the expertise and recognition from his peers is well deserved and respected. Nowadays Mike is heading along partner Sarah Townson his Record Label: Strictly Beatdown Recordings you can also hear his sets on his Weekly Online Radio shows - Afro Disiac UK (check for schedules) and Real House Radio (check the schedules).


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Initial POMSS - Event Budgeting


$1,500 registers the festival with the local, state and federal governments

$2,000 purchases necessary office equipment and bookkeeping program

$3,500 promotes POMSS and recruits artist at WMC 2014

$8,000 gets the initial marketing, sales and promotion started

$15,000 secures local venue contracts 

$20,000 seals initial artist, vendor and business contracts and riders

Contribute as little at $5 USD! 
POMSS is offering perks in the form of Promotional Mix Downloads by Internationally known DJ and Producer Victor Simonelli; Official POMSS 2014 T-Shirts; 3-day VIP passes to all music events; 3-day VIP PLUS Package to all closed events with artists, press and organizers; and Artist Portrait Packages including signed one-of-a-kind portraits of performers by artist Hannah Stone, Music and DJ career launching packages and a Private Party for 50 guests of your choice with an Internationally known DJ at POMSS 2014!

Portland Maine Soul Summit is not only a festival but represents an International Dance Music Movement to bring people from all backgrounds together to celebrate PEACE, LOVE & UNITY. This festival will also make a difference in the global community by raising funds for children around the globe to pursue music and dance as a means of cultural immersion, expression and healing.

POMSS organizers will be attending Winter Music Conference, Miami, FL in March to promote the festival and we plan to work with DJ Hall of Fame Group Radio EU and DJ International TV as well as on-line magazine and modern art site:
5 Magazine, Chicago, IL.

If the goal is not reached, the money will go to the above mentioned costs in order of importance and to getting perks to contributors. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you love the idea of POMSS, but just can’t contribute, you can still help by: spreading the word and the LOVE to the people in your life who may want to support the festival financially; by attending in 2014; or by sharing this campaign with your friends and social media contacts.

story:
One Found Sound is a new conductorless chamber orchestra in the Bay Area founded on the principles of democracy and human connection. Because we adapt the conventions of chamber music as the basis of our process, we are able to create strong bonds between our members and our audience. By removing the conductor and performing orchestral music in the spirit of chamber music, we are able to invite our audience to become actively engaged in our live performances in a way that is unique to our ensemble. Using these ideas, we strive to bring classical music to wider and more diverse audiences, as well as enrich the lives of our musicians and composers in the Bay Area. 

Funding our project will allow us to continue this work by supporting the costs of curating the rest of our inaugural season. Your support is immensely significant as it not only fosters the growth of our orchestra, but helps cultivate a new Bay Area area cultural experience for the benefit of our community.


Our Inaugural Season

Friday, February 7, 2014 - Salle Pianos, 1632C Market Street, San Francisco, CA 
Mahler - Adagietto from Symphony No. 5
Copland - Appalachian Spring (for 13 players)
Stravinsky - Pulcinella Suite


Thursday, April 24, 2014 - Salle Pianos, 1632C Market Street, San Francisco, CA 
Featuring Grammy nominated pianist Keisuke Nakagoshi


How it works:
One Found Sound breaks down the orchestral model and puts the power of decision in the hands of its members. The One Found Sound musicians propose repertoire and vote to select the program for each concert. Providing and unrestricted democratic process for our members is important in terms of empowering our musicians to increase their investment when they perform, thus creating better and more intimate listening experiences for our audiences. 

Renting and purchasing music for our performances costs a lot of money. Like, a LOT of money. The majority of donations will cover the cost of these rentals and purchases.


In addition to music expenses, your funding will help us cover recording and videography costs.
story_txt: One Found Sound is a new conductorless chamber orchestra in the Bay Area founded on the principles of democracy and human connection. Because we adapt the conventions of chamber music as the basis of our process, we are able to create strong bonds between our members and our audience. By removing the conductor and performing orchestral music in the spirit of chamber music, we are able to invite our audience to become actively engaged in our live performances in a way that is unique to our ensemble. Using these ideas, we strive to bring classical music to wider and more diverse audiences, as well as enrich the lives of our musicians and composers in the Bay Area. Funding our project will allow us to continue this work by supporting the costs of curating the rest of our inaugural season. Your support is immensely significant as it not only fosters the growth of our orchestra, but helps cultivate a new Bay Area area cultural experience for the benefit of our community. Our Inaugural SeasonFriday, February 7, 2014 - Salle Pianos, 1632C Market Street, San Francisco, CA Mahler - Adagietto from Symphony No. 5Copland - Appalachian Spring (for 13 players)Stravinsky - Pulcinella SuiteThursday, April 24, 2014 - Salle Pianos, 1632C Market Street, San Francisco, CA Featuring Grammy nominated pianist Keisuke NakagoshiHow it works:One Found Sound breaks down the orchestral model and puts the power of decision in the hands of its members. The One Found Sound musicians propose repertoire and vote to select the program for each concert. Providing and unrestricted democratic process for our members is important in terms of empowering our musicians to increase their investment when they perform, thus creating better and more intimate listening experiences for our audiences. Renting and purchasing music for our performances costs a lot of money. Like, a LOT of money. The majority of donations will cover the cost of these rentals and purchases.In addition to music expenses, your funding will help us cover recording and videography costs.

story:
WHO

Hello world, my name is Quincy Cole and I am a professional musician, producer, educator, entrepreneur, father and friend.  As the Founder and CEO of Micetyro Music, a Houston-based music production company, my objective is to:

·  Positively influence the music community

·  Educate aspiring musicians

·  Deliver breathtaking performances, and

·  Create timeless music

Understanding the challenges that come along with launching and sustaining a career in music, I realize that it is best to collaborate with other artists with the same vision and goals.  As a result, I’ve teamed up with some of Houston’s best kept secrets to watch our dreams come to fruition.

Our Micetyro family consists of fellow musicians, producers, songwriters, artists, and various technical professionals that specialize in areas including but not limited to legal, accounting, booking, marketing, media.

WHAT

My short term financial goal is to raise $25,000 which is 1/3 of my $75,000 project budget.  All donations will go towards the following:

·  Renovating and furnishing a full-service production facility for live recording

·  Production and recording costs

·  Copyright, manufacturing, and distribution costs

·  Video Equipment

Beyond the $25K mark, all contributions will go towards artist recruitment, development, and eventually national live performance touring.

WHEN

Performing professionally across the U.S. with various accomplished and renowned musicians since the age of 15, I’ve developed into an amazingly gifted and hardworking musician and performer.  For the last 3 years, I’ve been self-sustaining as a full-time musician and private instructor; after a ten year run as a certified teacher and campus-based IT technician.

Micetyro Music has been in existence since 2005!  As you can see, 9 years later, I am still working towards my goals!  Our deadline to raise $25K ends on January 31, 2014.  All things considered, by April, we will begin recording! Upon the year’s end, we should be finished with recording and find ourselves ready for the next step of this venture.  Our ultimate goal by the year 2015, is to take our show on the road and present our music to our friends, fans, and supporters!

WHERE

On any given day of the week, you can find me any member of Micetyro Music living out our purpose in the greater Houston area and surrounding areas.  We perform at various bars, clubs, lounges, festivals, sporting events, churches, weddings, and corporate events.

However, if you want to find us at any time, please feel free to visit www.micetyromusic.com. All of our social media links can be found on each artist’s webpage.

WHY

Why am I doing this?  What makes Micetyro Music so special or any different?  While most people selfishly pursue music for their own reasons, Micetyro Music is founded in the proverb, “teamwork makes the dream work”. Our slogan, “Mastering Arts with Class” is the distinctive difference between who we are, what we do, and what we represent.   

People are starving for real music!  WE WANT TO QUENCH YOUR THIRST!!!  Our compilation album (EP) and individual projects comprised of live instrumentation, groundbreaking sound and meaningful lyrics, will embody a “feel-good” spirit that will surely do the trick.  Unlike record labels, each artist will own the rights to their music and have permission to do with it as they please.  Whether they shop their music around or not, each song will be stitched and woven with elements of true authentic musicianship and artistry that is far-reaching beyond our years.

story:
Nesta's First EP

Nesta is a 5-piece reggae/funk band with an original sound that is sure to leave you feeling "blissful & irie." We started as an outfit within the Academy of Rock Music in Newport News, Virginia and have since taken our skills to the next level by writing original tunes led by the composition artistry of guitarist/vocalist Nick Wade. After years of trying to convince AoRM owner Ron Lowder to record and produce a demo for the band, Ron finally conceded, recognizing that we were ready to take the next step in our musical careers.

Nesta needs a little help to make this happen...

The recording process for any professionally produced CD is an expensive and highly involved undertaking. We are hopeful of gathering funds to help with the following costs:

  • Mixing & Mastering of all tracks
  • Professional art layout for the CD jacket
  • Cost of session horn players for selected tracks
  • Duplication of the CD

What this EP could mean for Nesta

The recording of a professionally produced 3 song EP could be a spring board for our young career and open up the doors for more performances around the Hampton Roads area. The most important thing for us, however, would be the joy of sharing our music with like-minded and peace loving individuals.

"A life is not important except for the impact it has on other lives."  - Jackie Robinson

Spread the Love!

story:
Short summary

French freelance photographer, some of you know some of my work through my facebook page (www.facebook.com/pages/Karydwen-Photography/121...), or my flickr gallery (https://www.flickr.com/photos/karydwen) or by my live pictures mostly from metal bands.

I ask for your help today, to be able to buy some new material.
My camera officially died some months ago. And as you know photography stuff are clearly expensive, and I can't buy it all by myself :( that's why I NEED YOU today. If you like my work and you want to see more and more. Help me to go back on my Moon, because photography is all I've got and one of my only way to communicate in any form I can, through live pictures, models, landscapes or everything that is inspiring me.
Any help is welcome, you no need to be rich.
If you have any questions or want extra infos ask me :)

http://karydwen.carbonmade.com/
www.flickr.com/photos/karydwen
http://0karydwen0.deviantart.com/
http://twitter.com/karydwen
http://karydwen.tumblr.com/

What I Need & What You Get

  • The money will help me to buy a new camera, probably a canon 70D wich is around 850€.
  • You will be able to get in return some of my work on postcards, posters, or be able get a shooting with me, for people or band. And for bands some live shooting.

    And you know how it works, if the goal is not reach, you will received nothing, so SPREAD THE WORD!

Other Ways You Can Help

  • If you really can't help me with money but you want to support me there is always a way to go, just share this project to the entire world and on all social media!

story:
Save the Shoegaze!

We need your help! The Shoegaze Collective Podcast is raising funds to support Plaza Midwood Community Radio. PMC Radio is a not-for-profit community radio station based out of Charlotte, North Carolina.

  • Your donation goes to support the cost of bandwidth, server space, equipment, administrative costs. underwriting, marketing, and so much more.

Other Ways You Can Help

You may also donate online by visiting: http://www.pmcradio.org/ and clicking "Donate" in the top right corner.

story:
The Helo  and  Helo Plus

                 " Most incredible device you will have on you Key Chain "

                                                 Passion and Freedom  


This is the device you cannot miss it !

    In my busy life, music gives me inspiration and so much more. "HELO" is my ideal and A music-inspired technology product which i designed but cannot wait to share with all of you. Don't Miss It! Be early Bird, you always get unbelievable Deals! 

                                 

       Please Read carefully for Helo and Helo Plus


What is "HELO"

  • A wireless blue tooth  speaker: you can simply connect to  your Cell Phone, Laptop,Ipad,Game system etc.
  • Hands-Free speaker for your incoming phone calls
  • A mp3 storage you can easily store songs to play


Bluetooth Hands-free speaker:  when you driving, you dont have to take out your phone from your bag, by simply press the Green Phone bottom on Helo, then you can start your conversation.

Carry it wherever you go:  The HELO has size of 4.6cm. It fits in your hand. It’s completely carry-able, attach to your bags or your pants or your belt  when you hiking, driving,camping, outdoor working, biking, traveling, even cooking, countless activities you can have it with you.

Stream an infinite selection of music through Bluetooth: 

The Helo can play any musics from your smart phones, tablets, laptops, game device etc which have your personal music collection.     no wires or Wi-Fi required.  

Song storage and MP3 Player : If you are not a smart phone user or dont want to carry your phone or Ipad, NO Worries, it can easily store  1000+ songs based on how big the storage card you want to put in. It supports up to 32GB FT card. you can use any Micro SD card and down load your songs. then put in The Helo and enjoy it anywhere.


How to Use:

It works via blue tooth, so you have to pair when you turn on your bluetooth on your cell phone or tablets, it ll search the Helo device and you can confirm pair it. It is very easily connected with smartphones, tablets, and laptops etc..

Upgrade your experience for all your music, videos, games and more with Helo speakers that stays with you anytime and anywhere. Since it’s already in pairing mode when you turn it on, it’s super-easy to connect Helo to your Bluetooth-enabled smartphone, tablet or other music player for big, crystal-clear sound. And once they’re connected, they’ll be friends for life. Then you can stream music, and even adjust volume and tracks right from the speaker.

Take speakerphone calls with The Helo built-in microphone.
The Helo makes taking hands-free calls easier than ever. With a built-in mic and 10M range, you can continue the conversation even when you’re not near your phone (or when you just don’t feel like holding it). 



 SPEC for HELO :
           
Dimensions: w 77 * D 85* H 46 mm
Weight: 200g 
FT Support: Up to 32 GB
Speaker output:  3W
Color Blue, Red,Green,Grey
material: Special Industrial PE
Signal-to-Noise Ratio: ≥60db
Distortion:  ≤0.1%
Battery life:  up to 4 hours
Battery Charging voltage: 5V(500mA)
Working voltage: 3.3 -- 5V
Battery charging time: 1.5-2 hours
Battery capacity: built in 600 mAh Li ion battery
Interface: Bluetooth, Micro USB,FT Support
Speaker: High Performance
Bluetooth transmission distance: 10 meters
Connection: Blue tooth 2.0+EDR
Support Format: APE FLAC WAV WMA MP3
   

                        

        
*****************************************************************************     
          What we are going to do next When our funding reaching  $10000 
          we will accomplish another mission --- For Helo Plus 

      



\What is Helo Plus?


Based on our Helo design, we will develop more functions for Helo lovers, we call it Helo Plus, and the technology has been approved by our engineering. 
  • A wireless blue tooth  speaker you can simply connect and listen to the songs from your Cell Phone, Laptop,Ipad,Game system etc
  • Hands-Free speaker for your incoming phone calls
  • A mp3 storage you can easily store songs to play

  • A Plus cellphone battery charger  the perfect, convenient charger for your cell phone

Cell Phone Charger:

          you don't need to worry about out-of -battery situation. When your phone is out of battery, you can simply charge your phone with the Helo Plus Key chain, you will get your phone for up to 2 hours usage again.  

                               
What We Need & What You Get

we've got our confidence and finally we have got our prototype done already and It is fully tested by manufacturer professional inspectors. Now, we need your confidence on our incredible design and products which we have spent more than 300 hours to  finalize and test. With your confidence, not only you get the product as we described, but you will also get your life turned on. 

we already spent our own budget to develop the Helo, so you don't have to wait three month to receive the product, For US contributors you will receive the Helo by Nov 2014. receive the Helo Plus by Jan 2015. International delivery cost about  10 more days. 

Dont miss our unique Perks! 

Risks

From our Testing and Quality control feedback, we are in confidence you will get more than you expected. In case, if there is any manufacturer production issue, we give all products A year warranty, Free replacement program !

story:
UPDATE:
We did it! Let's keep this going and see what we can do!

With all YOUR help, we did this! Our record label, POP Records, is going to be teaming up with 75orLess Records to co-release the album in vinyl, CD & digital! We will be updating each of you once production details are finalized and we will get this record into your ears!

If you want to learn more about POP Records & 75orLess Records, be sure to visit the websites after contributing: www.portofprov.com and www.75orlessrecords.com.
-------------------------------------

Gavage has been a band for one and a half years. Starting with Chris, David and Kevin making a racket in a Providence, RI basement studio. When they met John, a Michigan transplant, things began to click together. They played some shows, they made some demos, things were going well. A few months later John's friend from home Adrienne moved to town and was promptly drafted. Her saxophone allowed them the versatility needed to take diverse strands of musical influences from various eras and cram them into their punk rock funnel.





With the team in place they went from strength to strength. Bigger shows. Local press. Local notoriety. Recording an album with local legend, Jay Berndt. The eventual plan to self-release said album and set up a record label and distribution hub. Big plans. Also pins with the band's name on them.

Then they ran into a problem.

All of those very noble goals are expensive.

So, as loathe as they are to admit it, they are asking for help from you, the internet.

You will be helping to birth an independent, artist owned, artist supportive recording entity. You will also be giving a little push in getting an album the gang think you'll really like out into the world and into your hands.

Thank you (except for the pins, we totally already did that ourselves).

story:
Short Summary

Our band, Gas Station Disco, is one of the top 10 best new Breakout bands according to Touchtunes, a ranking we reached after the success of our latest record, "Port and Starboard". The main reason of our success has always been our supportive fans; we wouldn’t be where we are today without them, and we are eternally grateful for the possibilities they’ve created for us as a band. We are now getting ready to move ahead into a national tour, and we can’t do it without a reliable tour van. Our hope is to raise money to purchase a tour van! 

Gas Station Disco was founded in 2010 in Pottsville, PA. Our goal was to offer a new, special, simple type of music for our audience, who kept giving us more reasons to live up to their expectations show after show. Our fans are our main motivation, and we know they are the reason we’ve made it as far as we have. Now we want to reach out to them, as well as new listeners, to help us make the next step. There’s just one technical limitation holding us back from fulfilling our destiny.

Why We Need Your Help

We are seeking $10,000 to pay for a reliable tour van so that we can make it around the country to play in more places than we’ve ever been able to before. The truck we have now has served us well for years, but it’s given us everything it has. A new van will be the investment we need to continue leveraging our growing success as far as it can go. It could be the single defining factor that makes the difference between our band making it big, or dying just before we were really able to take off. We don’t want that to happen, and we want to reward everyone who has supported our dreams along the way.

We’d like to offer as many incentives as possible for those who are able to donate the money we will need to make this happen. The funds gathered from this campaign will be used to purchase one of the suitable vans we’ve already scouted,and go towards letting the world know that Gas Station Disco exists. We view touring as the absolute best way to really get in touch with fans, and reach out beyond the limits of just recordings of our music into the real world of performance. The van is what will make that possible. 

Tell Your Friends

We’d like to serve as an inspiration for other aspiring musicians to get out there and release their music to the world through the crowdfunding model. We believe we’ve barely tapped the surface of all the people who will love the music we bring into the world, and our upcoming tour might be the door that gets them interested in what we produce. Tell your friends to contribute so we can promote it to the world. Sharing this campaign on your social media profile is just as valuable to us as an actual financial pledge.

We are also having a contest called "Find A Van & Instagram". How it works is you find a 15 passenger van in your travels and you take a picture of it and include details about the van in the description such as location, phone #, etc and if we end up purchasing a van that you found, we'll give you $100. Get snapping!

Thank You again for all your support.

story:
Hello and Welcome to the beginning of something very special!

My name is Tony Banks. I'm am LGBT hip-hop recording artist trying to pull off something that hasn't been done by anyone probably in the history of lgbt entertainment. 
On top of releasing my upcoming EP "Chocolate Cake" 

I'm also releasing not one, not two but THREE music videos!!
All before we say goodbye to 2014 and I need your help!


The goal is 3 music videos to be shot in 3 different locations

First: Boston

This video is a simple 2 hour shoot for a fun one verse song titled "Touch Me" produced by Kitt Holemann
The vision and exciting part will be the 9 piece band and studio set up that will be required for this video. Quirky and Fun and keywords for this production inspired by the world famous Roots Band

Second: New York City

Now we are getting a little more into concept, location, and production hours. This video is in tribute to the classic hip-hop video era as is the song "Old School Love". Throwback to the backyard dance contest, electric slide, DJ and an MC, family and friends. 
This video will require multiple locations and the help of choreographers, dancers, family and friends to pull off just right. I've hired popular NYC videographer RED to co-direct this video. She is an amazing cinematographer and also a member of the LGBT community. 
REDNYC1979
Real NYC hip-hop flava will be used for this video and as a Brooklyn/Queens Native I'm very excited about this project.

Third: Los Angeles

That's right! We are traveling to LA for this video to work with super dope videographer and director Gordon Cowie and his team
http://www.gordoncowie.com
This will be our biggest production of the three. For the song and title track of the EP "Whip it (Chocolate Cake)". 
We are working on cool locations, props, wardrobe, dancers, extras! It's going to be so cool and so much fun. 
Attempting to do these three projects takes proper planning, a great team of people and even more important help from someone  like you.

We are looking to reach a goal of $4500 to create all 3 music videos. That includes locations, cast, crew, prop rental and any additional equipment needed. 
I am looking forward to putting all my creative energy into something that I have been dreaming about for so long. 
Your donation is greatly appreciated and needed. Check out the perks and pick your pleasure. 
Lets GO!
