story:
What is this all about?

Original and unique music, producing my first album  .


I’ve been composing and recording my own music for many years, while doing an abundance of other creative projects in TV, Film and stage. I've realized that it's time to go back to my origins and put all my emphasis on music again. (I'm a graduate of Rimon school of jazz and contemporary music in Israel, and after graduation I spent some time in Boston, working with Berkley graduates.)


  I have 15 musical pieces waiting to be professionally produced and heard by others and not only by my great and loving friends and family. It's time for this music to come out of the drawer.   Luckily I was recently introduced to Shai Lowenstein, a multi talented music producer, involved these days in some of the most interesting musical projects around, here in  Israel.  


Some of his work is available here:


http://talyaeliav.bandcamp.com/


http://quetevmeriri.bandcamp.com/


We immediately bonded and made this first piece ( http://soundcloud.com/dalit-ziv/sati-demo2-2 ), to test how we feel about working with each other for the first time. Well, it felt great. Both of us got extremely excited about the possibility of producing my first album together.


However, we need your help to make this.   I’m sure that it is going to be a great, one of a kind album! 


A few more details to share:

I call it “Suggestions to the Unconscious."   I was digging into my unconscious in the last two years, to find some answers about my life. Much imagery came out of this fascinating journey, which has become parts of these musical pieces.   But beyond all these stories and words, I’m talking about some great innovative music -- unique, emotional and very sincere -- creating its own genre. A music that needs to be shared and heard. A music of its own right, deserving the exposure, finally seeing the light of day.

Recording an album is expensive!

We need the funds for renting a recording studio and pay for musicians to come  and record the music with us. We need to rent equipment, pay for technicians,  final mastering, etc.   The encounter between me and Shai is still very fresh, the momentum has  already begun. Recording at the studio will make it blossom…


What We Need

Musicians, filmmakers, painters, and all sorts of artists put so much effort, talent, love, time and money for things that don’t give money back. Especially those  independent, free spirited ones… Unfortunately for most of the time, it is indeed, a non- cash cow, so we need financial help. It’s part of this complex game that we’re  trying to play in this amazing world of ours!  


We need any help you can afford. We’ll appreciate each dollar that you can  spare.  

Other Ways You Can Help

Please forward this mail to anyone who appreciates music and supports art and culture. Please be creative and thoughtful about that.  


Thank You for your time and donation! It means a lot to me.


* A special thank you to Amnon Winner for his beautiful blue picture of mine. He is a talented artist, here you can see his amazing work 

http://cafe.themarker.com/user/65626/


תודה רבה
story_txt:
What is this all about?
Original and unique music, producing my first album  .

 I’ve been composing and recording my own music for many years, while doing an abundance of other creative projects in TV, Film and stage. I've realized that it's time to go back to my origins and put all my emphasis on music again. (I'm a graduate of Rimon school of jazz and contemporary music in Israel, and after graduation I spent some time in Boston, working with Berkley graduates.)

  I have 15 musical pieces waiting to be professionally produced and heard by others and not only by my great and loving friends and family. It's time for this music to come out of the drawer.   Luckily I was recently introduced to Shai Lowenstein, a multi talented music producer, involved these days in some of the most interesting musical projects around, here in  Israel.  

Some of his work is available here:

http://talyaeliav.bandcamp.com/

http://quetevmeriri.bandcamp.com/

We immediately bonded and made this first piece ( http://soundcloud.com/dalit-ziv/sati-demo2-2 ), to test how we feel about working with each other for the first time. Well, it felt great. Both of us got extremely excited about the possibility of producing my first album together. 

However, we need your help to make this.   I’m sure that it is going to be a great, one of a kind album! 


A few more details to share:
I call it “Suggestions to the Unconscious."   I was digging into my unconscious in the last two years, to find some answers about my life. Much imagery came out of this fascinating journey, which has become parts of these musical pieces.   But beyond all these stories and words, I’m talking about some great innovative music -- unique, emotional and very sincere -- creating its own genre. A music that needs to be shared and heard. A music of its own right, deserving the exposure, finally seeing the light of day. 

Recording an album is expensive!
We need the funds for renting a recording studio and pay for musicians to come  and record the music with us. We need to rent equipment, pay for technicians,  final mastering, etc.   The encounter between me and Shai is still very fresh, the momentum has  already begun. Recording at the studio will make it blossom…


What We Need 

Musicians, filmmakers, painters, and all sorts of artists put so much effort, talent, love, time and money for things that don’t give money back. Especially those  independent, free spirited ones… Unfortunately for most of the time, it is indeed, a non- cash cow, so we need financial help. It’s part of this complex game that we’re  trying to play in this amazing world of ours!  

We need any help you can afford. We’ll appreciate each dollar that you can  spare.  
 Other Ways You Can Help

Please forward this mail to anyone who appreciates music and supports art and culture. Please be creative and thoughtful about that.  

Thank You for your time and donation! It means a lot to me.

http://cafe.themarker.com/user/65626/

תודה רבה

story:
Short Summary  

With the new record ready to release, Alabaster gets ready for the adventure of a life time.  They are packing their bags and making their dream become a reality.  

fAlabaster is a band of six that is no stranger to hard work and perserverance! A "do-it-yourself" band, they have been creating their own music, art, websites, marketing, promotion, hype, and sometimes even clothing and instruments, for many years.  Their passion is music. The energy they put into creating and giving themselves to their fans, and the response they get in return, is what keeps them going.  

Alabaster has toured before but has had to rely on someone else for transportation.  They are reaching out to you now to help them buy a van of their own so that they can deliver their music across the country whenever they want!  

What We Need & What You Get

Although a tour bus would be nice, it's much too large and expensive. Alabaster is very familiar with life on the road and has travled and slept under some very interesting circumstances.  Alabaster is now interested in a 12 - 15 passanger van.  This would allow enough room for sleeping, luggage, and gear and would eliminate the need for a trailer.  A van this size can cost anywhere between $8,000 - $10,000 depending on miles and condition.  

Howvever, the cost of renting one of an entire tour is very expensive:

Van: $700/wk
Gas: $200/day + $0.30/mi
Insurance: $200/wk
Hotel: $70/night

Clearly renting is not the cheapest way to go.  However, with your help Alabaster would be able to own their own van and buy their own insurance, eliminating extra expenses!  

The Impact

There is almost nothing Alabaster loves more than being out on the road; exposing their music to all that will listen.  They love meeting new people, seeing new places, and playing with new bands all over the country.  Because they don't own their own van, they cannot simply plan a tour whenever they want, but must consider a lot of expences.  There are, of course, expences that will still exist, but you can truly help them eliminate a lot of them and provide them with the security of their own property.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that not everyone has the money to contribute.  Anything helps, but if you truly cannot contribute, then please help Alabaster by spreading the word.  Post this on all your social media sites and tell all your friends!! Thank you so much!!

story:
Short Summary

Hey everyone, my name is Lucas.  I'm an aspiring musician inspired by all the amazing people around me.  I have the distinct privilege of getting to hang out with musicians who play for the love of music.  I recently started playing my guitar and taking learning very seriously.  For the past two months I've been glued to my instrument.  Recently I went on a camping trip with a bunch of other people, to a place where integrity is valued over everything except sharing music and love.  During that camping trip, I placed my guitar in a friends "instrutent."  A closely guarded tent meant for housing instruments from the elements when they weren't being used.  Sadly, my guitar was taken and hasn't been returned.  It's been a week, and almost all hope for finding the guitar is gone, and with it my ability to make music.

This campaign is important to me because my guitar has been such a huge source of inspiration and happiness since I started playing.  I've always written songs and poetry and wanted so badly to put music to those words, and had finally broken through and began writing and being able to play original songs.  I want that back in my life so bad, unfortunately I don't have the money to replace the guitar, which is why I'm asking for your generosity. 

What you'll be helping me do by contributing is to be able to share music with others, to jam on a starry night with a violin player and a banjo picker.  You'll be giving me my inspiration back.

What I Need & What You Get

I am asking for $800 to cover the cost of the guitar and all the necessary accessories I was working with including a strap, a case, a tuner, and a capo (plus campaign fee's.)  I haven't picked the model of guitar because I need to go to a music store and put my hands on a few before I pick what I want.  I'd preferably like a Martin. 

Perks:
I'll be doing a bunch of different perks.  From personal thank you cards sent directly to your email or home address, all the way up to writing a song just for you and if you are feeling extra generous, a personal fire show!


Other ways to help:
If you can't contribute, but would like to help somehow, I need the following things that you might have laying around the house collecting dust:
Chord books/song books with tablature
Extra strings size 12
Amplifier and cords
Pics
Any kind of board that can give me relay/distortion while playing

story:
This is Acid 2

With the increasing difficulty in 2014 to disseminate great music, we've decided to hit the streets on our own and attempt to raise enough money grassroots to fund our second LP COMPLETELY without corporate interference.  After the onslaught of offers from literally every single major label in the business we have decided that the best route to take is the one we believe in the most...ourselves.

What We Need & What You Get

Here are the details:

  • We are attempting to raise the modest sum of $10,000
  • All proceeds will go to the following:
  • Physical pressing of limited vinyl
  • Mastering of ALREADY RECORDED second LP
  • Press agency
  • Radio promotion
  • Tour support
  • Video production cost
  • Tshirts and other merchandise

We Need You

This second release is coming on the heels of our popular debut.  However, all of our collective resources are beyond tapped.  We have already put everything we have into the recording and the general expense of keeping Acid up and running. Plus, Coors Light doesnt come cheap in NJ these days.

We've done the hardest part, now its just a matter of funding to release it into the world.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please keep up with us in our various residences on the web:

https://www.facebook.com/AcidHQ

http://havesomeacid.bandcamp.com/

  • Even if you cant help us with some $$$ please spread the word and come see us when we are in a town near you.

story:
Famed LA director/producer Constantin Preda has agreed to direct the most B.A. music video ever created. But we need you to make it possible.

This would cover costumes, location expenses, and our nefarious drug habits to make the Moonmen From Mars the most prolific, internet-famous band in the world. The song is "Reanimator" and will be released at the start of the year.

The song is "Reanimator" and will be released at the start of the year.

story:
Have you ever known somebody who was so dang good at something that you just wished they could make a living from it?  Well, that's how I feel about my music, and hopefully some of you do, too.  I believe that I am an excellent songwriter, and that music is not just the most valuable application of my energy toward the world, but the only valid one.  Perhaps I've painted your house--or the house of someone you know--in the last seven years.  If so, you know that I was quite a good house painter, but that it did not make me happy.  At any rate, the path I was on brought me to a point of utter depression and despair.  I was doing the wrong thing with my energy.  My path brought me to a crossroads.  It's time for me to do the right thing now.  It's time for me to make music my absolute imperative.  I was given a very sacred gift, and now I have to pay it forward.

Of course, this will not be easy.  My plan is to travel the western US, earning my keep (and hopefully enough money to pay for the recording of the next Kentucky Nightmare album) by performing on the street.  I also hope to make new connections, meet new people, have new experiences to write songs about, and hone my craft.  To accomplish this goal, I'm going to need some help.

I'm asking for $700 in donations.  This money will pay for transportation costs (not just inter-city or inter-state travel, but even intra-city buses and taxis), clothing, guitar strings, food, shelter, and keeping my cell phone turned on, so that I can communicate with hosts, navigate new cities, and keep you all informed of the ups and downs of my adventure.

Along this path, I hope to move as many people in as many places as possible with sweet, sweet music.  Not only that, but I plan to write a bunch of new songs along my adventure, and write a book about all the places I've seen, people I've met, and experiences I've had along my journey.  I hope to inspire more people to follow their bliss--to escape the rat race and explore their full potential.  After all, I'm not the only passionate, capable artist out there.  Not by a long shot!

This journey will not be easy.  There will be many nights spent in dangerous locations.  There will be countless unknowns, including how much money I will make at any given time and place, or if I will make any money at all.  I will have to perform for a lot of drunk and volatile people, because that's where the money is when it's there for the gettin'.  I will have to explore unfamiliar territory with an open mind and heart, but also a watchful eye for danger.  I have already given up all of my material possessions except what will fit in a backpack and a guitar case.  And I have no illusions about how treacherous a world this is.  This is a danger that I accept and embrace.  The imperative of bringing my music to the world can no longer be ignored at the cost of my financial and emotional stability.  If I can paint an entire two-story, 4,000 sq. ft. house exterior by myself, I can handle these dangers.  Those of you who know me know that I am fearless and determined.

Even if you can't contribute personally, perhaps you know someone else who is passionate about art or music and who has some disposable income who might be.  You might not even know that you know such a person.  So please, even if you can't contribute, tell your other friends about what your amazing friend Simon P. Moore decided to do with his energy.  Heck, you might even inspire someone else to find their true calling as well!

story:
ALHAMBRA GOES TO BRAZIL

ALHAMBRA performs the rhythmic, haunting music of Spain, the Balkans, North Africa and Israel. www.alhambragroup.com


With your help,  Alhambra will make their debut at the Fifth Annual Kleztival - Jewish Music Festival in  São Paulo, Brazil.   This campaign is intended to raise the funds necessary for these five highly skilled musicians to travel to the festival.  Alhambra performs Sephardi music worldwide.  The group is comprised of five internationally recognized musicians devoted to keeping this treasure trove of rarely heard music and history alive.  Though the Kleztival in São Paulo has presented primarily Klezmer and Eastern European Jewish Music, the Sephardic Jewish community came to Brazil in the 16th century, when the Inquisition reached Portugal.  The first synagogue in the Americas was established in Recife in 1636.  Today, Brazil has the 9th largest Jewish community in the world and it is estimated that at least 17 million Brazilians have Sephardic Jewish ancestry.  Alhambra seeks to bring some of the music of Brazil back to Brazilians, sung in the language of their ancestors, Ladino. 

The cost of travel is steep but the honor is great.The festival will pay for the group’s lodging, food and transportation within Brazil but we MUST raise money to pay for airline tickets and performers’ fees.  

YOUR CONTRIBUTION IS TAX DEDUCTIBLE. YOU WILL RECEIVE A RECEIPT WHEN YOU COMPLETE YOUR TRANSACTION. 

THE HISTORY OF ALHAMBRA

Alhambra was founded by Dr. Isabelle Ganz in 1981.  Based in New York, the ensemble has  toured Andalusia, the British Isles (including London’s Purcell Room and Almeida Theatre), Quebec, Bogota, performed at the Quincentennial Celebration in Istanbul, The First International Festival of Jewish Art Music in Vilnius, Lithuania, in San Juan, Puerto Rico, and at colleges, community centers and folk festivals throughout the U.S.  They have appeared in Merkin Hall, Weill Recital Hall, for the World Music Institute, and the Jewish Museum in New York, the Skirball Cultural Center in LosAngeles, the Ordway Theater in St. Paul, the Rothko Chapel in Houston, Smith College, Hunter College, and the Eastman School of Music among many other venues.  The ensemble won first prize in the Jewish performing arts competition and was a finalist in the concert artists’ guild competition, both held in New York.  Three CD’s of Judeo-Spanish music recorded by Alhambra are available for sale. www.alhambragroup.com               
THE MEMBERS OF ALHAMBRA
ALHAMBRA’S virtuoso performers create exciting arrangements of Judeo-Spanish wedding music, love songs, and instrumental dances on the oud, quanun (trapezoidal zither), nay (ancient vertical flute), dumbek (middle-eastern drum) and shawm. 



ISABELLE GANZ


An international performing and recording artists and one of the pioneers in the performance of Sephardic music, ISABELLE GANZ and her New York-based ensemble, ALHAMBRA, have produced three CDs of Judeo-Spanish music.  Her 1980 recording, with THE BROKEN CONSORT, was one of the earliest made in the field. In 1997 Ganz received a Fulbright Grant to research Sephardic music at the Jewish Music Research Centre of Hebrew University and to teach Voice and Contemporary Music at the Rubin Academy of Music and Dance in Jerusalem.  She received a Solo Recitalist Grant from the National Endowment for the Arts for the 1992-93 season.  Ms. Ganz has appeared as vocal soloist with symphony orchestras and chamber ensembles throughout the world, including the Seattle Symphony, the Brooklyn Philharmonic, the Portland, Maine Symphony and the Slovak Radio Orchestra.  She has premiered numerous works, including Ryoanji, a work composed for her and for percussionist Michael Pugliese by John Cage, and recorded by them for MODE RECORDS.

Ganz has performed in Milan, Amsterdam, Paris, Tel Aviv, Jerusalem, and in England, Germany, Luxembourg, Canada and throughout the U.S. She holds a Doctor of Musical Arts degree in Voice and Music Literature from the Eastman School of Music, where she was a student of the late Jan DeGaetani. She has been a Cantorial Soloist in synagogues, both Reform and Conservative, in Munich, Amsterdam, Canada and the U.S.  As a composer, Ms. Ganz has been published by Boosey and Hawkes, Transcontinental Music Publishers and Shalshelet.  She has recorded for Mode, Leonarda, Master Musicians Collective, Spectrum, Opus One, Tecnosaga (Songs of the Gershwins) Prestige/International, Global Village Music and Aulos/Koch/Schwann. Ms. Ganz is listed in the International Who’s Who in Music.

ELLIOT Z. LEVINE                                                  

The baritone for the Western Wind Ensemble since its inception in 1969, ELLIOT Z. LEVINE has appeared as a soloist with such groups as Musica Sacra, The Rome Opera, La Fenice, The Mannes Camerata, Music at Ascension, The Ensemble for Early Music and the Folger Consort. He received his M.M. degree from the Manhattan School of Music and has studied conducting with Robert Hickok and composition with Robert Starer at Brooklyn College. He has been awarded five Meet-the-Composer Grants and has been composer-in-residence at the Church of St. Thomas More in New York . For many year he has been a conductor and coach at Western Wind workshops at such institutions as Dartmouth College , Smith College, the University of Massachusetts, and at ACDA choral conferences throughout the U.S. As a composer, Mr. Levine is published by Harold Flammer, Inc., Willis Music Co. and by Shadow Press. He is a Cantorial Soloist at Temple Emanuel of Great Neck.

                                                                RAMI EL AASSER


Percussionist RAMI EL AASSER performs worldwide on middle-eastern instruments such as the tabla, darbukah, riq (tamborine), def (frame drum), and bendir.  He has studied, performed and recorded with many groups and several percussion masters including Anistar, Raquy Danziger, Said el Artists, Hamish Henkish and Ashraf Essam el Din in Egypt, the Radyo Istanbul Orkestra and the Cafe Artesia Ensemble.  Mr. El Aasser studied at the Gallatin School at New York University and received B.S. degrees in both Music Performance and International Studies from Northwestern University.

MARGO GEZAIRLIAN GRIB

Early Music America Magazine wrote: “If one performer deserves special note, it is MARGO GEZAIRLIAN GRIB, whose unique voice is perfect for these songs” in its review of the recording Music in the Land of Three Faiths.  Grib was a soloist for the recording of Einstein on the Beach by Philip Glass and Robert Wilson for Sony Classics and toured with that production to opera houses around the world, including BAM, Opera Bobigny in Paris, The Liceu in Barcelona, the Melbourne Opera House and the McCarter Theatre.  Ms Grib has performed with many prominent early music ensembles such as New York’s Ensemble for Early Music, the New York Collegium and The Ivory Consort, and at festivals such as the Indianapolis Early Music Festival and the Cloisters and the Bloomington Early Music Festival.  Ms. Grib is artistic director of The Alba Consort, which has performed at the Academy of Ancient Music, Bargemusic, The Greene Space and Early Music Now.  The group was also featured on CUNY TV and was selected for Chamber Music America’s 2014 conference showcase.

Ms Grib’s other recordings include Music of Medieval Love for EEM, Jesus Blood Never Saved Me Yet by Gavin Briers with Tom Waits, and for the film score of Kundun.  Grib has performed on WQXR FM and WNPR and sung choral works at Carnegie Hall and Lincoln Center.  Under the direction of playwright David Mamet, Ms. Grib was a founding member of the Atlantic Theatre Company where she performed in The Cider House Rules directed by Tom Hulce.  Her extensive theatre resume also includes performances at the Goodman Theatre of Chicago with the London Shakespeare Company and at the Lincoln Center Theater.

                                                                     CARLO VALTE 


CARLO VALTE is an active performer and teaching artist based in New York City, engaging audiences with music ancient and new.  His varied programs are a blend of classical traditions of both the East and the West with universal connections.  Known for his rhythmic vitality, he has performed in numerous venues, including Alice Tully Hall, Weill Recital Hall, L’Auditori de Barcelona and the Metropolitan Museum of Art in NYC.  He is the Oudist for the several ensembles including Alba, Adufera, Compass and Sendebar.  He performed with Hesperus on classical guitar, oud and percussion for the live music with silent film project The Golem.

Mr Valte’s education began on Guitar and Bandurria with C.O.S. conductor Michael Dada.  He received Bachelor of Science and Master of Music degrees from the Mannes College of Music, where he was a student of Frederic Hand.  He also studied Jazz Guitar and arranging with Howard Morgen.  Mr Valte’s interest in Medieval and Middle Eastern music led him to study the Oud with Simon Shaheen in New York and Nasser Houari in Morocco.  Volte recorded for One Soul Records, Vienna Modern Masters and New York Collegium.  He is a faculty member of Mannes College of Music’s Prep Department where he teaches Classical Guitar, Bass Guitar, Ear Training and Theory.
story_txt:
ALHAMBRA GOES TO BRAZIL
ALHAMBRA performs the rhythmic, haunting music of Spain, the Balkans, North Africa and Israel. www.alhambragroup.com



With your help,  Alhambra will make their debut at the Fifth Annual Kleztival - Jewish Music Festival in  São Paulo, Brazil.   This campaign is intended to raise the funds necessary for these five highly skilled musicians to travel to the festival.  Alhambra performs Sephardi music worldwide.  The group is comprised of five internationally recognized musicians devoted to keeping this treasure trove of rarely heard music and history alive.  Though the Kleztival in São Paulo has presented primarily Klezmer and Eastern European Jewish Music, the Sephardic Jewish community came to Brazil in the 16th century, when the Inquisition reached Portugal.  The first synagogue in the Americas was established in Recife in 1636.  Today, Brazil has the 9th largest Jewish community in the world and it is estimated that at least 17 million Brazilians have Sephardic Jewish ancestry.  Alhambra seeks to bring some of the music of Brazil back to Brazilians, sung in the language of their ancestors, Ladino. 
The cost of travel is steep but the honor is great.The
festival will pay for the group’s lodging, food and transportation within
Brazil but we MUST raise money to pay for airline tickets and performers’
fees.  


YOUR CONTRIBUTION IS TAX
DEDUCTIBLE. YOU WILL RECEIVE A RECEIPT WHEN YOU COMPLETE YOUR TRANSACTION. 


THE HISTORY OF ALHAMBRA



Alhambra was founded by Dr. Isabelle Ganz in 1981.  Based in New York, the ensemble has  toured Andalusia, the British Isles (including London’s Purcell Room and Almeida Theatre), Quebec, Bogota, performed at the Quincentennial Celebration in Istanbul, The First International Festival of Jewish Art Music in Vilnius, Lithuania, in San Juan, Puerto Rico, and at colleges, community centers and folk festivals throughout the U.S.  They have appeared in Merkin Hall, Weill Recital Hall, for the World Music Institute, and the Jewish Museum in New York, the Skirball Cultural Center in LosAngeles, the Ordway Theater in St. Paul, the Rothko Chapel in Houston, Smith College, Hunter College, and the Eastman School of Music among many other venues.  The ensemble won first prize in the Jewish performing arts competition and was a finalist in the concert artists’ guild competition, both held in New York.  Three CD’s of Judeo-Spanish music recorded by Alhambra are available for sale. www.alhambragroup.com               


THE MEMBERS OF ALHAMBRA


ALHAMBRA’S virtuoso performers create exciting arrangements of
Judeo-Spanish wedding music, love songs, and instrumental dances on the
oud, quanun (trapezoidal zither), nay (ancient vertical flute), dumbek
(middle-eastern drum) and shawm. 





ISABELLE GANZ





An international performing and recording artists and one of
the pioneers in the performance of Sephardic music, ISABELLE GANZ and her New
York-based ensemble, ALHAMBRA, have produced three CDs of Judeo-Spanish music.  Her 1980 recording, with THE BROKEN CONSORT, was one of the
earliest made in the field. In 1997 Ganz received a Fulbright Grant to
research Sephardic music at the Jewish Music Research Centre of Hebrew
University and to teach Voice and Contemporary Music at the Rubin Academy of
Music and Dance in Jerusalem.  She received a Solo Recitalist Grant from
the National Endowment for the Arts for the 1992-93 season.  Ms. Ganz has appeared as
vocal soloist with symphony orchestras and chamber ensembles throughout the
world, including the Seattle Symphony, the Brooklyn Philharmonic, the Portland,
Maine Symphony and the Slovak Radio Orchestra.  She has premiered numerous
works, including Ryoanji, a work composed for her and for percussionist Michael Pugliese by John Cage, and recorded by them for MODE RECORDS.
Ganz has performed in Milan, Amsterdam, Paris, Tel Aviv,
Jerusalem, and in England, Germany, Luxembourg, Canada and throughout the U.S.
She holds a Doctor of Musical Arts degree in Voice and Music Literature from
the Eastman School of Music, where she was a student of the late Jan DeGaetani.
She has been a Cantorial Soloist in synagogues, both Reform and Conservative,
in Munich, Amsterdam, Canada and the U.S.  As a composer, Ms. Ganz has
been published by Boosey and Hawkes, Transcontinental Music Publishers and
Shalshelet.  She has recorded for Mode, Leonarda, Master Musicians
Collective, Spectrum, Opus One, Tecnosaga (Songs of the Gershwins) Prestige/International, Global Village Music and Aulos/Koch/Schwann. Ms. Ganz
is listed in the International Who’s Who in Music.
ELLIOT Z. LEVINE                                                  

The baritone for the Western Wind Ensemble since its
inception in 1969, ELLIOT Z. LEVINE has appeared as a soloist with such groups
as Musica Sacra, The Rome Opera, La Fenice, The Mannes Camerata, Music at
Ascension, The Ensemble for Early Music and the Folger Consort. He received his
M.M. degree from the Manhattan School of Music and has studied conducting with
Robert Hickok and composition with Robert Starer at Brooklyn College. He has
been awarded five Meet-the-Composer Grants and has been composer-in-residence
at the Church of St. Thomas More in New York . For many year he has been a
conductor and coach at Western Wind workshops at such institutions as Dartmouth
College , Smith College, the University of Massachusetts, and at ACDA choral
conferences throughout the U.S. As a composer, Mr. Levine is published by
Harold Flammer, Inc., Willis Music Co. and by Shadow Press. He is a Cantorial
Soloist at Temple Emanuel of Great Neck.


                                                                RAMI EL AASSER



Percussionist RAMI EL AASSER performs worldwide on
middle-eastern instruments such as the tabla, darbukah, riq (tamborine), def
(frame drum), and bendir.  He has studied, performed and recorded with many
groups and several percussion masters including Anistar, Raquy Danziger, Said
el Artists, Hamish Henkish and Ashraf Essam el Din in Egypt, the Radyo Istanbul
Orkestra and the Cafe Artesia Ensemble.  Mr. El Aasser studied at the
Gallatin School at New York University and received B.S. degrees in both Music
Performance and International Studies from Northwestern University.

MARGO GEZAIRLIAN GRIB

Early Music America Magazine wrote: “If one performer
deserves special note, it is MARGO GEZAIRLIAN GRIB, whose unique voice is
perfect for these songs” in its review of the recording Music in the Land of
Three Faiths.  Grib was a soloist for the recording of Einstein on
the Beach by Philip Glass and Robert Wilson for Sony Classics and toured
with that production to opera houses around the world, including BAM, Opera
Bobigny in Paris, The Liceu in Barcelona, the Melbourne Opera House and the
McCarter Theatre.  Ms Grib has performed with many prominent early music
ensembles such as New York’s Ensemble for Early Music, the New York Collegium
and The Ivory Consort, and at festivals such as the Indianapolis Early
Music Festival and the Cloisters and the Bloomington Early Music Festival. 
Ms. Grib is artistic director of The Alba Consort, which has performed at
the Academy of Ancient Music, Bargemusic, The Greene Space and Early Music
Now.  The group was also featured on CUNY TV and was selected for Chamber Music
America’s 2014 conference showcase.
Ms Grib’s other recordings include Music of Medieval Love for
EEM, Jesus Blood Never Saved Me Yet by Gavin Briers with Tom Waits, and
for the film score of Kundun.  Grib has performed on WQXR FM and
WNPR and sung choral works at Carnegie Hall and Lincoln Center.  Under the
direction of playwright David Mamet, Ms. Grib was a founding member of the
Atlantic Theatre Company where she performed in The Cider House Rules directed
by Tom Hulce.  Her extensive theatre resume also includes performances at the
Goodman Theatre of Chicago with the London Shakespeare Company and at the
Lincoln Center Theater.
                                                                     CARLO VALTE 



CARLO VALTE is an active performer and teaching artist based
in New York City, engaging audiences with music ancient and new.  His
varied programs are a blend of classical traditions of both the East and the
West with universal connections.  Known for his rhythmic vitality, he has
performed in numerous venues, including Alice Tully Hall, Weill Recital Hall,
L’Auditori de Barcelona and the Metropolitan Museum of Art in NYC.  He is
the Oudist for the several ensembles including Alba, Adufera, Compass
and Sendebar.  He performed with Hesperus on classical guitar,
oud and percussion for the live music with silent film project The Golem.
Mr Valte’s education began on Guitar and
Bandurria with C.O.S. conductor Michael Dada.  He received Bachelor of
Science and Master of Music degrees from the Mannes College of Music, where he was a student
of Frederic Hand.  He also studied Jazz Guitar and
arranging with Howard Morgen.  Mr Valte’s interest in Medieval and Middle Eastern music led him to
study the Oud with Simon Shaheen in New York and Nasser Houari in Morocco.  Volte recorded for One Soul Records, Vienna
Modern Masters and New York Collegium.  He is a faculty member
of Mannes College of Music’s Prep Department where he teaches Classical Guitar, Bass
Guitar, Ear Training and Theory.

story:
Firstly, hear some samples of music I've made over the past 10+ years: https://soundcloud.com/frank-mcginnis/sets/my-m...

Please take the time to read all of this. That will be a contribution in and of itself.

Many of you have known me for a long time. You know that making music is the biggest part of who I am. I'm so very proud of everything I've done. I feel unbelievably lucky to have had the amount of support I've had and the response to the music I've made for the past many years. Though I look back on where I've been and where I've gone with humble appreciation, I recognize that there are many things I could have done more.

I'll be turning 30 in April. That doesn't scare me. It invigorates me. More than ever, "the time is now" applies like a motto of virility and inspiration. I am in pre-production for my first studio recording since 2010 and I'm so excited to say that I'll be working again with Jeremy Backofen, the gentleman who helped Frankie and His Fingers become a real band years ago. He produced the first record of ours and guided us through our most formative years of trying to make it in the music business. Jeremy has also produced many very successful albums for labels like FatCat Records and for bands like The Felice Brothers.

My plan with the money I raise here is to record a new studio EP (of about 4-6 songs) with Jeremy at an incredbile new spot in Clermont, NY. The space is gloriously equipped with gear and sits on a breathtaking property that overlooks the Hudson River/Catskills on one side and the Berkshires far off in the distance on the other side. I will be playing most of the instruments on this new record: guitars, vocals, keys, bass, sometimes drums, and even some "plinky weird things". I hope to have a few sparky guests as well to add to the character of the EP. This process will take time, since many of the instruments will have to be painstakingly tracked individually by yours truly, but my vision for this EP is strong and has made me feel more excited than I have in a very long while.

The money donated will also go to having the record professionally mastered, cover art and layout design, a possible PR push for a single, and perhaps even some kind of physical duplication. After this record is finished, those who have donated will be invited to a pre-release listening party and will receive an advanced copy of the EP. It means the universe to me that you would want to help and would consider giving me even just one dollar.

Once I have a professional quality recording that represents the music I make at this stage in my life, the next step will be performing as much as possible. Touring in various ways, as far as I can, whenever I can. This record  will be my vehicle for doing what I love as often as I can. Thank you. I really do love you all.

Frank

story:
The Story So Far

Two Years ago we released our Album Ezekiel. The album was recorded in our houses and church’s basements with barely any equipment. The guys in Bluetree offered to mix our tracks for next to nothing. When we recorded it, we only expected it to be a demo for ourselves and a few friends. We NEVER expected to be where we are now. Looking back, we can’t believe what has come out of it.


To name a few accomplishments:

  • 4 Cross-Canadian Tours
  • 2 US Tours
  • Band Missions Trip to Guatemala
  • 2 GMA 2015 Nominations
  • GMA 2015 New Artist of the Year
  • ECMA 2015 Gospel Album of the Year

Where We Are Presently

After gaining some excitement and momentum, we now have even larger doors opened in front of us. We’ve been approached by record labels, influential artists, big-name producers, non-profit organizations, radio, TV, and other influencers to partner together for the greater cause of Worship, Purpose, & Mission.

We collectively realize that these opportunities have come FIRST, because God has given us a passion and message to give to a broken generation, and SECONDLY, because of the support of fellow VISIONARIES such as YOU.


                                                  -  Check out our perks! -

The Next Step: A NEW ALBUM

The next step for our ministry is a NEW ALBUM. And not just a new album, but the most legitimate album we may ever do.

IF we raise the finances we need, this album will have the absolute best recording, production, mixing, and sound that is available out there! This fact alone absolutely get us FIRED UP. Although we are very proud of Ezekiel, we know that the quality of the production has limited it’s exposure. BUT this new record has no limits!

A World Class album will open the doors to ministry we haven't had the privilege to be a part of yet. We’ve all experienced the power of Music. We believe that these new songs will connect people to an unfathomable love, a higher purpose, and worthy mission. We know this because that’s what music has done for us. 


                                    -  Our EXCLUSIVE Merch Designs!! - 

   


New Album Cost

  • Studio Time | 1 week recording, engineer, accommodations, gear rentals, etc | =  $3600
  • Production & Mixing | this price can vary depending on what our options are | = $15,000
  • Studio Players | we may be able to work with some legendary worship artists | = $1000
  • Mastering | = $ 750
  • Flights | to fly in our producer & session artists to the studio | = $2000
  • Rewards Expenses | shipping, paypal, merch costs, cd costs, graphic design, etc | $2000

TOTAL ALBUM COSTS = $23, 600


As you can see, our total cost is actually higher than what we are fundraising. If any extra money comes in, it will be added to this total cost.

Other Ways You Can Help


We know that some of you can’t afford to support right now. No sweat! We’ve been there. But just sharing our story can go a long way! You can support by sharing on the socials, telling people about our campaign via word or mouth, or any other way of getting the word out!

story:
-Deutsch unten-

/

Who we are?

Hey guys,

we are Malte and Alex - together Yatao - and a handpan/world music duo hailing from Berlin. We met about 5 years ago and ever since we keep (re-)discovering our common love for music. We have gone a long path and experienced a lot together - on a musical level and also on our friendships's level.

Our music found its beginning on the streets. Inspired by the people and their reactions to our music, to the sounds of the handpan, our playing style stayed true to the spontaneity and honesty of the moment.

In the meantime we only seldom play on the streets but still kept the spirit. During the past 5 years we gave hundreds of concerts for free - in the strong belief that giving and receiving will always be balanced.


What will we do?

Together with you we now want to make another step forward. We already created a couple of albums, self-made from beginning to the end - always on no or low budget. 

Also for our new album 'Drops to Oceans' we want to accompany every step of the process, but inviting professional friends to help and be able to reach a quality that we couldn't reach without them. To finally create a piece of art that is beyond what we created as yet.

Our music is only precious when it reaches open ears and hearts. Help us to create an album that touches people in their core and ignites a spark of peace in our souls.

Our new album 'Drops to Oceans' will be published on the 31st August, 2019. If you help us grow this seed, you will receive the album even before the official release.

Starting at the end of September until the end of the year 2019 we will hit the road again and tour all over Central Europe, playing concerts with free entrance, presenting you our new album and spreading the love.

Thanks for being part! <3


How will we do this?

In the beginning of June, we will go to a nice little hut in the middle of nowhere, somewhere between Berlin and Hamburg, with all our instruments and recording gear, nice food and the best vibes we can bring. We will spend full 5 days to record, experiment, talk, change and settle with the best musical pieces that we can create.

The Album Cover is already in work and will be done by the amazing Munich based artist Vicky Anna Lardschneider (https://www.instagram.com/v.annart/). She will also do the T-Shirt design.

We will ask our dear friends from Camissa Audio (http://www.camissa-audio.de/) to master our tracks so they sound amazing on all devices that you can think of and make your ears sizzle.


What do we need the money for?

We got the instruments and the creative minds - so that's all set. But we DO need money for making the artwork (1500€) and for mastering (1000€), then we need to press the CDs so our music can materialise (3500€). We need to spend some money in advertising this campaign and the release of the album so people can know about it (maybe 500€). We need some money to ship all the perks to you that you want to hold in your hands (800€) and last but not least, indiegogo and the handling of the payments eat up another 8 to 10% of the whole cake.

All in all we will need about 7500€ to let this project happen. The more the better because you will help to cover our costs. But to be honest - we will make this happen anyway, cause this is what we do! :)

In deep gratitude and relatedness,

Alex&Malte

/


Wer sind wir?

Hallo ihr Lieben,

wir sind Alex und Malte, zusammen Yatao, ein Handpan/Weltmusik Duo aus Berlin. Wir trafen uns vor 5 Jahren und seitdem entdecken und erforschen wir gemeinsam unsere Liebe zur Musik. Viele Höhen und Tiefen haben wir seitdem erlebt, sowohl auf freundschaftlicher Ebene, als auch auf musikalischer.

Den Ursprung fand unsere Musik auf der Straße. Inspiriert von den Menschen und ihren Reaktionen auf unsere Musik, den Klängen der Handpan, hat sich unser Spielstil nie entfernt von der Spontanität und Ehrlichkeit des Moments.

Mittlerweile spielen wir nur noch wenig auf der Straße. Den Spirit haben wir aber mitgenommen. So gaben wir in den vergangenen 5 Jahren nahezu alle von uns organisierten Konzerte auf Spendenbasis - stets im Vertrauen, dass sich Schenken und Empfangen die Waage halten.


Was wollen wir machen?

Heute sind wir hier und wollen zusammen mit euch einen nächsten Schritt wagen! Einige Alben sind schon entstanden, alle in Eigenregie von vorne bis hinten - immer ohne Budget. Auch bei unserem neuen Album 'Drops to Oceans' wollen wir jeden Schritt begleiten, uns jedoch von Menschen an die Hand nehmen lassen, die Qualitäten mitbringen, die wir nicht haben. Um am Ende auch eine Qualität zu erreichen, die jenseits dessen ist was wir bisher kreierten.

Unsere Musik wird erst wertvoll, wenn sie Ohren und Seelen erreicht. Helft uns ein Album zu produzieren, das uns Menschen im Inneren berührt und so ein wenig mehr Frieden in unseren Herzen stiftet.

Unser neues Album 'Drops to Oceans' wird am 31.08.2019 offiziell released. Wenn ihr uns helft, dieses Projekt zu realisieren bekommt ihr es sogar noch davor!

Ab Ende September bis zum Ende des Jahres spielen wir dann eine auf Spenden basierte „Album Release Tour“ in Zentraleuropa, um euch das Album live zu präsentieren und Gutes zu verbreiten.

Danke, dass du Teil davon bist! <3


Wie machen wir das?

Anfang Juni werden wir gemeinsam in eine kleine Hütte zwischen Hamburg und Berlin gehen, irgendwo im Nirgendwo, all unsere Instrumente im Gepäck, Aufnahmeequipment, gutes Essen und die besten Vibes, die wir zu bieten haben. Wir werden 5 Tage dort verbringen, um aufzunehmen, zu experimentieren, reden, abändern und festlegen auf die besten musikalischen Stücke, die unsere Muße uns kreieren lässt.

Das Albumcover ist bereits in Arbeit und wird gezaubert von der wundervollen Münchner Künstlerin Vicky Anna Lardschneider (https://www.instagram.com/v.annart/). Sie wird auch das Design der T-Shirts und unser gesamtes Tourdesign erstellen.

Wir werden unsere guten Freunde von Camissa Audio (http://www.camissa-audio.de/) bitten uns durch ihr Mastering den bestmöglichen Sound unserer Tracks zu liefern, sodass Eure Ohren kribbeln werden.


Wofür brauchen wir das ganze Geld?

Wir haben die Instrumente und die kreativen Köpfe - dafür ist also schon gesorgt. Aber wir brauchen Geld, um das gesamte Artwork zu kreieren (1500€), für's Mastering (1000€), um die CDs zu pressen, sodass unsere Musik sich materialisieren kann (2500€). Außerdem müssen wir die Crowdfundingkampagne sowie den Release unseres Albums promoten, sodass ihr auch etwas davon erfahrt (etwa 500€). Um euch eure CDs zu schicken, brauchen wir etwa 800€ und zu guter Letzt gehen etwa 8 bis 10% der gesamten Einnahmen an Indiegogo und die Zahlungsdienste.

Alles in Allem brauchen wir um die 7500€, um dieses Projekt realisieren zu können. Je mehr desto besser, weil jeder Euro unsere weiteren Kosten mindert. Aber um ehrlich zu sein werden wir dieses Album so oder so in die Welt setzen. Weil dies nun mal das ist, was wir tun und lieben! :)

In tiefer Dankbarkeit und Verbundenheit,

Alex&Malte

What will we do?
Together with you we now want to make another step forward. We already created a couple of albums, self-made from beginning to the end - always on no or low budget. 
Also for our new album 'Drops to Oceans' we want to accompany every step of the process, but inviting professional friends to help and be able to reach a quality that we couldn't reach without them. To finally create a piece of art that is beyond what we created as yet.
Our music is only precious when it reaches open ears and hearts. Help us to create an album that touches people in their core and ignites a spark of peace in our souls.
Our new album 'Drops to Oceans' will be published on the 31st August, 2019. If you help us grow this seed, you will receive the album even before the official release.
Starting at the end of September until the end of the year 2019 we will hit the road again and tour all over Central Europe, playing concerts with free entrance, presenting you our new album and spreading the love.
Thanks for being part! <3
How will we do this?
In the beginning of June, we will go to a nice little hut in the middle of nowhere, somewhere between Berlin and Hamburg, with all our instruments and recording gear, nice food and the best vibes we can bring. We will spend full 5 days to record, experiment, talk, change and settle with the best musical pieces that we can create.
The Album Cover is already in work and will be done by the amazing Munich based artist Vicky Anna Lardschneider (https://www.instagram.com/v.annart/). She will also do the T-Shirt design.
We will ask our dear friends from Camissa Audio (http://www.camissa-audio.de/) to master our tracks so they sound amazing on all devices that you can think of and make your ears sizzle.
What do we need the money for?
We got the instruments and the creative minds - so that's all set. But we DO need money for making the artwork (1500€) and for mastering (1000€), then we need to press the CDs so our music can materialise (3500€). We need to spend some money in advertising this campaign and the release of the album so people can know about it (maybe 500€). We need some money to ship all the perks to you that you want to hold in your hands (800€) and last but not least, indiegogo and the handling of the payments eat up another 8 to 10% of the whole cake.
All in all we will need about 7500€ to let this project happen. The more the better because you will help to cover our costs. But to be honest - we will make this happen anyway, cause this is what we do! :)
In deep gratitude and relatedness,
Alex&Malte
/
Wer sind wir?
Hallo ihr Lieben,
wir sind Alex und Malte, zusammen Yatao, ein Handpan/Weltmusik Duo aus Berlin. Wir trafen uns vor 5 Jahren und seitdem entdecken und erforschen wir gemeinsam unsere Liebe zur Musik. Viele Höhen und Tiefen haben wir seitdem erlebt, sowohl auf freundschaftlicher Ebene, als auch auf musikalischer.
Den Ursprung fand unsere Musik auf der Straße. Inspiriert von den Menschen und ihren Reaktionen auf unsere Musik, den Klängen der Handpan, hat sich unser Spielstil nie entfernt von der Spontanität und Ehrlichkeit des Moments.
Mittlerweile spielen wir nur noch wenig auf der Straße. Den Spirit haben wir aber mitgenommen. So gaben wir in den vergangenen 5 Jahren nahezu alle von uns organisierten Konzerte auf Spendenbasis - stets im Vertrauen, dass sich Schenken und Empfangen die Waage halten.
Was wollen wir machen?
Heute sind wir hier und wollen zusammen mit euch einen nächsten Schritt wagen! Einige Alben sind schon entstanden, alle in Eigenregie von vorne bis hinten - immer ohne Budget. Auch bei unserem neuen Album 'Drops to Oceans' wollen wir jeden Schritt begleiten, uns jedoch von Menschen an die Hand nehmen lassen, die Qualitäten mitbringen, die wir nicht haben. Um am Ende auch eine Qualität zu erreichen, die jenseits dessen ist was wir bisher kreierten.
Unsere Musik wird erst wertvoll, wenn sie Ohren und Seelen erreicht. Helft uns ein Album zu produzieren, das uns Menschen im Inneren berührt und so ein wenig mehr Frieden in unseren Herzen stiftet.
Unser neues Album 'Drops to Oceans' wird am 31.08.2019 offiziell released. Wenn ihr uns helft, dieses Projekt zu realisieren bekommt ihr es sogar noch davor!
Ab Ende September bis zum Ende des Jahres spielen wir dann eine auf Spenden basierte „Album Release Tour“ in Zentraleuropa, um euch das Album live zu präsentieren und Gutes zu verbreiten.
Danke, dass du Teil davon bist! <3
Wie machen wir das?
Anfang Juni werden wir gemeinsam in eine kleine Hütte zwischen Hamburg und Berlin gehen, irgendwo im Nirgendwo, all unsere Instrumente im Gepäck, Aufnahmeequipment, gutes Essen und die besten Vibes, die wir zu bieten haben. Wir werden 5 Tage dort verbringen, um aufzunehmen, zu experimentieren, reden, abändern und festlegen auf die besten musikalischen Stücke, die unsere Muße uns kreieren lässt.
Das Albumcover ist bereits in Arbeit und wird gezaubert von der wundervollen Münchner Künstlerin Vicky Anna Lardschneider (https://www.instagram.com/v.annart/). Sie wird auch das Design der T-Shirts und unser gesamtes Tourdesign erstellen.
Wir werden unsere guten Freunde von Camissa Audio (http://www.camissa-audio.de/) bitten uns durch ihr Mastering den bestmöglichen Sound unserer Tracks zu liefern, sodass Eure Ohren kribbeln werden.
Wofür brauchen wir das ganze Geld?
Wir haben die Instrumente und die kreativen Köpfe - dafür ist also schon gesorgt. Aber wir brauchen Geld, um das gesamte Artwork zu kreieren (1500€), für's Mastering (1000€), um die CDs zu pressen, sodass unsere Musik sich materialisieren kann (2500€). Außerdem müssen wir die Crowdfundingkampagne sowie den Release unseres Albums promoten, sodass ihr auch etwas davon erfahrt (etwa 500€). Um euch eure CDs zu schicken, brauchen wir etwa 800€ und zu guter Letzt gehen etwa 8 bis 10% der gesamten Einnahmen an Indiegogo und die Zahlungsdienste.
Alles in Allem brauchen wir um die 7500€, um dieses Projekt realisieren zu können. Je mehr desto besser, weil jeder Euro unsere weiteren Kosten mindert. Aber um ehrlich zu sein werden wir dieses Album so oder so in die Welt setzen. Weil dies nun mal das ist, was wir tun und lieben! :)
In tiefer Dankbarkeit und Verbundenheit,
Alex&Malte

story:
Short Summary

My name is Aasha Francis and I'm artistically known as Aasha Marie. Since my early childhood I've always been fond of the music and the arts. I personally believe God gave me the affinity for music and gifted me to express myself through song, poetry and the arts. I'm a native of Chicago, Illinois and am proud to be from this city I call my home. I've spent most of 2019 recording, performing and building up my confidence as an artist and as an individual.  However I started my musical journey in 2014 with my first EP entitled "Breaking Obscurity" and I've learned so much along the way. As I'm embarking on my journey toward my first full length rap album I am launching this campaign to raise funds for it's completion. This album entitled WYWS (While You Were Sleeping represents a physical and spiritual awakening for me to steward my gift well and use it to be a blessing to others. WYWS features poetry, rap and original songs all penned by me reflecting the current times and my faith. This campaign is important to me because it is a FIRST. A FIRST for me to complete, release and market an album but also for the FIRST time ever not being ashamed or afraid to walk in my gift and share it with others. I made WYWS for people who are sleeping on their own God given talent and abilities not knowing it's what God wants to use to free them out of that prison/mindset to help others. In recording this album, it was a message for me personally to wake from my sleep and shine a light in the darkness and I hope I can encourage others to do this same. With your financial contribution to this project my FIRST album can be released and reach more people who like me are fighting to finish their FIRST, whatever that FIRST maybe in life. 

What We Need & What You Get

I am raising $4,500 and funding will go toward the following:

  • Photography, Videography, Editing (mini-docs, music videos, cover art, performances etc.)
  • Hiring musicians, singers, graphic/web designers 
  • Lighting, Props, Wardrobe/Costume, and other filming needs 
  • Marketing, PR, Promotion/Advertising of the album 
  • Music Production and CD production/duplication
     

For your contribution you will receive:

  • Free T-shirt (for contributions of $50)
  • Free T-shirt and Advanced copy of WYWS album (for contributions of $75)
  • Free entry to WYWS listening party, copy of WYWS and free merch (for contributions of $100)
  • All of the above + exclusive BTS footage (for contributions of $150 or more)

The Impact

Why your contribution is needed:

  • Lack of funds can be a huge roadblock for many indie artists like myself and it's one of the reasons why so many great ideas, so much inspiration and talents are missing from the world
  • With the proper funding I can get my album in places I otherwise couldn't and build my brand and go on my first tour
  • I am creating clean, creative, content for the culture and I want future generations to know that they can be contrary to the culture while making a positive contribution to my city

Risks & Challenges

The reality of music and the music business for an indie artist:

I released my first EP in 2014 and I've learned so much since then, made a lot of mistakes and grew from those experiences. As an indie artist I realize that nothing in music is ever guaranteed, you may try and fail. You also may try again and fail again. However, I realize that I have to set the expectation for my music and how I want to present myself and I have to keep knocking on doors and eventually someone will let me in. My album may not make "top lists" and there's also a possibility it may not spread further than my local Chicago/Midwest region, however I feel I have more resources in place now to go further with this project than the previous one and with your help, I can do so. Your financial contribution can connect me to the resources and outlets I wouldn't have access to without your help. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Helpful Contributions:

  • Share my indiegogo link with other people who would love to give
  • When I release a new single, video, or other creative content share it w/your friends/family/social media
  • Pray for me to meet the right people, get the right resources and for me to maintain the right motives that honor God and my purpose

story:
Help The School get to SXSW!

THE SCHOOL have been officially invited by SXSW to play in Austin, Texas during March 2020. We need help raising money to cover the costs of getting us there. 

This is a HUGE opportunity for the band, SXSW is the most important showcase in the world, attended by music industry from many different countries. It will allow us to:

  • raise the profile of the band
  • introduce our 4th album in the USA, due for release later in 2020 on Elefant Records
  • find a team in the US to help work on the album with us, along with other countries 
  • make connections so we can come back for a full US tour once the album is out
  • make connections in other countries too so we're more likely to tour near you
  • export some awesome Welsh music to the world!

What We're Looking for

We'd love to be able to take the whole band so we can be at our very best, but flights, accomm, visas are very expensive. 

We're looking for anything we can get close towards the cost of the trip. We realise Christmas is the worst time to ask for help and everyone is skint, but we'll be grateful for anything we can get.

Our costs per person include £380-440 flights, hold luggage for instruments, accommodation in a Motel 6 for 6 nights, visas are £120. Then there's extras like getting to the airport and parking, getting around Austin each day, insurance, getting to the interview at the US Embassy for our visas - this all adds up with 8 band members. 

Impact

You'll be helping us export Welsh indie pop to the world! Plus raising our chances of going back later for a full US tour once our new album is out and we have a great team in place. 

We believe there's demand for our music in the USA, you can see that just with the records we've sold there so far (solely through distribution, we haven't had a label or press team there before), our digital sales and streams are very high, and we've been lucky to get some US synchs including a few Netflix shows. We want to build on this! 

Risks & Challenges

If we don't raise all the money we'll still go, but probably just with 3-4 band members so we feel it wouldn't be The School at our best. We're determined to make the most of this trip. 

If we don't reach our final target we still receive the money donated so far

Other Ways You Can Help

You could share our campaign and listen to our music, every tiny bit can still help us. If you see that we're playing a show near you soon (eg 21st Dec in London) then buying a ticket would also really help us. thank you so much! x

story:
Overview

We are Ona and Helly, collectively known as Joann Fabrix. Our duo is a pop project that we started just over a year ago, but we have been making music together for over four years! We spent this summer and fall making an album - FABLE, which recently got picked up by Funnybone records.  The songs on FABLE are nursery rhymes and fairytales taking shape as sample-based experimental pop. Our album is set to be released in April, but we need your help putting together a music video for our debut single!

 

Story & Style

In line with the stories in fables and fairytales, the loose narrative will focus on us in a fabricated forest, where we are turned into foxes after drinking a liquid from an enchanted tree. In the video there will be three sets: a forest set, a glowing storybook made by projecting images through paper and an outdoor kite flying scene. 

Our set and costumes will draw on works like Kenneth Anger's "A Rabbit Moon", Kate Bush's music videos as well as The Tales of Beatrix Potter put on by the Royal Ballet. We will create a mood that balances humor, spook and enchantment:

 

 

What We Need 

In order to make this video happen we need your help! Below is an outline of how your money will be spent:

Equipment Rental ($300) - We will need to rent an awesome camera, lenses, a UV filter as well as lights to fill our our set and help create the right mood. 

Production Design ($200) - Bringing our enchanted world to life will only be possible with a visually rich set, costumes and props. 

Directing and Editing Rate ($250) - A highly important expense to make sure our director and editor, Regina Melady, is compensated for the hours put into working on this project.

 

The Team 

Regina Melady, Director - Regina is a Brooklyn-based filmmaker whose work includes music videos for pop and experimental musicians such as Robot Ginger and Jack Whitescarver. She seeks to blend classical filmmaking techniques with homemade visual effects, eye-popping colors, and a DIY sensibility. During an artist residency in 2018, Regina created commercials for a tea farm in rural Nanjian, China, blending footage of traditional farming and drying methods with green screen special effects and visuals. She is thrilled to collaborate with the minds behind Joann Fabrix and to bring this fable to screen. To view her reel click the link below: 

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=SPUmixZMITg 

Toby Meyer, Production Design - Toby graduated from Wesleyan University last spring with a double major in Studio Art and Science in Society and is currently based in Philadelphia where they are working in construction. They are excited about making playfully exaggerated objects that combine recognizable and magical elements and their favorite materials include handmade paper, duct tape and tubes. Toby is so psyched to work on this project with dear buds!

Lu Donovan, Choreographer -  Luisa is a choreographer, performer, and educator based in Philadelphia. Their work prioritizes indulgence and researches strategies of queer-ing the mundane. Lu has shown original pieces at the Icebox Project Space, Fringe Arts, Headlong, as well as self-produced pieces in fields, basements, and apartments across the city. They participated in the Headlong Performance Institute in 2018 and graduated from Wesleyan University with a BA in Dance and American Studies

 

Other Ways To Help

If you are unable to contribute, spreading the word would help us a bunch!!! If you have any questions please reach out :-)

story:
Channeling the dance of the undead and playing songs distinguished by atmospheric synth melodies, lush guitars, and melodic vocals, Neon Coven is equal parts tragedy and beauty. Their anthems of love, loss, life, and death are delivered with the passion that only comes from someone that has lived it. From Los Angeles, CA, Neon Coven is releasing their debut full length album digitally on October 30th, 2020 and on vinyl and cassette the second week of November.

This campaign is the pre-order for the vinyl. Digital and cassette orders are available now.  All Vinyl orders will ship the second or third week of November.

story:
See my Linked In for more references

 

ca.linkedin.com/in/shadefrost/

 

This will give you a good idea of how serious I am and what my background looks like. 

 

Here's my twitter: https://twitter.com/ShadeFrost

My Facebook page: https://www.facebook.com/FrozenShadeOfficial

My Google + page: https://plus.google.com/u/0/102010353130079040444/about

My Model Mayhem page: http://www.modelmayhem.com/ShadeFrost

My Reverbnation page: http://www.reverbnation.com/frozenshade

 

Funding:

 

25$: You get my album before everybody else as well as a thank you letter and a signed and personalized picture of myself.

 

50$: You get my album before everybody else as well as a thank you letter and a signed and personalized picture of myself. You will also get a free limited edition Frozen Shade T-Shirt

 

75$: You get my album before everybody else as well as a thank you letter and a signed and personalized picture of myself. You will also get a free limited edition Frozen Shade T-Shirt plus you will receive a 30 minutes Skype session with me or a phone call from me of 30 minutes also so I can thank you personaly.

 

100$: You get my album before everybody else as well as a thank you letter and a signed personalized picture of myself, a limited edition Frozen Shade T-Shirt, a Skype video call or a phone call of 30 minutes with me so I can thank you personaly. Your name will appear in my thank you section of my album and you will have the chance to meet and greet me as well as being a guest at one of my shows (of your choice) and will have a VIP PASS for that specific show.

 

150$: You get my album before everybody else as well as a thank you letter and a signed personalized picture of myself, a limited edition Frozen Shade T-Shirt, a Skype video call or a phone call of 30 minutes with me so I can thank you personaly. Your name will appear in my thank you section of my album and you will have the chance to meet and greet me as well as receiving a VIP ALL ACCESS PASS for you and two of your friends for one of my shows.

 

250$: You get my album before everybody else as well as a thank you letter and a signed personalized picture of myself, a limited edition Frozen Shade T-Shirt, a Skype video call or a phone call of 30 minutes with me so I can thank you personaly. Your name will appear in my thank you section of my album and you will have the chance to meet and greet me as well as receiving a VIP ALL ACCESS PASS for you and two of your friends for one of my shows and a special VIP ALL ACCESS PASS FOR EVERY SINGLE SHOWS YOU WANT TO ATTEND. You will also be able to see the show for free from the side of the stage at all time with 4 of your friends (you must make sure to give me their names so I can put their names on my guest list for that night).

 

500$: You get my album before everybody else as well as a thank you letter and a signed personalized picture of myself, a limited edition Frozen Shade T-Shirt, a Skype video call or a phone call of 30 minutes with me so I can thank you personaly. Your name will appear in my thank you section of my album and you will have the chance to meet and greet me as well as receiving a VIP ALL ACCESS PASS for you and two of your friends for one of my shows and a special VIP ALL ACCESS PASS FOR EVERY SINGLE SHOWS YOU WANT TO ATTEND. You will also be able to see the show for free from the side of the stage at all time with 4 of your friends (you must make sure to give me their names so I can put their names on my guest list for that night). I will also schedule a professional photo shoot for both of us and I will be yours for one day! (By that I mean, it can be a shopping spree with me, invite me to one of your parties or what ever you would like me to do with you for that special day. I will also make sure it is filmed so you can get a souvenir DVD of our day together...)

 

1000$:  You will get my ALL of my albums before everybody else as well as a thank you letter and a signed personalized picture of myself, a limited edition Frozen Shade T-Shirt, a Skype video call or a phone call of 30 minutes with me so I can thank you personaly. Your name will appear in my thank you section of ALL my albums and you will have the chance to meet and greet me as well as receiving a VIP ALL ACCESS PASS for you and two of your friends for one of my shows and a special VIP ALL ACCESS PASS FOR EVERY SINGLE SHOWS YOU WANT TO ATTEND. You will also be able to see the show for free from the side of the stage at all time with 4 of your friends (you must make sure to give me their names so I can put their names on my guest list for that night). I will also schedule a professional photo shoot for both of us and I will be yours for one day! (By that I mean, it can be a shopping spree with me, invite me to one of your parties or what ever you would like me to do with you for that special day. I will also make sure it is filmed so you can get a souvenir DVD of our day together...) and you will be personnaly invited to party with me and my friends at the place of your choice, as well as being added to my personnal phone contact list, friends list, email contacts and we will go swiming in a shark proof cage together. Also, you will have the chance to be in of one of our music videos and be in charge of the concept of the video as well along with the band. You will also be allowed to attend the band's studio recording session for our albums and hear the songs before anybody else. 

 

Thank you very very much for your support guys!!! \m/

 

Shade Frost

story:
LISTEN TO THE MUSIC AT: https://soundcloud.com/john-tokarczyk

JOHN TOKARCZYK AND CLARITY

Throughout my life I have always considered myself to be an easy going low key person.  I always try to look at the positive side of all situations and understand that everything that happens to you, good or bad, is a great learning experience.  I think laughter is the best medicine and the more positive people you have in your life, the more uplifting and wonderful your life will be.

I have been listening to and playing music for the majority of my life.  It all started when I was in 5th grade and played the trumpet at school to stay out of reading period……It was all over after that.  I took classes in guitar, piano, and drums.  I also picked up bass and vocal work along the way.  Once I had an understanding of the music world, I started to write and compose music.  Over my 20+ years of experience, I have written and produced rock, hard rock, folk, and instrumental music.

Nine years ago, I also got involved with energy work and natural/self healing.  Due to certain life experiences, I decided to take a class in meditation and energy work.  While studying, I concluded that I must learn Reiki, a Japanese energy healing technique that uses healing chi energy to balance your chakras and clear your aura of imbalances.  While studying to become a Reiki master my instructor, Nanci Cannon, said I should write a meditation CD.  I loved the idea, but it was obviously not the right time then.

This 2 years in the making, 9 song album is titled “Clarity”.  This a meditation / new age album.  Each song is specifically written to sooth and relax you while incorporating sound healing and sound therapy. Sound therapy uses certain frequencies to resonate with your body to help reduce stress, bring your mind to a calm and centered place, help with disease and disorders, clear your chakras and remove toxins from your body.   This music is specifically designed to vibrate with your chakras and is tuned to resonate with your body.  A few techniques used are tuning to 432 Hz, setting the song tempo to match the human heart beat while at rest, and incorporating solfeggio tones.  While listening you will enjoy the music and get the benefits of the embedded sound healing frequencies.

 

THE CAMPAIGN AND IT’S IMPORTANCE TO ME

“Clarity”  is very important to me for many reasons.  For me, this project is the first of it’s kind.  I have finally incorporated both parts of my life and my low key positive minded personality to capture this special moment in time.  It is the perfect cliché, “This music incorporates my mindset, heart, and soul”.  I have always been someone that loves to help people.  I don’t even think twice when someone comes to me for help.  And that is really what this project is about, helping people.  Helping people to reduce stress and give the body tools to self heal and balance.  Helping people to live a happier and healthier life.

 

WHAT I NEED AND WHAT YOU GET

I have been able to write, compose, produce, record, and mix the album.  This journey cannot be completed without your help.  If you decide to contribute, your money will go towards: 

  • $200: Updating computer software to complete the artwork.
  • $240: Music mastering to bring the audio to commercial audio standards.
  • $260: Manufacturing of the first 100 actual CD’s.
  • $100: Copyright and basic online digital distribution.
  • The additional money covers Indiegogo’s percentage and fees.

If you do decide to help, there are many perks available to you including a copy of the album, 10 questions sent to me that I will answer (any subject…let you mind go crazy!), your name included in the CD liner notes, and personal thank you notes emailed/posted/facebooked directly to you.  You can also spend time with John in: reiki healing sessions, drum lessons, a casual lunch, and recording time in his home studio (you must be able to get to Mebane, NC or live in the area).  If you are feeling especially giving, you can even become an Executive Producer (There are no publishing or licensing rights, or royalties included with this title.)!!!!

If I do not reach my goal, the money raised will still go towards what it can while I find other means raise the rest to release this album.

 

THE PROJECT’S IMPACT

This campaign will provide me with the stepping stone to get this project off the ground and the music to the people that can benefit from it.  The main steps I am trying to accomplish are:

  • Start the physical CD inventory.
  • Setup digital distribution.
  • Accomplish physical distribution within regional stores. 

I believe that healing music and positive thinking can change the world in which we live.  Have you ever heard the phrase, “Teach 5th graders how to meditate and you will end violence in one generation”?  That is what this project is about.  Solving the world's intensity, negativity, and imbalance with simple and non violent ways. 

 

OTHER WAYS TO HELP

I understand if you are not in the financial situation to help at this time.  But you can still help by:

  • Forwarding this page to all your friends to help spread the word.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tool located right below the video.
  • Post a link to this page on your social media walls/sites.
  • Tell a friend or loved one at your next social event about how we can make the world a better place.

I hope through this project, I will be able to both entertain people and help them live a healthy and happier life.
