I hope through this project, I will be able to both entertain people and help them live a healthy and happier life.

story:
Who is The New Up?

The New Up is a truly independent, DIY, electro rock band from San Francisco that's always done things our own way. Over the last several years, we have spent countless hours writing, rehearsing, recording and touring. Through this journey and some serious self-reflection, we've come to a vision of the music we really want to make, the music we strongly feel could have a significant impact on the community and the world. In a city and nation with increasingly limited resources for the arts and where artists struggle to survive, we have never stopped working toward our dream. Your contribution to our campaign will allow you to collaborate with us to keep independent music alive, and be a part of an inspired, authentic creative process in a highly commercialized industry. Music that genuinely comes from the heart is a universal language and connects all walks of life. It's one of the few things in life that can bring hope and change to us all.

 

Why Should I Donate?

This new album is going to be the pinnacle of everything we've done up to this point, and we've poured our very existence into the writing process for this release. We've also vowed to ourselves to not settle for anything less than full creative expression and realization of our vision. The recording process for our past albums - which have received a fair amount of recognition - was a little more straightforward: we wrote the songs, recorded the songs in a studio, and released the songs. This time, we came together and decided to take an entirely different approach to making music and connecting to the community through our music. Working together with our dear friend and producer, Jack Frost, the process of writing this new album has been much more in-depth, creatively driven and inspired than any of our previous albums, so we expect to far exceed our past successes with this strong new direction, drive and confidence in the power of the songs. We're also really reaching for a larger audience with the content, production and stylistic vision of this new album, and doing it in a way that stays true to our own creative aspirations. In addition, we're donating a portion of the funds to an undeniably righteous non-profit, Half the Sky Movement, which aims to empower oppressed women and girls all over the world. When you add all of these factors together, you get a project that will not only be immensely helped by the community, but will also be of great benefit to the community, making it hard to think of a reason to not donate.

 

So Where Do the Funds Go?

Your donations are going directly into the quality and reach of our new album. The primary goal is to pay for expenses related to the recording and duplication of the music. We need some seed money to be allocated towards gear for our home studio, to get the ball rolling on the recording process. We have spent the last several years building up our home studio, but still need additional, essential pieces to complete a professional workspace. Microphones, an audio interface and software plug-ins are among the big-ticket items, which are all spelled out in our budget below. This will allow us to complete basic tracking and overdubs on our own, rather than pay others for their studio time. It's the whole owning vs. renting paradigm and it will apply to all current and future recording projects. After the album is funded, the rest of our funds will be spent on promotion to get our album out into the world. It doesn't make sense to have a great product if nobody hears it, so we're hiring a trusted and established PR firm. In addition, we're donating a portion of the funds to Half the Sky Movement, a wonderful global non-profit whose goal is to put an end to the oppression of women and girls worldwide.

 

Charity (2% of Gross Donations)

$500

UAD Apollo analog to digital converter

$2,500

Wide Diaphragm Vocal Mic

$1,750

Power Conditioner

$120

Headphone Amplifier

$180

Two Pairs of Headphones

$230

Software Plug-ins

$1,000

Drum Microphones

$450

Mixing

$3,000

Mastering

$1,000

CD Duplication

$1,000

PR Campaign/Marketing

$10,000

Indiegogo/Paypal Fees

$3,270

Total

$25,000
 

I'm Broke, How Else Can I Help?

As artists, we understand that not everyone has the resources to contribute monetarily. But there is still so much you can do. In a word (or three) - spread the word! Whether it's through social media, email, phone, carrier pigeon or a good old fashioned face-to-face conversation, directing folks to The New Up's campaign and introducing them to our music is invaluable. We truly appreciate our fans' sharing the love with their fellow music fans. And the fact that there are so many tools and resources at everyone's disposal means that it's easier than ever to spread the word.

 

You can:

- Post a link to our campaign on your Facebook page

- Post a link on your Twitter, and retweet our Twitter posts

- Point people to this page (http://igg.me/at/thenewup/x/2175393)

- Email your friends, family and acquaintances about The New Up's campaign and our music

- Share The New Up's campaign video via this page and YouTube

- Embed our campaign's widget anywhere you can using the Indiegogo share tool

- Talk about The New Up's campaign and music to your friends and family

- Talk about the band to your friends and associates who are music writers and radio hosts


Thanks again for your support. We really can't do it without you!

- Share The New Up's campaign video via this page and YouTube

story:
WORK. PARTY. GROOVE.  Three words BELOW THE TIDE honor every day.

BTT is a 5 piece blue-collar deathcore band based out of Kent, Ohio. We as a band have spent the last few years building towards the beast we've become and are now a dominating force in the DIY metal circuit. We have a fondness for the extreme and a tendency to party hearty, and we want to bring our party to YOU! 2013 brings a whole new level of intensity for both our live performance and our music, with our full-length album having just been released this summer and a music video not far behind!

The goal of this campaign is to raise funds in order for us to obtain 2 new t-shirts, restock our old t-shirts, and help to fund the various short tours we have planned for the end of Summer and Fall of 2013! We live and breathe this band every day, and you could say we’re a band of brothers. We’re just five guys that want to have a good time. We don't go to parties; we ARE the party. Help us to bring it to you!!!

We’re looking to raise $2,000 so that we can not only restock our Skull Island t-shirts, but also get TWO BRAND NEW SHIRTS printed and available for you! Along with bringing you new merch, your donation also helps us get a few miles further on the road. As a touring band, we can’t always count on guarantees at shows, thus forcing us to fund things out of pocket. Being blue-collar workers, it’s hard enough paying our own bills most of the time, so we can’t always make ends meet when it comes to BTT. This is why we need YOU. With your help we can keep the proverbial ball rolling and come hang out and party with you on your turf!

In return for your donation, we’re providing “perks” - stickers, cd’s, posters, shirts, music video guest appearances, and even a night on the town with the BTT boys that we’re giving to you as a thank you for your pledge. Even if we don’t reach our goal, you still get your perks for your donation, and the money that we do make is still going towards our merch and tour funds. We pinch pennies, and make every penny count!

Below the Tide has been stirring the waters of the metal industry for the past three years and we’re now taking the strides necessary to ascend beyond the state of a local act and step towards an international position in our industry. Each member has extensive experience in our local and national music industry and have plenty of band experience over the past decade. We LOVE what we do!

Even if you can’t donate, you can still help us! Share our campaign on various social networks (FaceBook, Twitter, Instagram, etc.), tell your friends and family, make some noise about it! IndieGoGo.com has several awesome share tools that make it easy to spread the word.

Don’t forget to “like” our FaceBook page for regular updates on shows, tours, and other happenings in the BTT world! If you have any questions just ask! We’d LOVE to hear from you!

As a touring band, we can’t always count on guarantees at shows, thus forcing us to fund things out of pocket. Being blue-collar workers, it’s hard enough paying our own bills most of the time, so we can’t always make ends meet when it comes to BTT. This is why we need YOU. With your help we can keep the proverbial ball rolling and come hang out and party with you on your turf!
In return for your donation, we’re providing “perks” - stickers, cd’s, posters, shirts, music video guest appearances, and even a night on the town with the BTT boys that we’re giving to you as a thank you for your pledge. Even if we don’t reach our goal, you still get your perks for your donation, and the money that we do make is still going towards our merch and tour funds. We pinch pennies, and make every penny count!
Below the Tide has been stirring the waters of the metal industry for the past three years and we’re now taking the strides necessary to ascend beyond the state of a local act and step towards an international position in our industry. Each member has extensive experience in our local and national music industry and have plenty of band experience over the past decade. We LOVE what we do!
Even if you can’t donate, you can still help us! Share our campaign on various social networks (FaceBook, Twitter, Instagram, etc.), tell your friends and family, make some noise about it! IndieGoGo.com has several awesome share tools that make it easy to spread the word.
Don’t forget to “like” our FaceBook page for regular updates on shows, tours, and other happenings in the BTT world! If you have any questions just ask! We’d LOVE to hear from you!

story:
Mags- The "Knock (Remix)" Video project

My name is Mags and I am 17 years old.  I am launching a music career and my single "Knock" is being played all over North America at Christian radio stations.  Now, the song is under consideration for secular airplay as well.   To reach this broader audience, I need to create a professional music video to go along with my album, "missmatched", which is scheduled for summer release to Christian retailers. 

To shoot a video, a minimum budget of $3000 is needed to create a project that can attract attention, particularly to break into the secular market.  If we don't reach our goal, we will still proceed to create the best and most imaginative music video possible. If we exceed our goal, we will split the excess off into additional music videos to help promote the album.

My heart is to reach the general culture with some positive music! I would love your help and to be part of my vision.  If you can't help professionally, please spread the word and, most of all, please pray for me and my music!

101A LIVE FROM EXIT - FUSION STAGE!!!

http://t.co/52iogHirLg

WATCH AT:

BELGRADE, SERBIA - 11:50pm

TOKYO - 6:50am

HONG KONG - 5:50am

SHENZHEN - 5:50am

NEW YORK - 5:50pm

LA - 2:50pm

LONDON - 10:50pm

 

101A serbian tour STARTED!!!

FIRST GIG IN DOM OMLADINE AT JAPANIZAM CONVENTION WAS ABSOLUTE SUCCESS! 101A REACHED LOYAL FANS THAT SUPPORTS THEIR TOUR!


101A REACH THE AUDIENCE!

 

From JAPANIZAM 'til EXIT same day with
NICK CAVE AND THE BAD SEEDS who performs on the main stage!!!

 



FOLLOW TOUR UPDATES ON OFFICIAL 101A - Serbian tour page.
- Tour Dates
- Tour photos
- gigs
- updates
- Bands daily comments
- TV
- And many more...

https://www.facebook.com/pages/101A-Serbian-tour/638001672896673

 

NEWS ABOUT 101A BANDS TOUR KEEPS SPREADING IN SERBIAN MEDIA!

   

MEDIA TALKING ABOUT 101A

EXIT
http://www.exitfest.org/sr/stages/fusionstage/101a

Trablmejlker webzine about 101A:
http://www.trablmejker.com/whatsup.php?news_cat=1&news=5670

Audio Space about 101A:
http://audiospace.rs/vest/turneja-po-srbiji-benda101a-premijera-spota/

RESONANCE MEDIA AND MARKETING:
http://resonance-mms.com/2013/07/press-release-...

Also, Serbian media’s focuses on 101A tour story:

http://www.24sata.rs/scena/muzika/vest/bend-101...
http://www.atastars.rs/muzika/85205-101a-bend-i...
http://www.nadlanu.com/pocetna/vodic/koncerti/k...
http://www.mtv.rs/koncerti/najave/japanci-101a-...
http://vrsacplus.com/index.php/muzika-2/8805-ja...

 

セルビアの出版社フェスティナレンテ、映像芸術チームCRV2studioは、昨年中国の深センでライブを始めて見た101Aをセルビアに招致し、ライブツアーを企画しています。

101Aは7月の3日から14日にかけてセルビア各所にて演奏します。

*Japanizam--セルビアにおいて日本の新しい文化を紹介する重要な窓口であるSakurabanaが毎年主催しているフェスティバル。

*EXIT Festival--ヨーロッパでも有数の規模を持つ野外ロックフェスティバル。今年はAtoms for Pease, The Prodigy, Bloc Partyなどの出演が発表されています。

*出版社フェスティナレンテの出版記念パーティー。--集英社「イキガミ」のセルビア語版の出版記念企画。

*首都ベオグラード、各都市のクラブ、ライブハウス等

101Aは日本のバンドですが、セルビアをはじめとする東欧地域、ヨーロッパ、世界に於いて活躍できる魅力的なバンドであり、このセルビアツアーが多くの人を音楽でつなぐ一つの力となることを願っています。

我々はインタビュー、ミュージックビデオ、写真、を作成し、このプロジェクトの先駆けとして昨年より活動してきました。

しかし、ツアーに関して、プロモーション費用、国内移動費などの面ではまだ資金が十分ではありません。

このツアーを応援してくださる方、音楽が好きな方、どうかご支援いただければと考えております。

各種クレジットカードまたはpaypalのアカウントをお持ちであればご参加いただけます。

ぜひこのプロジェクトを本当の成功に導いてください。

 

101A & SERBIAN TOUR

 

“101A is not your normal bend. This trio of gender-bending name trickery are very much twisting the rules of  convention with their music and image. One thing is for sure, they’re here to stay. Rock on!” (from IN THE RED, international urban culture & fashion magazine from Guangzhou, China)

The alternative rock band 101A (Noa, Sally and the K) is coming this July to Serbia (101A SERBIAN TOUR) or the first time, as ambassadors of Japanese music and pop-culture. The start and  highlight of their tour will be JAPANIZAM Convention which celebrates Japanese pop-culture and is the biggest event of this kind in the region of South-East Europe  The tour will end with the band’s playing at the EXIT festival (www.exitfest.org)

Official website:
www.101a.org

 

 

GOALS OF THE PROJECT

101A SERBIAN TOUR is a project that aims to:
- Promote the music of the 101A to people of Serbia (down are listed tour details)
- Enhance  the promotion of  the biggest festival of Japanese pop culture, that is  JAPANIZAM Convention with 101A live performance
- Spread the promotion of Japanese culture throughout Serbia
- Share the music globally (Serbian tour is one way to promote the band and to use this opportunity to share music worldwide)
- STIMULATE OTHER FANS  TO BELIEVE THAT EVERYTHING IS POSSIBLE IF YOU FOLLOW YOUR PASSION AND IDEA!
- STIMULATE MUSICIANS THAT GREAT WORK IS RECOGNIZED AND SUPPORTED

Project description:
From July 3rd until July 14th, the band 101A will perform at various locations in Serbia and promote and participate in social activities of JAPANIZAM Convention.

These events will be followed by publishing house FESTINA LENTE, documented by CRV2Studio (who made the music video for the band in Tokyo, Japan) and promoted by many Serbian channels and portals and associations,  among which are TRABLMEJKER, one of TOP3 leading webzines, and SAKURABANA Association, the organizer of JAPANIZAM Convention. 

This project s will gather around about 10.000 attendees ( at gigs and  JAPANIZAM Convention). The prospective audience reach of the project is significantly higher, if  in it are included all those reached through media coverage  and (social) networks of organizers. 

WE SUPPORT RECOGNIZED QUALITY

With joined forces (strong will and funding), Festina Lente publishing house, CRV2Studio and 101A band, self-funded the 1st part of the entire operation, provided all of the material that is already posted on our networks and that will be shown at JAPANIZAM festival (including music video and documentary of the band and two other Japanese artists).

Our idea and wish to share  their music led us forward.

OUR BUDGET  NOW STARTS TO ABANDON OUR AMBITION!!! (Did we mention it’s our private budget?)

 

HELP (WHO CAN HELP?  AND HOW?)


GRATEFUL TO RAMBO AMADEUS, SUPPORTER OF 101A TOUR IN SERBIA

 

We need your support.

Everyone is welcome to help, however,  these organizations and individuals are expected to be most interested in the project:

- Rock, Industrial rock, hardcore, alternative, grunge, metal music supporters, webzines, magazines etc.  – What you get: CD’s, DVD’s, T-Shirts and bunch of other stuff. Or, if you are an organization (magazine, blog, webzine etc.), you have the  possibility to become the official sponsor of the tour. The band will play in major cities and festivals with high attendance expectation, which  creates  great promotion opportunities for sponsors.

 

- HELP BY SHARING THE WORD OF 101A  – All help is highly appreciated, we are grateful if  you  just use all  your active social platforms to spread the word!

SHARING GOT US HERE, BY SHARING WE CAN MAKE IT THROUGH

TOUR PLACES:
Belgrade (JAPANIZAM Convention + another gig )*
Pancevo*
Kragujevac
Zemun

Mladenovac

Novi Sad (Exit festival)*

*confirmed gigs

Other activities:
101A band will also join in other activities of SAKURABANA’s  JAPANIZAM Convention in order to promote Japanese language and culture. 

In case the expected budget exceeds the set basic goal, post-promotion material will be created by CRV2Studio, which will additionally promote 101A, all the above-mentioned events, including all the supporters and sponsors  reached through indiegogo.

 

 

BUDGET GOALS:

BASIC BUDGET GOALS:
Transportation: 4000 euros

Stage Sound Equipment: 800 euros (for places where we have to rent it)

Accomodation: 1000 euros

Notice: In case the donations exceed our basic goals, the rest of the money will be transferred  to the GROOVE BUDGET:
 GROOVE BUDGET GOALS:

Photo and video (lighting rent, studio rent, shooting day, shooting for the gigs, interview)
- 800 euros

Tour marketing  (printing and distributing marketing material)
- 300

If the donations exceed all of the above goals, the rest of the money will be transferred to the PREMIUM BUDGET.

PREMIUM BUDGET GOALS:

Band’s work on the new album, CRV2Studio’s expenses for the filming and future projects with 101A.

HELP
KEEP THE WORLD SPIN IN THE RIGHT DIRECTION!

 

OUR APPRECIATION - SUPPORTERS AND DONATORS

All supporters: Follow our facebook page:
101A - Serbian tour page

https://www.facebook.com/pages/101A-Serbian-tou...

All donators will be taged in THANK YOU - Photo of 101A band. "Like" our page, and let us show that this project WOULDN'T BE POSSIBLE WITHOUT YOU!

THANK YOU

 

ABOUT US

IDEATORS OF SERBIAN TOUR AND SUPPORTERS OF 101A: FESTINA LENTE, CRV2Studio & Trablmejker

Festina Lente is a publishing house from Serbia. They are promoting 101A band on their website and  other social networks. Together with CRV2Studio, they contributed to the making of music video for the 101A track  “Forbidden Sky”, from their new astoundingly ambitious album, soon to be released.
Festina Lente is the only Serbian publishing house that is about to  publish mangas in Serbia. The first manga to be published in Festina Lente is IKIGAMI from the author Motoro Mase. The manga was originally published by Shogakukan Inc. Tokyo.  Band 101A was the first connection with   Japanese culture and the subsequent motivation to share  it for Festina Lente. Therefore, the band  will take part in promotion of IKIGAMI and  in that way, they will contribute to the cultural exchange by sharing   what they are  best in…  MUSIC.

Official website:
http://festinalente.rs/
Interview with the band:

http://www.festinalente.rs/artikli/intervju%20sa%20101a.html (in Serbian)

http://festinalente.rs/artikli/intervju%20sa%20101a_jap.html ((in Japanese)

CRV2Studio is an art advertising team based in Hong Kong and Shenzhen, who is supporting publishing house Festina Lente.  Their crew established  a creative cooperation and support with 101A band as well.
So far, CRV2studio and 101A collaboration included:
- Photo Coverage of Blue Syrup tour 2012 in South-East  China (including Hong Kong & Macau)
- Photo credits for the Band interview made for Festina Lente and  international Magazine IN THE RED (Guangzhou)
- Music Video (Tokyo), filming + post production (parts available in the indiegogo promo video )
- Live interview (coming soon)
- Backstage Photo Shooting from “Forbidden Sky” MV.
https://www.facebook.com/media/set/?set=a.66441...
- Serbian tour support and promotion

Facebook page: https://www.facebook.com/Crv2Studio

 

TRABLMEJKER is one of top 3 Serbian webzines that also promoted the work of 101A, by publishing their interview and now by supporting their tour and logistics:

Interview: http://www.trablmejker.com/emisije.php?ep=2520&em=2

story:
**Texte en français ci-dessous**

Summary

My name is Jane Ehrhardt and I am a singer-songwriter based in Quebec City, Canada. I began songwriting as a teenager and I have been honing my craft ever since. I decided to devote my life to this passion around seven years ago. Since then, I have put out a few releases. My last two albums were distributed across Canada and they received a good deal of critical acclaim as well as airplay on the CBC and various campus radio stations. I have also done a lot of touring and intend on continuing to do so. Over the years, I have performed a couple hundred concerts across Eastern Canada. My last album came out at the beginning of 2011, and if I want my career to keep moving forward, the time has come for me to release some new material!

In June 2013, I recorded 11 new songs with my band made up of Hugo Le Malt (electric guitar, mandolin, lapsteel), Grégoire Dufour (bass, piano) and Renaud Pilote (drums). Simon Paradis engineered the sessions that were held in a century old farmhouse in Quebec’s Beauce region (see above video). Simon is also co-producing the album with me. I have been working on this very personal collection of songs for the past couple of years and I daresay that they are some of my best yet! As for the production, we wanted to go for a very natural, warm and live sound. I believe we have succeeded as Simon describes it as sounding reminiscent of old Neil Young barn recordings.  Everyone involved is very excited to get these recordings out to the public! 


What We Need & What You Get

In order to properly release these recordings in a professional manner, we are calling on our dear friends, families and supporters to give us a hand! Our goal is to raise $3000. Firstly, the funds raised will go towards getting the album mixed and mastered, which are two necessary steps in creating an album which sounds coherent and professional. The rest will go towards manufacturing the CDs, designing the album packaging with a professional graphic designer, and creating a promotional video for the album. If we manage to surpass our goal, we will be able to invest more in the CD packaging, the video and promotional tools such as a website. In exchange for your contribution, I am offering a wide array of perks for different budgets that range from the digital download of the new album, to my complete discovery, to original artwork and intimate live performances!  P.S. All perks include the price of delivery. Send me a message if you would like for your copy of the CD to be signed!


The Impact

We all know that the music industry is not what it once was, but I truly believe that music remains alive and well in the hearts and lives of so many. It is an extraordinary means of communication that must not be taken for granted. By contributing to this project, you will be helping me to share with the world the most beautiful and original music that I have to offer! All funds raised will go directly into the project, whether the goal is met or not, and you will be able to hear the fruits of your contribution as soon as the album comes out. 


Other Ways You Can Help

If you aren’t able to help out monetarily, you can give us a big hand by simply sharing this page with your contacts on social media, by email or through word of mouth. Check out Indiegogo's share tools above! Every action counts!

**********************************************************************************************

Sommaire

Je m’appelle Jane Ehrhardt et je suis une auteure-compositrice-interprète habitant la ville de Québec au Canada.  J’écris des chansons depuis l’adolescence et, il y a environ sept ans, j’ai pris la décision de m’y consacrer entièrement.  Mes deux derniers albums ont été distribués à travers le Canada et un bon nombre de critiques les ont salués avec enthousiasme, en plus d’avoir été joués sur les ondes de Radio Canada et d’une multitude de radios universitaires.  Au fil des ans, j’ai également fait plusieurs tournées (des centaines de prestations dans l’est du pays) et prévoit continuer à en faire.  Mon dernier album a paru en mars 2011 et si je souhaite poursuivre ma carrière, il est temps pour moi de faire paraître de nouvelles chansons.

 

En juin 2013, j’ai enregistré 11 nouvelles chansons avec mon groupe de musiciens constitué d’Hugo Le Malt (guitare électrique, mandoline, lapsteel), de Grégoire Dufour (basse, piano) et de Renaud Pilote (batterie). Les sessions d’enregistrement ont eu lieu dans le grenier d’une maison centenaire en Beauce au Québec (voir la vidéo attachée), avec l’aide de Simon Paradis qui agissait à titre d’ingénieur de son.  Simon est également le co-réalisateur (avec moi) de l’album.  Il s’agit d’un album très personnel, composé de chansons sur lesquelles j’ai travaillé lors des dernières années.  Je dirais même que ces chansons sont parmi les meilleures que j’ai faites !  Au niveau de la production, nous avons voulu un son très naturel, très chaleureux et j’ai vraiment la conviction que nous y sommes parvenus. Simon a même décrit le tout comme étant dans l’esprit des vieux enregistrements de Neil Young (ceux qu’il a fait dans une grange).  Tous les participants au projet ont très hâte de pouvoir faire entendre le fruit d’une telle expérience !

 

Ce dont j'ai besoin et ce que vous pouvez obtenir

Afin de faire paraître correctement (de manière professionnelle) ces enregistrements, nous demandons l’aide de nos amis, familles et supporters ! L’objectif est de récolter 3000 $. La somme sera d’abord dépensée sur le mixage et matriçage (ou « mastering ») de l’album, deux étapes essentielles pour donner une finition professionnelle à nos enregistrements. Le reste de la somme ira dans la conception de la pochette (engager un graphiste professionnel), la manufacture des CDs et dans la production d’une vidéo promotionnelle pour l’album. Si nous arrivons à dépasser notre objectif, nous allons pouvoir investir davantage dans la pochette, le vidéo et des outils promotionnels tel un site web. En échange de contributions monétaires, j’offre donc un large éventail de privilèges spéciaux allant du téléchargement du nouvel album, de l’obtention de ma discographie complète, d’un dessin fait par moi même, jusqu’à un concert privé dans votre salon ! P.S. Les frais de livraison sont inclus avec tous les privilèges. Si vous voulez que votre copie du disque soit signée, envoyez-moi un message !

 

L'Impact

Nous savons tous que l’industrie de la musique n’est plus ce qu’elle était, mais je demeure convaincue que la musique est plus que jamais vivante et bien portante dans les cœurs et dans la vie de tellement de gens.  Nous ne devons cependant jamais prendre cet extraordinaire moyen de communication pour acquis.  En contribuant à ce projet, vous m’aideriez à partager la meilleure, la plus belle et la plus originale musique que j’ai à offrir au monde entier ! Tous les fonds iront pour la réalisation du projet et ce, peu importe si l’objectif est atteint.

 

Autres manières d'aider

Si vous n’êtes pas en mesure d’aider financièrement, vous donneriez un grand coup de main au projet en partageant cette page parmi vos contacts sur les réseaux sociaux, via e-mail ou par le bon vieux bouche-à-oreille !  Prenez en compte également les outils de partage d’Indiegogo ci-dessus !  Chaque geste compte !
story_txt:
**Texte en français ci-dessous**
Summary

My name is Jane Ehrhardt and I am a singer-songwriter based in Quebec City, Canada. I began songwriting as a teenager and I have been honing my craft ever since. I decided to devote my life to this passion around seven years ago. Since then, I have put out a few releases. My last two albums were distributed across Canada and they received a good deal of critical acclaim as well as airplay on the CBC and various campus radio stations. I have also done a lot of touring and intend on continuing to do so. Over the years, I have performed a couple hundred concerts across Eastern Canada. My last album came out at the beginning of 2011, and if I want my career to keep moving forward, the time has come for me to release some new material!


In June 2013, I recorded 11 new songs with my band made up of Hugo Le Malt (electric guitar, mandolin, lapsteel), Grégoire Dufour (bass, piano) and Renaud Pilote (drums). Simon Paradis engineered the sessions that were held in a century old farmhouse in Quebec’s Beauce region (see above video). Simon is also co-producing the album with me. I have been working on this very personal collection of songs for the past couple of years and I daresay that they are some of my best yet! As for the production, we wanted to go for a very natural, warm and live sound. I believe we have succeeded as Simon describes it as sounding reminiscent of old Neil Young barn recordings.  Everyone involved is very excited to get these recordings out to the public! 




What We Need & What You Get

In order to properly release these recordings in a professional manner, we are calling on our dear friends, families and supporters to give us a hand! Our goal is to raise $3000. Firstly, the funds raised will go towards getting the album mixed and mastered, which are two necessary steps in creating an album which sounds coherent and professional. The rest will go towards manufacturing the CDs, designing the album packaging with a professional graphic designer, and creating a promotional video for the album. If we manage to surpass our goal, we will be able to invest more in the CD packaging, the video and promotional tools such as a website. In exchange for your contribution, I am offering a wide array of perks for different budgets that range from the digital download of the new album, to my complete discovery, to original artwork and intimate live performances!  P.S. All perks include the price of delivery. Send me a message if you would like for your copy of the CD to be signed!



The Impact

We all know that the music industry is not what it once was, but I truly believe that music remains alive and well in the hearts and lives of so many. It is an extraordinary means of communication that must not be taken for granted. By contributing to this project, you will be helping me to share with the world the most beautiful and original music that I have to offer! All funds raised will go directly into the project, whether the goal is met or not, and you will be able to hear the fruits of your contribution as soon as the album comes out. 



Other Ways You Can Help

If you aren’t able to help out monetarily, you can give us a big hand by simply sharing this page with your contacts on social media, by email or through word of mouth. Check out Indiegogo's share tools above! Every action counts!


**********************************************************************************************

story:
Who am I?

My name is BenJamin Wallen and I am a graduate of Chapman University's Dodge College of Film and Media Arts. My love for live music and movies have led me to start shooting concerts. I started in 2012 with my little 10 megapixel Pentax K200d and have been using it every since. I want to continue to shoot great live music moments for people to share and enjoy! You are here to help that dream come true. The fundraising is fixed, so it is all or nothing. 
I need new gear in order to stay current and step up my game. My eye is sharp, I just need the right gear to capture what I see. 

Bottom Line:

I need a better camera! In order to shoot concerts you need a camera with great sensitivity, noise control and a fast shutter. Capturing fast moving objects, with constantly changing light in a near dark scenarios is a very difficult thing to do. Your funding will allow me to do this. 

With your donation I will be buying a new Body. The camera lenses I have already will do the trick. The camera is what I need to desperately upgrade. 
  • The Camera is a Pentax K-5ii. Not top of the line, but excels where I need it most
  • If I reach the goal for the body, I will increase the goal to include a fast zoom lens. 
  • The zoom lens is the next step for any concert photog to get close, when they can't physically get close. They are pricey and have been left off this campaign for right now. 

The Impact

If you donate it will give me the ability to follow my dream: 

  • Live music will be captured for thousands to enjoy.
  • I have shot many bands in the SF Bay Area and plan to shoot more.
  • I have been used to shoot Hardly Strictly Bluegrass, Aftershock Festival and Hangtown Halloween Ball.
  • Bands I have also shot are: 

    Greensky Bluegrass, Billy Nershi, Nicki Bluhm and the Gramblers, Justin Townes Earle, Tea Leaf Green, The Dustbowl Revival, The Tropics, The Neckbeard Boys, The Mother Hips, Bonnie and the BANG BANG, Sleeping Giants, Dead Winter Carpenters, Korn, Avenged Sevenfold, Megadeath, P.O.D., Railroad Earth, Les Claypool Duo de Twang, Galactic, Lotus, Anders Osborne, Mark Benevento, Mike Dillon Band, BLVD. and many more. 

  • My portfolio is ever growing and no music is off limits. 

Other Ways You Can Help

I know not everyone can donate money. If you can't, but you love my work or passion, please forward my links to your friends on social networks and help me grow!

Check out some of my work! 

https://www.facebook.com/bjaminphoto

http://www.flickr.com/photos/99507294@N06/

http://www.hangtownhalloween.com/

(rotating pictures 7 of the 10 are mine)

http://www.aftershockconcert.com/

(most the pics on the main page here are mine)

https://www.facebook.com/hardlystrictlybluegrass

(Cover photo is mine)

http://apotheosis415.tumblr.com/tagged/concert

(not so much here)

story:
Hey Everyone!


Thanks for participating in our Indiegogo campaign!


Glasskin Arts was formed after violinist Frédérique Gnaman and clarinetist Ricky McWain performed Contrasts by Bela Bartok at NYU. Unfulfilled by the audience/performer relationship, they questioned "setting" as the infrastructure for dynamic performance. By the time they met pianist Jeremy Rafal in the Spring of 2013, redefining how the audience could interact with performing artists became a pillar for the organization. These diverse musicians make up Glasskin Arts, an organization that fuses multiple art forms to cultivate a platform showcasing dynamic collaborations. Whether the focus be an exploration of space, or the relationship between disparate art forms, Glasskin Arts will consistently question the current climate for classical and new musics. 

Born in the Philippines and raised in Hawaii, pianist Jeremy Rafal has been called “a sterling musician” distinguished by “sensitivity and natural realization of phrasing and shaping of musical lines (The Journal Standard, Freeport, IL).”  He is a soloist, collaborative artist, music director, teacher, and composer.  Now a resident of New York City, he has performed across the United States, Europe, and Asia..  Jeremy had his share of honors, having received prizes from the Brevard Music Center Piano Competition, the Indiana State MTNA Collegiate Performance Competition, the Shostakovich International Piano Competition of St. Petersburg, Russia, among others.  Currently, he is focused on working collaboratively with other artists from theater artists to visual artists.  He holds a master’s degree from University of Cincinnati, and a doctorate from Indiana University.

 Frédérique Gnaman is a violinist living and working in New York City. She started violin at the age of 9 and by 11 was accepted into the New England Conservatory Preparatory School where she studied with Matthew Green. She then went on to study violin under Gregory Fulkerson at New York Unversity's Steinhardt School of Culture, Education, and Human Development. She graduated in May 2013 with a Bachelor of Music Degree at NYU and currently works as a freelance musician in New York City.

 As a young musician, clarinetist Ricky McWain sat 2nd chair Bass Clarinet at All-State Band for Bass Clarinet and played 2nd Clarinet in the inaugural Macy's Great American Marching Band as one of four representatives from the state of Kentucky. At NYU, Ricky has played principal clarinet on Le boeuf sur le toit  by Darius Milhaud and other works in NYU's Philharmonia as well as performed in chamber recitals at The White Box Gallery and Gallery onetwentyeight.  He now works for NYU Residential Life as an Resident Assistant, and is finishing a B.A. in Music with a double major in Romance Language at NYU's Steinhardt School of Culture, Education, and Human Development. He studies privately with Dr. Esther Lamneck. 

The program will include:

--Contrasts (trio for Violin, Clarinet, and Piano) by Bela Bartok

--Sequenza I for flute (1958) by Luciano Berio x Visual Art Commission in Real Time 

--Premier of Matt Entwistle's piece "The Great Escape" and short film by Stela Xhiku (both works commissioned by Glasskin Arts)


AMAZING UPDATE BECAUSE OF THE WONDERFUL CONTRIBUTIONS THUS FAR: 

The Official Date will be December 20th, 2013. 

The event will take place at Tenri Cultural Institute at 43 W 13th Street at 8:00 PM!

We are excited to announce that flutist Mitzy Colletes will be joining the team for Glasskin's Showcase! 



We are asking for your help because Glasskin Arts can't cover the cost of putting this together on our own. We are a new initiative and aim to consistently provide innovative events in the future. All of you wonderful donors are a part of the Glasskin family just by taking the time to learn about our goals. 

Here is what we need help covering:

MUSIC--we are not allowed to perform music that hasn't been purchased first and music is EXPENSIVE. 

COMPOSER--we need to pay our composer, Matt Entwistle, for his time writing his piece and rehearsing with us! 

FLUTIST -  Born in Mogi das Cruzes, Brazil, Mitzy Nonaka Colletes grew up in New
York State, where she began playing the flute in elementary school. Mitzy completed
her Bachelor of Music degree at SUNY Purchase Conservatory of Music under Tara Helen O’Connor. She began her graduate studies at New York University's Steinhardt School under Kathleen Nester, and is currently completing her Master of Music degree at Rutgers University Mason Gross School of the Arts with Bart Feller. She has performed in masterclasses taught by Nicolas Duchamp, Raffaele Trevisani, Keith Underwood, William Bennett, Robert Dick, Brad Garner, and Mark Vinci. She has performed in Europe, South America, and Asia, including a recent tour of China with the Manhattan Symphonie.

Matt Entwistle is an award-winning British film and concert composer based in New York City. He is also an experienced piano accompanist and performer, holding a licentiate diploma in piano performance from the Associated Board of the Royal Schools of Music (equivalent to a Bachelor's with honors). Matthew currently studies music composition and physics at New York University, and is a reputable member of the NYU undergraduate film-scoring community. Outside NYU, he has collaborated with political musical comedy troupe Political Subversities and NBC'sSaturday Night Live. Most recently, his concert music work Return to Venezia won first prize in the university/emerging artist division of the Robert Avalon International Composers Competition. Matthew currently studies with LA-based film composer David Spear.

FILMMAKER--we need to pay Stela Xhiku for her efforts putting together this video, and creating a film for our performance! Stela is a multimedia journalist and founder of The Fly by Night. Started in her junior year at NYU, The Fly by Night is an art and fashion website intended for the curious aesthete. 

EQUIPMENT -- we need to rent several different pieces of equipment for the show including speakers, mics, headphones, and a projector. 

PHOTOGRAPHY-- Our photographer Cole Saladino provided the head shots you'll find on our website and facebook page. Christopher "Cole" Saladino is an adventurer, designer, dreamer, and photographer. Born in California and based in New York City, Cole received a B.F.A in Photography and Imaging from the Tisch School of the Arts in 2013. With your help, we'll bring him back to take gorgeous photos of you having a blast at our showcase! 

RECEPTION--it wouldn't be a concert without a reception! 

ANYTHING helps us out. We're hoping to put make this available for as low a cost as possible, if not free, and however much money we can raise makes all the difference! Please consider giving and thank you so much for your contribution! Without your help, Glasskin Arts would not be possible!

For updates on the showcase and future ventures, please check us out on these different platforms!

Matt Entwistle is an award-winning British film and concert composer based in New York City. He is also an experienced piano accompanist and performer, holding a licentiate diploma in piano performance from the Associated Board of the Royal Schools of Music (equivalent to a Bachelor's with honors). Matthew currently studies music composition and physics at New York University, and is a reputable member of the NYU undergraduate film-scoring community. Outside NYU, he has collaborated with political musical comedy troupe Political Subversities and NBC'sSaturday Night Live. Most recently, his concert music work Return to Venezia won first prize in the university/emerging artist division of the Robert Avalon International Composers Competition. Matthew currently studies with LA-based film composer David Spear.
FILMMAKER--we need to pay Stela Xhiku for her efforts putting together this video, and creating a film for our performance! Stela is a multimedia journalist and founder of The Fly by Night. Started in her junior year at NYU, The Fly by Night is an art and fashion website intended for the curious aesthete. 
EQUIPMENT -- we need to rent several different pieces of equipment for the show including speakers, mics, headphones, and a projector. 
PHOTOGRAPHY-- Our photographer Cole Saladino provided the head shots you'll find on our website and facebook page. Christopher "Cole" Saladino is an adventurer, designer, dreamer, and photographer. Born in California and based in New York City, Cole received a B.F.A in Photography and Imaging from the Tisch School of the Arts in 2013. With your help, we'll bring him back to take gorgeous photos of you having a blast at our showcase! 
RECEPTION--it wouldn't be a concert without a reception! 
ANYTHING helps us out. We're hoping to put make this available for as low a cost as possible, if not free, and however much money we can raise makes all the difference! Please consider giving and thank you so much for your contribution! Without your help, Glasskin Arts would not be possible!
For updates on the showcase and future ventures, please check us out on these different platforms!

story:
Everyone has dreams.  Whether personal or professional, that’s what makes our daily lives interesting.  Can we get to the destination we are striving for?  Musicians and athletes face a stark reality.  Ever since we pick up the guitar, or throw a ball, it’s all about letting our imagination run wild with endless possibilities.  Eventually our skills, developed over years, begin to get us noticed.  At one point, we reach our limitations and realize it’s time to move on.  Whether the girlfriend get’s pregnant, or you blowout a knee, something happens that dictates how things are going to be played out. In many instances, you get one last shot at glory.  For us, that opportunity has come knocking.  With the help of Carmen Marotta, we’ve been introduced to Tony Braunagal.  Tony is a legend in the blues community.  He’s done it all on the stage and in the studio.  He writes, plays, and produces.  He’s probably one of the most creative guys we’re ever going to get a chance to work with.  That’s where you come in… Currently, we are lacking the resources to make a career defining studio recording.  But, with a little help from our friends, we could make it happen.  Please consider getting involved with this project. Support the arts!  Support Rock n Roll!  Support some musicians cranking it up on the Jersey Shore!

If you’ve never been involved with something like this, you might ask…”what are they going to do with this money?”  It’s simple… there are numerous elements to making a recording.  The funds we raise will cover studio costs such as recording and mixing.  We need to pay Tony.  Other areas of expenditure are mastering, manufacturing, and, of course, promotion.  All sorts of things come into the equation.  If we decide to record a Beatles tune, you have to pay the piper!  Don’t worry…Billy won’t be buying another Fender!

We’ve come up with some interesting perks for those that chose to get involved.  Our friend Tom in Hawaii tracked a bunch of shows for us.  He’s mixed some tracks and we will be giving out a brand new live recording.  Glen Gray has designed a cool “rock clock” for us incorporating the Billy Walton Band logo.  Award winning  Chef Richard Spurlock will be cooking dinner for everyone at our exclusive CD release show.  Of course, the “entree” will be the music.  Billy has some special guest appearances in the works as well.

The last time we organized a “fan funding” campaign we were successful.  Please help us continue that momentum.  We will be on tour in Europe for a good part of November.  You’ll probably be reading this while we’re pulling into our show in Berlin…or London…or Cologne… It’s been a hard ride.  A successful campaign with Indiegogo  would propel us to new heights!

Thanks from the Billy Walton Band…..

story:
***********STRAIGHT TO THE POINT SUMMARY*************

We are an odd mix from different backgrounds on the same page about making didgeridoo infused hip hop/funk/folk - whatever you wanna call it! We are raising funds to release and promote our debut album and future music videos. We also plan to promote the “Yam” music video over this coming Thanksgiving (yam season). Our perks include the debut album itself (physical and digital form), private didgeridoo lessons, poster art and more! We thank you and appreciate any support you can give us and hope our perks will be of infinite value to you! 

                         *********************************************************************

·                                                   ABOUT GORANGUTANG

·  Gorangutang: Half gorilla, half orangutan. This hybrid creature is known for its strong thumping of the forest floor to mark it's territory, powerful bass-heavy calls and unpredictable swings through the upper canopy.  We (William Thoren and Tra'zae Lewis Clinton) first met in Berlin, Germany during the 2011 George Clinton and Parliament Funkadelic tour.  It was Thanksgiving Day and the first time either of us had traveled with P Funk outside of the USA. Strangely, less than a year from our Thanksgiving meeting we ended up cutting our first song together: "Yam".  Over the last year we have been making music together in hotels, buses, planes and anywhere else we find ourselves touring with P Funk and or at home in our "gorabitat".

· 

·  William Thoren is an LA based didgeridoo crafter, performer and photographer. He has been playing didgeridoo for thirteen years and started touring with George Clinton and P Funk as their photographer in 2011. Tra'zae is the grandson of George Clinton and learned to rhyme before he could speak. He is a multi instrumentalist with a focus on keyboard and a prolific producer of various styles of music.

· 

·                                                   ABOUT THIS CAMPAIGN

·  We have started this campaign to ask for help in getting the music we have created together over the last year out to the world! If successful, this campaign will allow us to put everything aside and focus on the release of our music far sooner then we will be able to with our current financial obstacles. We have learned that social media outreach alone is not enough for good promotion. Most of the major and indie artists we love have had a ton of promotional budget behind their music to get it to listeners.

· 

·  We are taking the independent route and have found a few good companies and outlets for promoting our upcoming music and videos. One of these companies is Hip Video Promo who will help get our videos on MTV, VH1, BET and a long list of other networks and online media outlets. The music industry is in a state of transformation and we feel blessed to have access to the many new opportunities for independent artists. We are big dreamers and each of us tends to constantly take on more then we can realistically achieve by ourselves. We have our creative flow down but now we are reaching out to our community for help in releasing the works we have created. With this campaign we hope to gain support from those who believe in us enough to help release the Gorangutang into the wild! Lastly, every didge player knows the world is hugely lacking in didgeridoo.

                                                           OUR OBSTACLES

First of all we feel amazingly blessed to be living the lives we live amongst such an amazing and diverse group of people! We are blessed to even see it as a possibility that our community might support us in achieving our true dreams and we appreciate any kind of support we get - even if you are just putting a lil extra syrup on a yam for us! 

One of our main obstacles is distance. Tra'zae lives in Las Vegas and William Lives in Los Angeles. We spend more time together on the road with P Funk then we do at either of our homes. All the music we have recorded is getting finalized and mixed in Los Angeles so part of the budget will go towards travel expenses between cities.

Tra'zae has three young kids with his wife in Las Vegas and time away from them is taken very seriously. There is often a pressure to spend our time together playing shows or street performing to cover Greyhound tickets and gas expenses rather than focus on releasing our creations. William runs a large didgeridoo crafting shop in LA that he is currently in the process of downsizing. He will be moving from a large shop to a smaller one over the next two months. This move combined with Will's habit of didgeridoo evolution over profits will leave little room for the excesses of funding this album project anytime soon.

With that said, every extra cent we have has been and will continue going into our music! If this campaign is successful it will feel like winning the lottery of our dreams. It will empower us to live our someday dreams now and if you help us achieve this we promise to strive for nothing less then making music history! 

·  Where the funds will go

1.  Travel expenses to finalize the album: $450

2.  Recording, mixing and mastering: $800 

3.  1000 Eco Wallet copies of the physical CD: $900 

4.  Digital distribution & publishing administration: $105

5.  Hip Video Promo music video promotion for "Yam": $1296

6.  Online album promotion: $1600

7.  Travel expenses/budget for 2 new music videos: $1200

8.  Album art and graphic design: $200

9.  Indiegogo + Paypal Fee: $396

·  We will be posting updates and more specifics on each of these expenses in the updates section.

About our Perks

If you have any questions about the listed perks or would like to specially request something more, please email us at info@gorangutang.com

·  If we don't reach our desired goal, the first priority of any of your contributions will go towards fulfilling the perks and completing the mixing and mastering of the music. After that, funds will go to towards promotion and completing our new music videos. If enough funds are not raised for printing, the delivery of the album will most likely be delayed longer than the said date.

Other Ways You Can Help

·  Your sharing of this campaign is deeply appreciated!!!!

·  We understand that some may not be in a place to contribute and we greatly appreciate your interest in this campaign and our music regardless of your contribution.

 Thank you for taking the time to read this and for your support!

story:
Watch the video to find out more about the Georgia Young Composer's Festival and meet our 2014 finalists!

About the Project:

The third Georgia Young Composers Festival (GYCF) will take place February 7-8, 2014 at our resident home, Avondale Estates First Baptist Church.  The two previous GYCFs were sponsored and produced by DCG in 2009 and 2012.  The upcoming festival is a collegiate choral composition competition for young musicians living or studying anywhere in Georgia. Six finalists have been chosen; two graduate students and four undergraduate students.  All six will be brought to Atlanta to participate in this two-day festival.  The first part, held Friday evening, will be the dress rehearsal of their pieces, followed by a welcome reception for the judges, finalists, and DCG singers. On Saturday morning, a half-day roundtable discussion will be held with the finalists, judges, and DCG members to discuss career opportunities, publication issues for composers, the job market in Georgia and the Southeast, current trends in professional music, and other matters of keen interest to the finalists.  The festival culminates with a concert Saturday evening for an anticipated audience of approximately 300 – 400 people, which will introduce these composers and their works to today’s audience.  Following the musical debut, the composers and the professional judges will discuss together in public the merits of their pieces in a high-level feedback session seldom if ever available to them.  This will give these young composers an unusual opportunity to be introduced to the Georgia music community, for the public to hear the latest music being produced in Georgia colleges and universities, and for the young composers to learn how more experienced composers view their work.   The two Grand Prizes are DCG-funded $1000 scholarship stipends, one presented to a graduate and one to an undergraduate student, to help support their compositional studies. 

This is a unique opportunity for the young composers and our community.  Please take time to acquaint yourself with the finalists who's pictures and bios are listed in the gallery section of this campaign.  

We hope that you will consider making a donation the GYCF.  Thank you in advance for your generous financial support!

About the DeKalb Choral Guild (DCG):

The mission of the DeKalb Choral Guild is to create opportunities for our community to experience and be enriched by excellent choral music.

The DCG was created in 1978 to present classical choral music of many styles and traditions to audiences in greater Atlanta.  Guild members are selected by audition every year from many counties, but focus on serving DeKalb County.  During its 35-year history, DCG has distinguished itself by the variety of pieces performed and by performing newer works by living composers.  Between September and May each year, DCG rehearses and performs four concerts locally, including a special holiday concert.  During different summers over the past several decades, DCG has travelled to Italy, Vatican City, Germany, and Great Britain to sing classical choral music in churches and cathedrals, including being invited to sing for the 5 pm Mass in St. Peter’s Basilica four years ago.

story:
Hi guys and gals,
Over the past 3 years, in between writing, recording and performing with my band Heaven Is Where, I've also been writing a slew of acoustic songs. I've narrowed it down to the ones that mean the most to me and would be so grateful for your support in making the dream of recording a full length acoustic album a reality.

Ya'll have always been there when I've needed my spirits lifted from some amazingly tough times...Many of you never even knowing what has gone on and how much your kind words and support have pulled me through.

This album will take you through my journey to hell and back. Should I be able to raise the funds to make it happen, it will be justly called "Welcome Home The Child".
Thank you all so very much.
~ Matt

~ My gifts to you for your support ~ 

(Outside of the U.S. please add $10 for shipping)

1. Anyone who donates any amount at all will receive a thank you in the new album.
2. For $25: I will send you my current band album, mens or womens shirt & band 8x10
3. For $50: I will send you my current band album, both a mens & womans shirt, band 8x10 & sticker


--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------


~ If you'd like to become a full fledged Investor ~

For every $1,000 invested toward the recording for the upcoming album titled "Welcome Home The Child", the return is $1 to you from every single album sale in perpetuity (Forever).


:Seeking:

$5,000

 

:About Matt:

Matt first established himself as lead guitarist in the successful Christian Rock Band

"StorySide:B".

Signed to Gotee Records in 2006, Matt toured the country and was co-writer for the #1 hit "Everything And More".

 

After leaving the Christian industry, Matt has went on to release a successful album as lead vocalist, guitarist, writer and producer for his alternative/pop/rock band "Heaven Is Where".

The album titled "Stories From Yesterday" has sold several thousand units to date through physical copies, itunes, amazon, shockhound and other online outlets.


:Extra Incentive For Potential Investors:

The Paranormal (Ghost Hunting) is extremely hot right now!

Matt is also involved in Paranormal Investigations as Co-founder and Co-Lead Investigator in Last Sunset Paranormal.

The team has recently been gaining exposure through print, media, websites, blogs and more. This in turn opens the music up to an arena that might not have previously been reached.


Thank you so much for the consideration

story: Candice and Scott are awesome, hardworking, and terrific people. If you have had the pleasure of knowing them, then chances are they have probably helped you out at some point. Here is your chance to repay them! Pass this along and lets help end the medical bill drama!

story:
Short Summary


I am Laura Berry and I have been passionate about music all of my life. I am mainly a fingerstyle acoustic guitarist but i play many instruments and wish to compose music with many layers and from a mixture of different influences such as folk, samba, d&b, ambient and the list grows. I got ill during my degree education with CFS a chronic illness and have been battling with it for many years, missing out on crucial years of my life my music had to go on the side while I have been recovering. Now I am starting to feel better I have a big desire to get back on track and go for it with my music. Funds to start are what I am struggling with. Last year I managed to buy a good recording mic and headphones, but I am still missing software to be able to make my own mini studio and a midi keyboard, blank CDs and ink for album covers etc.


This is important to me because music is my passion and I would love to be able to do something with it and feel ready to. I have so many ideas I wish to create as I like to compose and the software will be able to help me actually get out what is going on in my head and heart as well as make good quality recordings to share with others. 

This is a sample of one of my compositions I recorded on my old laptop with no recording equipment... with the inbuilt mic. It is a bit raw. But so you know I am a real musician, there is also a link at the bottom to a myspace page with some old samples. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=y9UllJFQvJ0


You will help change my life and to be able to produce and share my music and hopefully inspire others through it and inspire others in a similar situation to me.


What We Need & What You Get


I need less than the £500 minimum requested here... £60 would raise enough for the music software, £130 enough for the software and midi keyboard, £200 enough for the software, midi keyboard, guitar strings and an external drive for storing all my music on., But if I reached £500 I will put it all towards my music production costs or recording equipment (get better versions) i could even get a website started. Every donation will help and go towards this.

You will get free music. I plan to put my music up for free download on the internet with the option to donate if people desire. So that my music will be available to everyone no matter what their own financial situations are in life. I also will eventually be doing free gigs/ tuition in a similar way. I believe in a gift economy and i am excited about giving this a go in my life with my passion!

The Impact

The main impact from this fundraiser is the opportunity to make this happen in my life. It will get the ball rolling and launch me into a new direction towards my passion and to be able to share it with others.

story:
Gypsy Soul Bio and Philosophy

Cilette Swann and Roman Morykit

Gypsy Soul performs music to set your heart free. This unique blend of Americana pop, rock and soul is the creative collaboration of singer and lyricist Cilette Swann and multiinstrumentalist, composer and producer Roman Morykit. Over their 15 years together they have received more than 60 critics’ choice awards across a discography of ten truly independently-produced CDs, and their songs have been downloaded more than 1.5 million times. In addition, their music has been featured in multiple TV shows and movies. Their 2013 release, "The World Is My Country" has already won both the Independent Music Award and International Acoustic Music Award.
Click here for the full bio.

“We have created a successful independent music career with YOUR help and together, we have raised tens of thousands of dollars for local and regional charities. Over the past 15 years, we have produced benefit concerts for food banks, bereavement centers, AIDS and Veterans organizations.” By funding this campaign, we can continue our outreach on a much larger scale. What could be better than doing what you love while affecting positive change!" -
Cilette and Roman

Gypsy Soul Philosophy

Everybody wins has always been Gypsy Soul's guiding principle in all that we do. We can't think of a healthier or more sustainable partnership than that with our loyal fans. We've always been encouraged and supported by our fans who have kept our career alive via touring revenue and CD sales. Our promise is to always give 110% and ensure the exchange is one where everyone benefits, everyone is nurtured and everyone is better for the interaction.

Our Vision

To make music that matters by being fearless and resilient pioneers of an independent music movement. We are musicians and educators creating art with a purpose beneath the surface. Our desire is to inspire and empower others to find their own voice. Our passion is to bring joy and create lasting connections.

Why Create a Fan Funding Campaign?

We are launching this campaign to properly fund our new CD and promotional efforts to raise our profile. We are determined to win the 2016 Grammy Award for Best Americana Record and we will use your gifts to:

  • hire musicians
  • rent studios with engineers
  • hire a mastering engineer
  • hire media professionals
  • hire graphic and video artists
  • upgrade our touring vehicle
  • attend music business conferences
  • radio / promotional appearances
  • extend our reach globally
  • purchase necessary equipment

Gypsy Soul To Record at The Steve Miller Studio

Situated in rural Southern Oregon, this studio is a world class audio recording facility originally built in the mid 70's by rocker Steve Miller. Now operated by Grammy Award winning engineer, Dennis Dragon.

How You Benefit as a Contributor

You are a true participant in art and its creation, allowing us to continue our journey and grow our careers. By giving back to where your soul's fed, your gift will support music that inspires love, creates connections and builds community. It will assist us in acquiring all the proper resources needed to create this mission of beauty. AND, you will also be getting some pretty cool awards for your contributions!

Media Accolades

Our Goals

In a nutshell: We want to keep creating new music, produce more benefit concerts, tour globally and win an Americana Grammy to raise our profile so that we can help other independent artists create sustainable careers via our music business seminars.

Upcoming Events

We invite you to come out to any of our upcoming events and enjoy the music! Take a look below and see if we’ll be in your area! Also, be sure to pledge $250 or more to receive two tickets to any show! Please go to Gypsy Soul's tour page for full tour details.

"Who" Music Video


Thank You

There is no way to fully express our gratitude for your loyalty.

We are continually inspired by the dedication and generosity of donors like yourselves who answer the call to help and we are enormously grateful for your support & partnership.

Thank you so much for joining us on this exciting journey.

With love and gratitude,
Cilette and Roman

Care to Share?

Funding our IndieGoGo campaign is the first step toward achieving our 2016 Americana Grammy goal, and there are many ways that you can help us.

We would be so grateful if you will share this page with your friends on Facebook, Twitter, Pinterest or via an email. You can use the easy social network links just under the video at the top of the page, or you can copy and paste this link:

If you are a member of a Facebook group or email community that would appreciate our heart-based music we hope you’ll post the above link to this page with a brief message about how much our music has meant to you.

Espiritu Fine Art (Custom Fine Silver Jewelry)
by Cilette Swann

View more of Cilette's Custom Fine Silver Jewelry by clicking here.

story:
Hi

Welcome to my site for a complete restoration on my Ernstkaps 1907 grand piano.

I discovered this piano in an old wine bar in Kings Lynn in Norfolk as it was about to be skipped. It was in a terrible state with one broken leg and a load of old chairs piled on top.

As I moved the chairs and looked inside I could just see the brass decorative inlay on the frame and it was like discovering an old Chippendale. 

Once home I got to work repairing the leg and generally removing all the rubbish. 

Now I have dismantled the piano and ready for some specialist work required. This will be:

Strings removed.

Frame out and re-sprayed

Sound board re-varnished

Restrung with all new wrest pins and red felt on the hitch pins

All a-grafts cleaned and polished.

Full action dismantle and rebuild

Keys sent to Scotland for repair and replace where required

Full original French Polish and repair of ebony veneer where required

Polish of all brass work

New padded red velvet underneath the brass emblem 

All additional casework 

The time scale to restore all this is approximately 8 weeks.

The perks I am offering for your kind donations are:

£1.00 to £9 a surprise item sent to your e-mail address which I think you will enjoy

£10 to £24 the above surprise and an e-book about the complete restoration.

£25.00 all of the above plus a DVD of lots of pianists including me playing various pieces.

£50.00 all of the above plus a printed t-shirt with the piano on it.

£65.00 all of the above plus a personalised mug.

£1,000 all of the above plus a 7 night stay for 2 in sunny Sheringham at a top guest house (hooray henry's) and a personalised visit to see the piano and play it yourself or have it demonstrated.

I hope you have enjoyed my site.

story:
Who I Am

I am Garrett Godsey, a Christian singer and songwriter. My faith and music are my passions, and I love to share them with others.

I grew up in a small town called Avon, IN, which is just outside of Indianapolis. My love for music began at an early age. I started playing the guitar at age 7, and I was writing songs and singing on stage by age 12.  At that point, I performed everywhere I could: schools, churches, coffee shops, youth gatherings, concerts, fairs and festivals, and even on TV. By age 15, I was recording my debut album with grammy-nominated songwriter/producer, Aaron Rice, in Nashville, TN. The album did really well, and my single, "Spark," feat. Jason Dunn, former front man of Hawk Nelson, spent 20+ weeks in the CMW Christian Rock Top 100 and has played on radio across the globe. (It's still playing on radio as of today!)

Currently, I am a senior at Avon High School and doing that most seniors do; finalizing my college choices, hanging out with my friends, watching movies, and trying to finish my new EP. 


My EP Project

This is a very special project that contains several new, original songs that I co-wrote with Aaron Rice (TobyMac, Mandisa), Kipp Williams (Newsboys-"Live with Abandon" and "Restart" ), Nick Baumhardt (Stellar Kart guitarist, prev. TFK) and Luke Buishas, one of the top new songwriters in Nashville. 

This group of songwriters, combined, have written multiple #1 songs on multiple #1 albums, plus a grammy nomination . Given this kind of track record, there are big expectations for this EP. 


What Remains to be Done

All songs are recorded and mixed, and those expenses have been paid for. What remains to be covered are all the final processes needed to bring this project home. Those processes include mastering, manufacturing, shipping, licensing, legal fees. While those things may not seem expensive for some people, they add up very quickly and are not cheap for an indie artist. 



What can you do?

This is the part where you come in. 

Do you want to be part of something big and life-changing? Do you want to feel as if you made the difference in getting a positive message from a young, indie music artist out to the masses? This is your opportunity. Music has the power to change lives, and change our perspectives. It connects people who may have nothing else in common other than a song, a lyric or a beat. By being part of my EP project, you will become a vital part of making that connection, no matter the level at which you contribute. Every penny counts, and I truly appreciate your help.


For being part of my project, I have put together a number of packages that range from a pre-release digital download of my EP to a personal concert for you and your friends, with lots of fun and cool packages in between.


I am asking for your support to finish my new EP. Please contribute and share so I can reach my goal of raising $2,500. 

Thank you,

Garrett


P.S. Please spread the word and share this page with your friends.

story:
Amari Rebel & the Movement

Formed in 2013, Amari Rebel and the Movement are transporting bodies, hearts, and minds, while enticing imaginations to dwell in the Impossible.  To accomplish this, we call upon a genealogy of Rebels that includes Jimi Hendrix, P-Funk, Nina Simone, Bob Marley, and Fela Kuti, fusing musical traditions from across the African Diaspora into an experience that is simultaneously a genre and a state of being.  We call it Soular Rock.

Amari Rebel is a musical maroon armed with a guitar and a vision of freedom. The Movement is a sonic starship of Inner-Galactic Goodness.  Together, they are ready to pull a Harriet Tubman and usher listeners to Soular Rock: the land where the groove knows no end.

This summer (2014), we have the great opportunity to travel to London and Berlin to share our music and build relationships with independent artists and new audiences “across the pond.” This is particularly important to us, as it helps us further our mission of joining an international community of artists and music lovers creating and appreciating quality music with a message.

As independent artists, our support comes directly from our fans.  So we are asking for your contributions to help make this tour a success.  We have some great gifts as our way of saying thank you.

Peace and love,

Amari Rebel and the Movement

www.amarirebel.com

What We Need & What You Get

The $9,000 we raise will cover airfare, lodging, and local transportation for 6 band members.  Through regular gigs in Philly and New York, we have already raised enough to cover food for the two-week tour.  Now, we are looking to raise the money for travel expenses, and we’ve developed a list of gifts that reflect our gratitude for your support.  

The Impact

This is a huge step for us as a band.  Part of the Soular Rock aesthetic requires a personal connection to both the music and the movement.  Bringing our sound to the international stage means expanding our fan base in a way that allows us to share both space and music.  And you will be a part of making it happen.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    In the digital age, word of mouth still reigns supreme.  In addition to contributing, please spread the word to your networks (family, friends, acquaintances, strangers on the street, etc).  Click below to get the word out to as many people as possible via all of the social media outlets.





    Check out the rest of Amari Rebel's EP 'Soular Pebbles' by going here:

    http://amarirebel.bandcamp.com/album/soular-pebbles

story:
Over the past few years, I've been recording "Wake Up To Music," whenever I had a little free time. What a learning experience it's been, first assembling a humble home studio and then learning to use it. Along the way, I was kindly assisted by my friends Jamie, Jerry, Jeff, John and Gary, who all gave great advice and technical support.

If you're familiar with anything I've done, whether it be The Bradburys or the Christmas compilations, than you'll know what to expect. "Wake Up To Music" includes nine originals and two covers, mostly in the neighborhood of 60's style guitar pop. The covers are The Beatles "Do You Want To Know A Secret?", originally recorded for a tribute album that never materialized, and Marshall Crenshaw's "Cynical Girl." I'm most excited for you to hear the latter, as one of the friends mentioned earlier in this played it for Mr. Crenshaw, and he approves. There's also a rejected attempt at writing the theme song for Ray Romano's now-cancelled TV show, "Men Of A Certain Age." I think if he had used my theme song, his show might still be on the air. Well….maybe not.

I'm releasing it under the name The Click Beetles, partly so that I don't have to listen to people massacre my last name as I send it out to radio and press outlets. Though this is mostly the sound of me solo, my wife Ellen and daughter Mari were kind enough to assist with handclaps here and there.

I hope you'll consider pre-ordering "Wake Up To Music," as I'd really love for you hear what I've done. Maybe I'll even sell enough to warrant doing another one.

Thanks a million, 
Dan Pavelich
