story:
YouTube has wedded itself to the big music labels. 

Pandora sends you sterile genotypes of music it has decided you’ll like (and jacks artists with low payout).

You can listen to your digital music on public transit but where’s the artistic delight in stuffing sounds directly into your ear-bone? 

Serendipity is an actual, real-life, solid-as-a . . . well, solid-as-a-vinyl-record vinyl record (oh, and it's clear). 

It will be made in an actual, real-life, solid-as-a-big-building-filled-with-a-lot-of-machines vinyl record factory in Cleveland, Ohio.

It comes in a beautifully designed album cover (I’m sorry—your mp3 didn’t come wrapped in a piece of custom artwork? Oh gee that’s too bad). 

And more importantly than any of that, Serendipity will feature the songs of 8 FANTASTIC independent artists:

Coo Coo Birds

Kara Hesse

Crashing Hotels

Dubious Ranger

Way Jose

Should We Run

Lyttle King

Tino Drima

(We'll be alternating their videos here on Indiegogo daily.)

You are going to love sliding this record out of its lusciously illustrated cover, carefully lowering it onto the spindle of your turntable, touching the needle to the vinyl, hearing the first pre-song scratchings, and letting these tunes flow over you. How serendipitous that you will be able to fund this project.  

Pulse Music is helping independent artists produce beautiful vinyl records. 

The funds we raise go to: 

-our artists so they can keep making the music they love 

-our manufacturing partners

and, finally, to us. We are a small, cuddly company in San Francisco made up of people who are determined that independent music shall not vanish from the face of the earth.

We are confident that fans of great music and spiffy vinyl will fully fund this campaign. In the unlikely event of a water landing (i.e., we don’t reach our funding goal) Pulse Music covers all costs. We just don’t think that sticking artists with the bill is cool. That’s a bunch of mixed metaphors but you get the idea. 

Why vinyl? 

We’ll admit it: After years of toting heavy boxes of records from house to house, having to replace delicate record player needles, breaking up with someone and having to buy our *own* turntable, it was kind of cool to get music on CD. 

And after accidentally smashing a few CDs and worrying about how many landfills were toppling over with plastic “jewel boxes,” it was novel to click on iTunes and get a song piped right into our phone. 

But what did we lose when we dumped vinyl?

We lost the sensory experience. Shopping for vinyl meant thumbing through scores of thoughtfully designed album covers. When we brought a record home, we set the cover where we could see and enjoy it. We slid the delicate vinyl out of its sleeve with a sound like a silk slip falling to the floor. We held the album on its side in the light and examined the sleek, shiny surface (straight from the store, still un-fingered and unscratched). Using two hands, we lowered the record onto the turntable, lifted the arm, and touched—just ever so gently—the needle to the vinyl. And then we sat back in our favorite comfy chair and we . . . 

Listened. To. A. Record.

Why these artists?

Pulse Music began with an idea: How can we deploy any and all media to help independent musicians? We started with a TV show, a weekly newsletter about live events (sign up here!), a Tumblr, the requisite website, and vinyl record production. Along the way, we discovered artists who blew our minds. Those naughty-sexy Coo Coo Birds. Lyttle King’s echo-y one-person production. Kara Hesse’s sweet, soulful confessions. To bring these artists together, to give thought to how their songs speak to one another, to have a talented illustrator make a cover design for them, has been a straight-up honor.  

We like what dubstep pioneer Loefah said: “It’s a lot of effort to listen to vinyl, so you want to listen to good shit; you’re not gonna listen to rubbish on vinyl.”

We’ve worked hard to get many ducks in a row for these artists: Contracts have been presented, .wav files submitted, tracks mastered, visual artists engaged. Next steps are to rev up the vinyl pressing machines and the printing presses and start getting vinyl out the door! That’s where we need you. Fund this project and get a copy of Serendipity for yourself. And spread the word to your music- and vinyl-loving friends!
story_txt:

Pandora sends you sterile genotypes of music it has decided you’ll like (and jacks artists with low payout).
You can listen to your digital music on public transit but where’s the artistic delight in stuffing sounds directly into your ear-bone?

Crashing Hotels
Dubious Ranger
Way Jose
Should We Run
Lyttle King
Tino Drima

(We'll be alternating their videos here on Indiegogo daily.)You are going to love sliding this record out of its lusciously illustrated cover, carefully lowering it onto the spindle of your turntable, touching the needle to the vinyl, hearing the first pre-song scratchings, and letting these tunes flow over you. Fund this project and get a copy of Serendipity for yourself. And spread the word to your music- and vinyl-loving friends!

story:
Olivia & The Creepy Crawlies are looking to raise money to help assist us on tour. In February of 2014 we will be releasing our EP and we will be promoting it by touring parts of the 401 section of Ontario. Things like gas, food and unexpected emergencies can surely add up while on the road and we could use all of the help we can get. Any contribution is greatly appreciated by each and every one of us. 

FOR DONATIONS OUTSIDE OF LONDON, WE WILL BE TRAVELING TO THE FOLLOWING CITIES AND CAN DELIVER YOUR PERKS.

-LONDON - Feb 19th 
-KITCHENER - Feb 20th 
-KINGSTON - Feb 21st
-OSHAWA - Feb 22nd 
-TORONTO - Feb 27th
-HAMILTON - Feb 28th 
-GUELPH - March 1st 

BE SURE TO COME TO THE SHOW TO PICK UP YOUR ITEMS :)

story:
More info:


Click on the picture below to listen to us rehearse some of the songs we will record! Dale click a la foto de abajo para escuchar un ensayo de la banda!


(Texto en ESPAÑOL más abajo)

I am Nelson, and I am a composer.

One thing I love as much as music is Space. 

I want to record an album with original compositions inspired by the different stages a star goes through during its life cycle. I also want the music to be representative of our connection to the stars. So alongside molecular clouds, protostars and red giants, I composed about human existence.

My plan is to take this conceptual performance to schools, universities and to the general public, and hopefully spark their curiosity about Space and our place in it. For this, I collaborated with Dutch astronaut André Kuipers (who has gone twice to Space for a total of 204 days); He recorded an educational/inspirational video where he talks about stellar evolution and our direct connection to it. This video will be projected on stage during every performance we give.

Help us spark curiosity about Space and our place in it!!!

Here is where the money will go:

Recording Studio, Mixing and Mastering: We will record in the incredible Fattoria Musica (Studio A). This will ensure a high quality recording thanks to their amazing instruments, acoustics and engineers. 

http://www.fattoriamusica.de/

Vinyl Press: CDs have been devalued by the download of digital files. The problem with this is that sound quality is lost, and the connection between a person and a record is diminished. This is why you will be able to download High Quality digital files if you support us. And if you REALLY want to help us out and be a part of this project, then you will receive a limited edition vinyl with YOUR name written on the Album's Artwork. Why Vinyl? A Vinyl not only sounds great, but looks great as well! A vinyl sleeve is the perfect canvas for artwork, and in this case, we are extremely happy to have original drawings by Pawel Kuczynski! Each vinyl will be numbered: 0-500. In the end, you will not only have the highest quality Digital Audio files to add to your computer, phone, and mp3 player, but you will also have a piece of art you will be able to hold in your hands and showcase. Even if you don't own a vinyl player, you are getting a valuable collector's item that will be with you forever. And above all, you would be helping us greatly! :)

We will do our vinyl pressings with Record Industry to ensure a high quality product.

 http://www.recordindustry.com/

Album's Artwork: I believe an Album's Artwork is very important. It provides a visual layer that complements the listening experience. That is why I decided to work with an artist I deeply admire: Pawel Kuckzynski (Rewarded with over 100 prizes and distinctions).

Here is one of the drawings he made for this project:



If you haven't seen his art yet, check out his facebook page:

 https://www.facebook.com/pages/Pawel-Kuczynski/222849284410325

 

Please help fund this project by getting one of the 3 "Perks" listed on the right side of your screen, and help out by sharing this crowdfunding campaign with your friends! 


TEXTO EN ESPAÑOL


Soy Nelson y soy un compositor.

Mi infancia estuvo llena de sueños espaciales. Recuerdo mirar hacia el cielo en las noches, y dejar que mi imaginación me llevara alrededor de esas esferas brillantes. De niño no sólo vivía en el Planeta Tierra; Vivía en el Universo. Pero al crecer, me mude a ciudades más grandes y más pobladas, dónde las luces de las calles remplazaron a las estrellas. Sin darme cuenta había cambiado al Universo por un barrio, la Vía Láctea por una autopista, y mis fantasías sobre naves espaciales por una licencia de conducir.

Pero la fascinación por el espacio nunca me dejó.

Quería combinar mi amor por la música y por el espacio, así que compuse una obra inspirada en el ciclo de vida de una estrella, desde su nacimiento hasta su muerte. Con la ayuda de 4 de los músicos más talentosos que conozco, hemos trabajado en este proyecto desde hace un año, y finalmente estamos listos para grabarlo y compartirlo con el mundo.

Quiero grabar un disco que represente no solo mis intereses, sino también mi deseo de compartir las cosas que me sorprenden sobre estar vivo.

Necesito tu ayuda para grabar, mezclar, masterizar y finalmente llevar la música a copias físicas, para así poder compartir mis composiciones y ojala generar curiosidad sobre el espacio y nuestro lugar en él.

Las opciones para ayudar a financiar este proyecto están al lado superior derecho de la pantalla:

- Por 15 euros podrás recibir una copia digital de alta calidad de todo el disco directamente a tu correo electrónico.

- Por 25 euros recibes lo mismo que la opción anterior, más una copia del arte digital del disco y las partituras de la música.

- Por 50 euros recibes todo lo anterior, más una copia física de un vinilo edición limitada (numerado de 0 a 500). Con esta opción nos ayudarás a recaudar los fondos para hacer posible la grabación del proyecto, es por eso que si escoges esta opción, escribiremos tu nombre en el arte de cada vinilo, y estará ahí para siempre como un recordatorio de tu apoyo al proyecto. El vinilo podrá ser autografiado por toda la banda si así lo deseas. :)

Ayúdanos a materializar este proyecto, y corre la voz para que podamos alcanzar una audiencia más grande. ¡Gracias de antemano!

story:
Short Summary

Ok so here's the breakdown!!!

Fireset is an indie-folk band who sets out to awaken listeners into a new kind of worship unlike ever before.  With emphasis on the craft of music and the word of God within, this small group out of Pembroke, NC aims to set an uncontainable fire to the nations.

  • We have spent the past two years writing and performing
  • We have faced obstacle after obstacle when it comes to recording
  • We decided to do it ourselves, invested in equipment, recieved tons of help, and independently recorded the entire album.

This is where you come in!!!

What We Need & What You Get

Recording took countless hours, sweat, tears, some blood, and gallons of caffiene.  Now we are ready to produce.  That being said...

  • We need $500 to mass produce the album into distributable hard copies
  • On this album you get pounding bass, hand clapping, toe tapping rythm, with fingerpicking fun that you can scream out to as you bring glory to he father.
  • The goal goes towards casing, replication, and production in its entirety.

The Impact

If each person on our fan page donates a mere $2.00, our goal will be blown out of the water so by all means, please know that every bit counts.  We know the internet is a great way to access music and the album could be put there for free.  But the word of God ison the internet and we see how many people need a personal encounter. You could make that happen.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to participate financially in this effort, PRAY!!! Please also share with anyone and everyone not only what we are trying to do but the gospel and love of Christ.  That is the point to begin with. THANKS SO MUCH GUYS!!!

story:
With your help, a new DIY space with a proven commitment to the underground community will re-open in central Orange County.

A refuge for those on the margins of mainstream society: a music space with skateboarding and art, owned by musicians, skateboarders, and artists, and run with input from and in the best interests of the underground community that it serves. That is my dream.

My name is Mark Waters and I've spent most of my life following my dreams. I've been pretty lucky to have worked in the skateboarding, music, and film worlds my entire adult life. When I was introduced to Paul Hoffmann at Unit B, I knew that I'd found another great opportunity: to create something unique in Orange County -- a place where bands, skaters, and fans could get weird in the ways that only we understand. And with the community that quickly grew around Unit B, we were able to build something awesome.

Like it was for many people in this community, skateboarding and punk music were my first loves, and the underground scenes surrounding punk and skating were my first external family. With Unit B, I was able to develop an actual environment where the safety and comfort of an external family came very naturally. That environment was very important to me, and I’ve learned that it was important to a lot of people involved in Unit B. I’ve become obsessed with recreating that environment.

When the doors were closed at Unit B, it hurt. But I felt like it was an opportunity again -- a chance to build on what we'd done at Unit B, and make it better, make it completely legal, and basically build a new spot that was designed to be what we want. Not a skatepark with a stage, but a community space designed for live music, skateboarding, art shows, record swaps, a library/bookstore, a recording studio, as well as rehearsal studios and anything else that we feel the need to create. This is a community space like no other, and we've proven that this concept works.By working with local bands, bookers, volunteers and other members of the community, we're on the path to creating this new Unit B. And we need your help to make it as great as we all deserve.

We are hoping to raise $XX,XXX through this campaign, and we will be looking for investors for the remainder of the initial costs. Here is exactly how we will spend the initial contributions:

First and last month's rent and security deposit.

Materials for build-out of 3-5 rehearsal rooms (lockout studios).

Professional labor for code-enforceable specs.

Materials for skateboarding ramps.

Materials for wall protection inside, covering walls, glass, bathrooms, etc.

Materials to build-out stage and mixing booth.

Additional expenses will be covered by my initial investment, as well as by investments from a few key friends who’ve expressed interest. 

If we do not reach our fundraising goal, we will still be launching Unit B, it'll just take a little longer. This goal will allow us to build ramps, stage, art gallery space, lockout studios, and set up for the recording studio, but if needed, we can and will open with the stage and will build out the additional projects as we can.

We've got some great perks and rewards for every level of contribution. I'm very grateful to some longtime friends who've graciously helped by donating some amazing artwork, products, and time. Check out all the perks below! We will be adding additional perks as these are sold out. We're only allowed 20 at a time, so things like original prints of GG Allin, Nirvana, At The Drive-In, Fugazi, JFA, and more, plus art from other great artists, additional records, and more will be added as as the campaign continues on.

If you can take advantage of these great perks, you'll not only be helping out this Unit B community, but you'll be getting an amazing value for your contribution! If you're not able to help out with a contribution, please share using the Facebook, Twitter, Google+, and URL links above, or right-click the images below to share via Instagram or any other social media outlet!

Thanks, on behalf of the Unit B crew, extended family, and everyone who will be able to enjoy Unit B down the road. We can't wait to see you at the new spot!

We are holding a referral contest! Once you make a contribution, even a $1 contribution, you are automatically registered for three referral contests. The first contest is for the the sheer number of referrals you make. A "referral" in this case is counted each time you use one of the IndieGoGo sharing tools - to Facebook, Twitter, Google+, or by embedding or emailing the links. Whoever refers/shares the most people will earn a one-month pass to any events at Unit B. The second contest is for the amount of funders that result from those referrals. If you refer 20 people and ten of them make a contribution, they would all count as funders for you. Whoever brings in the most funders will earn a two-month pass to any events at Unit B. The third and final contest is for the contribution amount. Whoever brings in the most contributions from their referrals will earn a one-year pass to any and all events at Unit B! All the stats are tracked automatically and will be available for view at the end of the campaign. Don't forget that the way you register for referrals is by making a contribution! Have fun and share away!

Here are square images to download and share!

and I’ve learned that it was important to a lot of people involved in Unit B.
I’ve become obsessed with recreating that environment.
When the doors were closed at Unit B, it hurt. But I felt like it was an
opportunity again -- a chance to build on what we'd done at Unit B, and make it
better, make it completely legal, and basically build a new spot that was
designed to be what we want. Not a skatepark with a stage, but a community
space designed for live music, skateboarding, art shows, record swaps, a
library/bookstore, a recording studio, as well as rehearsal studios and
anything else that we feel the need to create. This is a community space like
no other, and we've proven that this concept works.By working with local bands, bookers, volunteers and other members of
the community, we're on the path to creating this new Unit B. And we need your
help to make it as great as we all deserve.
We
are hoping to raise $XX,XXX through this campaign, and we will be looking for
investors for the remainder of the initial costs. Here is exactly how we will
spend the initial contributions:
First and last month's rent and security deposit.
Materials for build-out of 3-5 rehearsal rooms (lockout studios).
Professional labor for code-enforceable specs.
Materials for skateboarding ramps.
Materials for wall protection inside, covering walls, glass, bathrooms, etc.
Materials to build-out stage and mixing booth.
Additional
expenses will be covered by my initial investment, as well as by investments
from a few key friends who’ve expressed interest. 
If we do not reach our fundraising goal, we will still be launching Unit B, it'll just take a little longer. This goal will allow us to build ramps, stage, art gallery space, lockout studios, and set up for the recording studio, but if needed, we can and will open with the stage and will build out the additional projects as we can.

We've
got some great perks and rewards for every level of contribution. I'm very grateful to some longtime friends who've graciously helped by donating some amazing artwork, products, and time. Check out all the perks below! We will be adding additional perks as these are sold out. We're only allowed 20 at a time, so things like original prints of GG Allin, Nirvana, At The Drive-In, Fugazi, JFA, and more, plus art from other great artists, additional records, and more will be added as as the campaign continues on.

If you can take advantage of these great perks, you'll not only be helping out this Unit B community, but you'll be getting an amazing value for your contribution! If you're not able to help out with a contribution, please share using the Facebook, Twitter, Google+, and URL links above, or right-click the images below to share via Instagram or any other social media outlet!Thanks, on behalf of the Unit B crew, extended family, and everyone who will be able to enjoy Unit B down the road. We can't wait to see you at the new spot!
We are holding a referral contest! Once you make a contribution, even a $1 contribution, you are automatically registered for three referral contests. The first contest is for the the sheer number of referrals you make. A "referral" in this case is counted each time you use one of the IndieGoGo sharing tools - to Facebook, Twitter, Google+, or by embedding or emailing the links. Whoever refers/shares the most people will earn a one-month pass to any events at Unit B. The second contest is for the amount of funders that result from those referrals. If you refer 20 people and ten of them make a contribution, they would all count as funders for you. Whoever brings in the most funders will earn a two-month pass to any events at Unit B. The third and final contest is for the contribution amount. Whoever brings in the most contributions from their referrals will earn a one-year pass to any and all events at Unit B! All the stats are tracked automatically and will be available for view at the end of the campaign. Don't forget that the way you register for referrals is by making a contribution! Have fun and share away!Here are square images to download and share!

story:
CHANGE LIVES THROUGH MUSIC - WITH THE GIFT OF A VIOLIN

El Sistema Colorado is part of an international movement for social change; using music to change the life trajectory of children living in poverty. We empower children by providing an intensive music program that teaches the importance of teamwork, promotes self-confidence, and instills the value of social responsibility.

Every week, 400 students from Early Childhood 4-year-olds to 9th graders participate in the free El Sistema Colorado music and youth orchestra program - but we don't have enough instruments.  Three or more of our young musicians are sharing an instrument as they prepare for their year-end concert. Another strategy we use is to have children start on a cardboard violin, like those you see in the photos. This is a great pedagogical tool to introduce them to the violin and teach them the basics of the instrument. But now they are waiting for a real violin of their own. 


$143.00 buys a student violin, rosin and case. 

Can we count on you to help get instruments for our young musicians?
Please note that El Sistema Colorado is a project of the Colorado Nonprofit Development Center, which is the organization which will appear on your receipt. 

We have also started a new student band and orchestra program at Bruce Randolph Middle & High School that needs instruments and supplies. We appreciate applying the contributions to the areas of greatest need. 

Invite your friends to join you in contributing towards instruments for our young musicians. 

HERE ARE SOME OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP...

  • Spread the word - re-post this on your Facebook
  • Like the El Sistema Colorado Facebook page 
  • Sign up for our Newsletter and find out more on the El Sistema Colorado website
  • Have an instrument that you are not using? 
    El Sistema Colorado gratefully accepts donations of all instruments and sizes for our students. Contact us to donate an instrument. A tax deductible receipt will be provided to you. 
  • Come Visit! We invite you to visit our school sites in Denver to see the program in action. Our young musicians want to show you what they are learning.

story:
WE ARE TO EVERY ENEMY!

... and we need your help.


We are a relatively small post-hardcore/rock band from San Antonio, Tx with a passion for what we do. While barely being on the move for a little over six months, we've gained a sizable fanbase in a small amount of time, getting attention from our own hometown to places like Belgium and Scotland. 

The only problem with all of that is that even though our music has been making its way across the world slowly but surely, our money has not. We are an unsigned band, therefore we pay for everything out of our own pockets. This makes recording scarce, and a big project is something we know we cannot take on all by ourselves. It's been a dream of ours to play music for people, travel the world and meet people who our music has made some kind of impact in their lives.

We are not just six men looking to get rich or trying to get girls by showing off. This is our passion, our life and hopefully, our career. If you decide to contribute to our project, you would be responsible for starting us off on the road to the rest of our lives.

If you decide to contribute, our gratitude to you will be permanent. If you cannot afford to contribute or do you want to, simply passing this message along can help us significantly. From the bottom of our hearts, thank you for taking time out of your life to read this and consider helping us.

 

- To Every Enemy

story:
Firstly Thank you for taking the time to read this.  It means a lot to us.

 

So we are a hard rock band called Another Distraction.  We are based in Clifton, NJ, and have been playing hard rock for the past two years.  In the last 8 months many things have changed.  A new singer was acquired, new songs were written, and momentum changed drastically.  Since January we have played several shows around NJ, NY, and PA.  We've also played a few battle of the bands, one that we are currently in for for Fright Fest, and we were in the running to play this years Warped Tour as well.  We've been working hard and passionately to perfect our show and our music throughout the months and finally feel that we are ready to share our music with the world.

 

What you are contributing to is a dream. A dream that we have shared since day one.  We're excited to get this project off the ground, and looking forward to getting into the studio to start recording.  With your help and continued support this dream can become a reality.

 

Alright, so at this point you probably want to know what your money specifically is going towards and what you get for your contributions.  Bullet points shall be needed! So our goal for this project is $6,000.  If we get more great, but we would be more than happy with just the asking goal.

  • Project Goal - $6,000
  • That money will go towards the Production of:
  • Studio Album
  • Music Video
  • and Merchandise like Shirts and Posters

What you get, and we are truly excited about these rewards, are as followed (In a nutshell).

  • $10 gets you the full album plus it will be signed by the entire band
  • $20 gets you the signed album plus a t-shirt
  • $50 gets you all that plus you'll be able to come and record vocals with us at the studio
  • $100 gets you all that good stuff plus you get to also be in our music video

There are so many other rewards, but we figured we would mention the top ones first.

So if we don't reach the full goal of $6,000 then whatever money we do attain will fully go to the production of the album, and a few of the perks mentioned will still be rewarded of course.

Since we have been playing out we have had nothing but good reviews from both the audience and other bands that we have played with.  One question that had been continuously asked was if we had an album to buy.  And with disappointed faces we had to tell everyone who asked that we didn't currently, but that we wanted to have an album, but financially just couldn't afford it.  This is not just for us, but for our current and future listeners to hear the music that we have dedicated the past few years of our lives to.  We are just super excited for everything that is happening right now! 

We completely understand if you can not contribute financially, but if you would still like to help get the word out for this project you can post the link to this page on your facebook or twitter.  Any help would be greatly appreciated!  Again, we thank you for all the help and contributions all of you are willing to give. Don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tool to get the word out.

Thank you all so very much!  We can't wait to see how this turns out, and we look forward to hearing from you.

story:
Short Summary

  • Hi everyone! Thank you so much for taking the time to watch and listen! My name is Ida fLO. I am an indie pop artist based out of San Francisco, CA. Writing and making music has always been a predominant part of my life. About 3 years ago, I began pursuing it as a career. During this time I have had the opportunity to perform all around the Bay Area and as far as Los Angeles and New York, collaborating with the many talents of the arts and performing arts community. I've been heavily involved in each aspect of my career so far. Managing, booking, promoting, etc. and producing, songwriting, choreographing, etc. As an independent artist, it is a lot to take in at first, but the supportive people I've been so blessed to be surrounded by helped make this journey immensely positive.
  • Currently, I am in the process of producing my next music video, "Plastic". The track got such a great buzz from my team that it had to take the next step and become a music video! With that said, there's a lot involved in this process. There is of course the careful planning and creative meetings, but there are several key ingredients needed to make this video a success:

1) Hire Videographer/Director and Team

2) Rent equipment

3) Rent location for video

4) Hire MUA's/Hairstylist/'Set' Staff

5) Hire Dancers/Actors/Models

6) Rent rehearsal/studio space

7) Taking care of travel, food, gas expenses of crew and cast

8) Get final cut of track Mixed and Mastered for high quality sound

9) Get video edited (Visual/Special Effects)

10) Invest in video promotion (This is a BIG one, Post Production)

  • This is why this project needs your help! Independently, I could never cover these costs on my own. With your help, you could share a part of this video's potential success, and my success as an artist! It all starts with you! 

The Impact

I'd like to take this time now to go more into detail about this project. The song and video is called "Plastic". It is mainly about what women do to their bodies to make themselves feel more "beautiful". I say more beautiful, because I feel strongly about how we should already see ourselves. As beautiful, inside and out.

"Plastic" exposes plastic surgery among the countless other ways women mold their bodies to their ideals. The song and video will focus on this, but is not intended to ridicule those who partake in aesthetically transforming their bodies. 

I only shine a light on the subject to understand, and to help others understand that who you are right now is beautiful... So embrace it!

Other Ways You Can Help

Please SHARE! Spreading the word and letting others know is another GREAT, GREAT way to help support this project! Remember, no donation is too small!

story:
WHO ARE WE?

CYGNETS are 3 piece new wave band- a furious mix of guitars, synths, dancing, and despair. Idealists who believe music should be accessible, which is why theirs is free. A band not interested in doing things the way they've always been done.

Last year, we saved up thousands of dollars and spent it mixing, mastering, and pressing our debut album "Bleak Anthems". Then we gave it away for free to anyone who wanted it. Why? Because money is the means, not the ends. We just want to make good music and share it with as many people as possible.

While you’re here, please download our first album for free at our website: http://www.cygnetsnotswans.com

If you like what you hear, read on to see how you can be a part of making our second album a reality.


THE IMPACT/WHY

The internet is now officially a game-changer for independent music. The days of corporations and big labels controlling artistic output are quickly fading… all because people know how to find and support music they like on their own.

We are involved with every aspect of our music, and we want to keep it that way. With sites like this and people like you we want to prove that it’s viable to be a completely independent band in the ever-changing landscape of what its like to be an up-and-coming band.


WHAT WE NEED… AND WHAT YOU GET

From the ground up, we put everything we can into our music. We produce and record in our own studio, film music videos and do our own photography. But we can’t do everything by ourselves. We want to provide our listeners with the best experience possible, and that’s where you come in.

We realize we're asking for a lot of money, but allow us to lay it all out for you. We put every cent and opportunity we get to good use. If we don't get to our final goal, these are the stages of what your money can do for us. At $3000, we get our album professionally mixed and mastered and get it up online, available to download for free. At $4300, we can afford to also get a CD pressing done. At $7000 we can also get it pressed on high quality audiophile vinyl.

We appreciate every bit of support we've gotten along the way. If you are willing to help with this endeavour, we want to give something back as a sign of our gratitude.

As we launch the second album, it will be free online (always!) as well as for sale at all major online retailers. The physical formats will be sold on the tour behind it and in independent record shops as we hope to expansively tour behind this album. Always keeping the music free will hopefully inspire people to buy it anyway and support the band. 

So, if this funding platform is really as awesome and charitable as we hear… we thank you in advance. You're not just funding an album, you're giving a hard-working band a great opportunity.

Thanks for reading, and if you like what you hear then help CYGNETS... and spread the word!

(And if you don't like what you hear, let us know. We'll have an "I Hate Cygnets" button sent to you immediately!)

story:
Hi, my name is Stephen and I am part of a group called the Deltona Philharmonic Orchestra.  We have been invited to perform in Chicago this December as a part of the Midwest Clinic, which is an international music conference where composers, arrangers, conductors and clinitians gather ech year to hear groups of students play music and evaluate their performances.

     I have been playing the violin since 2009 and am passionate about what I do.  I have been part of the Deltona Philharmonic Orchestra since 2010 and we have traveled to Chicago to perform in the Festival of Music and we were rated with Straight Superiors and placed first in this competition.  In April of this year we participated in the Music USA Festivals at Universal Studios and rated Straight Superior.

     I am currently trying to raise money to go back to Chicago and participate in this Midwest Clinic and I need your help to get me there.  With your generous donations I will be able to offset the cost of the trip and continue my musical education.  Thank you for your consideration.

 

Stephen

story:
Short Summary

Hey everyone! My names Jordan Sweeto.
I'm an independant Australian pop/rock artist.
A lot of you have expressed interest in me being a featured extra in MetroStation's new music video OR Masson Musso (lead singer of MS) having a cameo in my upcoming music video due to their relaunch campaign. Metro Station are one of many bands I look up to so for me this would be an incredible privilege.
For this to be able to happen we'd need $800 at least. The reason for this is because the video will be shot in California :)

What We Need & What You Get

Seeing as it is getting closer to the launch of my new Single, I thought that I would have some give aways and such for supporters generous enough to donate towards seeing me with Metro Station. I want to make sure that you know how much I appreciate it! ^_^

And finally:

We can't do this without you guys. Its so incredible to me seeing you guys support me so much and want to see my dreams come true.
I want to always put videos and music out for you all because I know I'll have your amazing support and if you are able to help out with this campaign at all, it would really mean a lot!

Spread the word and the #sweetolove!!

-JordanSweeto

story:
I am a singer songer based out of Eugene Oregon.  I began writing songs in the 5th grade shortly after my brief stint as an Elvis impersonator.  Having been lucky enough to get exposed to some fine records by my parents, I was inevitably inspired by the like’s of the Beatles, Bob Dylan, Paul Simon, Jackson Browne, Tom Petty, Crosby, Stills, Nash and Young, Sam Cooke, Sam and Dave and others.  I soaked up a ton of great music early on.  When I reached my twenties, I began getting serious about a career in music.  In 2011, I released my EP: "Into the Light".  After finally hearing my songs produced professionally and seeing the response thereafter, I knew there was no other road for me.  I have spent many nights since this release performing with a live rocking band and as a solo acoustic act.  I have connected with some amazing people.  From groovy dive bars, dinner crowds,  house parties and clubs, I have learned that this music stuff is just not as fun without people, without you. 

"The performer and the audience are valuable to each other as long as the performer can look out and see himself and the audience can look back and see themselves"-Bruce Springsteen. 

With this attitude in mind, I am excited to team up with Indiegogo and YOU with the goal of getting this record out to hearts and minds world wide.  "Complicated Heart" is my debut full length album.  Produced by Eugene Oregon's own Tyler Fortier, this album is a tasty variety of all original songs I am very proud of.  I cant wait to share it with you.  Thank you for checking out this page and deciding to be a part of the music.  I am eager to launch this record robustly and to take a big step in my music career.  Moving forward towards more and more music and opportunities to have an impact.  Thanks again for being here.  YOU rock!

 

The funds for this campaign will be used for mixing, mastering, cd printing, online store distribution and cd promotion.  If I exceed my goal, those funds will go towards additional printing of my EP "Into the Light", enhanced web presence, merchandise creation, money to pay band, and gas money for touring.  

 

I cant thank you enough.  Do check out some of the perks in exchange for your contribution.  If you are not able to contribute, feel free to share this with others.  It all helps.  You are amazing.  

-Scott Austin

story:
WHAT IT IS:  
"The D" - the official unofficial theme song of Detroit - a record, video, and documentary of a joyous citywide singalong tribute to the Motor City and its people. Written by Detroit-born Grammy winner Allee Willis with Andrae Alexander in the same uplifting spirit as Willis' first hit, "September" by Earth, Wind & Fire, "The D" will be recorded and filmed this September, performed by thousands of Detroiters singing, playing, dancing, clapping, whistling, breathing fire, juggling hubcaps, and showing their spirit any way they can all over the city. Everyone in Detroit is invited to participate, so this is truly a "Made in Detroit" effort, creating a musical theme for the Motor City's renaissance. (Hear a demo of the song by hitting the “gallery” tab above the video on this page.)
 
WHO AM I?:
Allee Willis - Grammy, Emmy, Tony and Webby award-winning and nominated songwriter, artist, director, producer, collector, party thrower.
 
Being born in Detroit influences everything I do. I never learned how to play an instrument, but Motown guided me to write songs that have sold over 50,000,000 records - like Earth Wind & Fire's "Boogie Wonderland," the musical The Color Purple, The Pointer Sisters "Neutron Dance," and "I'll Be There For You" (the Friends theme), all known for their upbeat positivity. Spending every Saturday at my dad's scrapyard, just miles from the Big Three automakers, influenced my art, sets and graphic design. I also have a reputation as one of the best party throwers in the world, and for decades have prided myself on throwing kick-ass, large scale, musically-pumped social events.
 
WHY I'M DOING THIS:
Because I LOVE Detroit. One person's spirit can energize thousands. Music and creativity can transform a city. And the energy and success of a city can transform the world. Some hear nightmare stories about this town and may shake their heads in dismay. But time has shown that as Detroit goes, so goes the nation. Detroit is bubbling from the bottom up and "The D" celebrates the spirit that fuels the population as they pull together to build a bright future.
 
As we film and record we will also generate revenue for the local economy, working with Detroit-based artists and local businesses. In addition, all profits go to two local crown artistic jewels, The Heidleberg Project and the Mosaic Youth Theatre. 
 
WHAT YOUR COIN COVERS:
Pre-production expenses, travel, preliminary technical costs, location scouting, and research. I've already spent a lot my own money producing a demo and YouTube video of "The D" (which you can see on the “gallery” page here) so everyone can learn the song, as well as built a website and funded four trips to Detroit with my team laying groundwork.
 
WHY IS SOMEONE LIKE ME ASKING YOU FOR MONEY:
I've never asked for money before. People think I'm loaded, given that I've written so many hit songs, but I've been a self-funded artist for the past 20+ years, rarely funded by others. I've always used every dime I've made to constantly reinvent myself, much like Detroit is faced with doing now. I'm not asking this for myself, I'm asking it for Detroit. So please, pretty please, help me help the city that has kept the world rolling and bouncing to the beat all these years.
 
And please use the Indiegogo share tools to spread "The D" word!

story:
Back Story

Throughout my childhood, I've been singing. I sang in plays, skits, and choirs. When people would ask me what I wanted to be when i grew up, I always would reply, "A Star". I played my first show when I was 17 as a senior in high school. It was amazing, and I'll never forget that. I wanted to start recording so I got a loop station pedal and recorded my songs live onto that. It was very hard to do. After listening to the product of my recordings, I knew I needed something better so I bought the light version of Cubase SE and waited all night outside of Best Buy on Black Friday to get a discounted Toshiba laptop to record my music on. The quality was better than the loop station recordings but that isn't saying much. They still stunk.

One day I was watching Coyote Ugly, haha don't laugh at me, and in the movie the main actress was shopping for a laptop to record on and the sales person told her "If you want to take yourself seriously as a musician, then you need a Mac". Or something along those lines, but it hit me "I need a Mac!" So I went back to Best Buy and bought one on credit and had to make payments. I paid it off about a year later. I also found and bought a Snowball, Blu Mic on Craigslist to record with. I recorded an album using GarageBand and my recording were much better but not even close good quality. Did I mention I converted my closet into my recording booth? yea, it was a little tight..

I then figured I needed a better microphone and better pre-amp so as a gift on my 21st birthday, my parents bought me some Prosonus gear. A Prosonus mic and a Prosonus audio box, which isn't great but it's a heck of a lot better than the Snowball Mic. I recorded an album I called "Journey To Empyrean" with my new gear. The album is really great. I spent money on getting my songs copy written and putting the album on iTunes and other streaming sites. I even paid a bunch of money on having the album packaged up so I could sell them at shows and whatnot and it look professional. I am still really proud of that album.

About 4 months ago, my Mac laptop was stolen out of my car when I ran in quickly to a friends house. I can't even tell you how upset I was and still am. I lost my mac which was a major tool in becoming who I want to be. I also lost my external hard drive that had all the music I was working on, on it along with at least 100 songs I had written.

A little while after that I knew I needed another Mac, so I had to buy another one and am currently still making payments on it. My financial funds are always depleted and it puts major restraints on what I want to do. And now here I am, humbly asking people for money to help me achieve my dreams. Please help support me, I promise to make you all proud.

James Drake

What I Need

I'm trying to raise $2,000 dollars to record my first studio album. I've done the best with the equipment I have and I feel it's time for something more professional and of higher quality. 

The Impact

I completely believe that I have the potential to change the world with my music. I write with passion and conviction. I belive that music is the best therapy and can help people so much, and I want my music to reach people and help them in whatever need that they have. More than fame, I want my music to help people express what they're feeling; whether it be happiness, sadness, over coming trials , love, etc.. And I believe my music can do that. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't donate, please just share my music so that maybe somebody else can. Share it on your facebook, or twitter, your blog, etc.. That alone would help so much. 

You can find my music at my website: www.jamesdrakemusic.com

story:
About Arkansas Dogjaw and Our Goals

"One of my old bands "Certifiable" played a show with these guys some time back at "Heartbreakers" on the Landing. They blew my mind that night with their level of musicianship and technical ability! They are going to release their first album soon and tour the midwest. Here is a new promo. Check it out and spread the word! They are flying the "integrity" flag high in a world of stagnant music..." -Joe Rich - St. Louis, MO

Bio: "Arkansas Dogjaw is an indie-progressive rock power trio from Urbana, Illinois. With hauntingly sweet guitar, aggressive bass, mouth-watering drumming, and powerful vocals, they bring a fresh sound and tangible groove. What makes this band unique and exciting is the diverse musical backgrounds of the members and the way that the genres are combined to create a new, big sound." (from www.reverbnation.com/arkansasdogjaw)

 

Our goals:

  • Self produce our first album
  • Tour for 25 days from December 21st, 2012 through January 7th, 2013 around the midwest
  • Long Term: Continue making albums, get radio play, build our fan base, and tour the rest of the country and abroad.

 

A donation is not simply a donation to our band, but an investment in keeping the creative process in music alive.  Basically we are a band looking to bring something fresh to the musical table.  We are headed down the independent path so that we can remain free to explore music without being shoved into a box.  The drawback is that we don't have a large record company paying our way and promoting for us.  This makes YOU, the listener/supporter/contributor very influential in the course that this band takes.  

 

We are not slackers looking to get rich and famous through music as a way out.  We are all college educated and want to make music our life because we have a love for creativity and innovation in music.

 

 Let's get personal:

Kijoong Choi: Drummer and occasional vocalist of Arkansas Dogjaw. Plays a Yamaha Stage Custom Birch drum set with Sabian 14" HH, 14" crash, 20" ride, and Wuhan 10" splash cymbal with Vic Firth 5A nylon tip drum sticks. Grew up in Korea for 14 years, then studied in La Crosse, WI and South Bend, IN. Influences include: Bill Ward, Butch Trucks, Neil Peart, Sean Kinney, Danny Carey, Dave Grohl, Josh Freese, and any drummers regardless of their skill level. Currently studying at the University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign with BAs in Environmental Science and Chemistry and currently working as a research assistant in on-campus materials research lab.

Ryan Tarazi: Guitarist, Banjoist, and occasional vocalist of Arkansas Dogjaw.  Plays an Ibanez S Series Guitar, Ibanez Artcore Guitar, Dean 12 String Acoustic, and Goldtone 5 string Banjo.  Grew up in the St. Louis area and currently lives in Auburn, Alabama. Influences include:  Modest Mouse, Pink Floyd, Radiohead, Tool, Drive-by Truckers, Ugly Casanova, and Whiskeytown.  Graduated from U of I Urbana-Champaign with a BA in Linguistics and currently working on golf course maintenance.

Danny Rio:  Vocalist, Bassist, and occasional acoustic guitarist of Arkansas Dogjaw. Plays a 5 string Ibanez SR505 Bass and a Parkwood acoustic guitar.  Born in California, also lived in Minnesota, now lives in Plainfield, Illinois.  Influences include: Frank Zappa, Primus, Tool, Victor Wooten, Gentle Giant, Genesis, and Led Zeppelin.  Graduated from U of I Urbana-Champaign with a BS in Kinesiology and is currently studying in a Doctor of Physical Therapy program.

 

 

Let's Break it Down

Tour:

  • Dates: December 21st - January 7th
  • States: Illinois, Wisconsin, Minnesota, Iowa

Gas money:

Gas money for 2 Cars:

    • '97 Chevy Cavalier (starting in Plainfield, Illinois): 2,000mi / 24mpg X $4.00/gallon = ~$333.33
    • '05 Honda Accord (starting in Auburn, Alabama): 2,300mi / 24mpg X $4.00/gallon = ~$383.33

Hotels: (we won't need one every night)

10 nights X ~$100/night = ~$1,000

 

Food:

3 Hungry Bandmates X 14 days X $20/day = ~$840

 

Tour Total: ~$2,200

 

Album Production/Equipment Expenses:

Album Artwork: $200

Physical Albums w/Digipaks + Inserts: $1,200

Strings, Picks, Cables, Sticks, Etc.: $200

Promo (posters, flyers, advertisement): $200

 

Album/Equipment Total: ~$1,800

 

The Impact

Keep creativity and innovation in music alive and support independent music.  Independent bands like Arkansas Dogjaw need support from real people in order to share what they have to offer with the world.  Please help us get there.

 

Thank you so much!!!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We know not everybody is made of money, so if you want to help out the band in other ways (which we value just as much) please listen to our music, promote us in your town, and fan/like/follow us and hit that "Share" button on our social media pages:

http://www.reverbnation.com/arkansasdogjaw

https://www.facebook.com/arkansasdogjaw

http://www.myspace.com/arkansasdogjaw

https://twitter.com/ArkansasDogjaw

http://www.youtube.com/arkansasdogjaw

story:
For additional performance videos and MP3s, go to Media at www.tylernewberrymusic.com.

Short Summary

I have been writing songs since I was in the 6th grade. I grew up in Memphis, TN, went to school in Jackson, MS, worked in the mountains of Colorado, then moved my family to the good, ole state of Texas. All of these rootsy places have shaped every note I play. 

Even though I have been writing a long time, this will be my FIRST record with all original songs. As a musician, this is a big, scary step to take. I have been living this record for a year, and I'm plum tired of you not hearing it!

What I Need & What You Get

Here's the skinny:

  • Every penny goes to recording and reproducing this album. That's the simplest way to put it.
  • Not only do you get what, I think, are some great tunes, but along with the music come some great perks. Take a look on the right of your screen and you'll see what you have to choose from. 
  • The closer I get to the goal, the more songs you hear. Music traditionally cost money per song, not per album, so I can't stress this enough: mo' money, mo' songs.

The Impact

You are here because you love my music or because someone you know sent you here. I have devoted my life to making music and I can only pray that it has (or will) impacted you. These songs are about cancer and sin and love and the way things used to be. They are a collection of what I've been thinking about over the past few years. This album is a testimony to who I am and who I want to be.

  • I make music because I love it
  • I make music to make a difference
  • I make music for you
  • I make money to make music (not the other way around)

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help:
  • If you live in the Houston area I can give you super neat materials to pass out at school, work, and local joints where the cool kids hang.
  • Social media is our best friend. I need EVERYONE to post this link on Twitter, Facebook, Pinterest, and any other site you're apart of - (igg.me/at/tylernewberry). This is incredibly important.
story_txt:
For additional performance videos and MP3s, go to Media at www.tylernewberrymusic.com.
Short Summary
I have been writing songs since I was in the 6th grade. I grew up in Memphis, TN, went to school in Jackson, MS, worked in the mountains of Colorado, then moved my family to the good, ole state of Texas. All of these rootsy places have shaped every note I play. 
Even though I have been writing a long time, this will be my FIRST record with all original songs. As a musician, this is a big, scary step to take. I have been living this record for a year, and I'm plum tired of you not hearing it!
What I Need & What You Get
Here's the skinny:

Every penny goes to recording and reproducing this album. That's the simplest way to put it.
Not only do you get what, I think, are some great tunes, but along with the music come some great perks. Take a look on the right of your screen and you'll see what you have to choose from. 
The closer I get to the goal, the more songs you hear. Music traditionally cost money per song, not per album, so I can't stress this enough: mo' money, mo' songs.
The Impact
You are here because you love my music or because someone you know sent you here. I have devoted my life to making music and I can only pray that it has (or will) impacted you. These songs are about cancer and sin and love and the way things used to be. They are a collection of what I've been thinking about over the past few years. This album is a testimony to who I am and who I want to be.

I make music because I love it
I make music to make a difference
I make music for you
I make money to make music (not the other way around)
Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help:
If you live in the Houston area I can give you super neat materials to pass out at school, work, and local joints where the cool kids hang.
Social media is our best friend. I need EVERYONE to post this link on Twitter, Facebook, Pinterest, and any other site you're apart of - (igg.me/at/tylernewberry). This is incredibly important.

story:
Hello. I am Carl Weinschenk, the founder of The Daily Music Break.

The Daily Music Break posts great music regardless of era or genre. Leonard Bernstein and House of Pain. The Clancy Brothers and Jimi Hendrix. Miles Davis and The Lumineers. Mississippi John Hurt and Claude Debussy.

The Daily Music Break is all over the map—because that’s where the talent is. We’ve posted about 500 times since we launched a year ago.

We are asking for funds to redesign the site, increase traffic through search engine optimization and launch new music search and recommendation features. We also will develop a mobile app. We also plan to introduce  features such as podcasts and social networking.

TDMB – which can be described as a curated video site – lets people browse as they do on many sites. That's a good start, and we invite you to check out what we've done so far.

Your generosity will help us take it a step further. Today, people use iTunes, YouTube and other aggregation sites, band- or genre-specific satellite radio channels and other tools to find music they love. That’s great, of course. The downside is that the technology makes it less likely that we will stumble on to new music. 

Our goal is to help people make connections between different types of music. We want a Flogging Molly fan to find Louis Armstrong. We want a Thelonious Monk fan to find Run-DMC. We want a Lianne La Havas fan to find Sarah Vaughan. We want a Bill Monroe fan to find The North Mississippi Allstars. We want a Aaron Copland fan to find Jeff Beck.

Music is a continuum in which the lines between ages and genres are not as stark as some people imagine. The connections can be between different genres or across time -- or completely random. It's all notes and chords and harmonies and melodies. It's all connected and it's all great.

Please visit The Daily Music Break, signup up for our daily or weekly alert and, perhaps, contribute as we plan our future.

And keep listening to great music.

story:
Hello, friends! My name is David Hightower, and I love music! I play three instruments - piano, trombone, and... Guitar! Music is such an integral part of my life that I can't go without giving back to the community with my talents. But now, I need your help!

I feel that rock music is the best suited genre for me to express myself and bring joy to other people. It's a powerful form of music geared towards emotion and feeling. There's just one problem, though. My current guitar.

I love the old axe, but she's just got some limitations. For starters, she's equipped with single-coiled pickups, which aren't really too fit for hard rock and metal. I've decided on the Ibanez RG470FM as my next choice because of its sufficient supply of features for an amateur's instrument. 

Here's where I need YOUR help. I'm a teenager with no car, and no close-by business will hire someone my age to work. And I've already squeezed my folks for my first guitar and two amplifiers, so it's time that I take a step by myself. Every donation helps, really.  If I fail to reach my goal, I'll do whatever work I can to fill the deficit.

Thanks in advance, and another thanks in advance! Here's to the spread of music in today's world!
